violationpenalty except as otherwise provided any person who violates any provision of this title shall be subject to a penalty as provided in of this municipal code in addition to any penalty imposed for violation of 1 any person who causes physical damage to or destroys any public property shall be liable for the costs of replacing or repairing such property the parent of any unemancipated minor child who violates 1 may also be held liable for the cost of repairing such damaged or destroyed property in accordance with wis stats editorially amended during 2002 codification prior code  925 property offenses obstructing streets and sidewalks prohibited no person shall stand sit loaf or loiter or engage in any sport or exercise on any public street sidewalk bridge or public ground within the city in such manner as to prevent or obstruct the free passage of pedestrian or vehicular traffic thereon or to prevent or hinder free ingress to or egress from any place of business or amusement or any church public hall or meeting place 07   open cisterns wells basements or other dangerous excavations prohibited no person shall have or permit on any premises owned or occupied by him or her any open cisterns cesspools wells unused basements excavations or other dangerous openings all such places shall be filled securely covered or fastened in such manner as to prevent injury to any person  and any cover shall be of such design size and weight that the same cannot be removed by small children 08   littering prohibited no person shall throw any glass refuse waste filth or other litter upon the streets alleys highways public parks or other property of the city or upon any private property or upon the surface of any body of water within the city 11   fishing and swimming from bridges prohibited a no person shall fish jump dive or swim from any bridge located in the city which has been posted as to these restrictions b no person shall swim wade or otherwise enter the water in lake george without a watercraft at points within one hundred 100 feet of the falls st bridge and dam c the city shall cause signs to be erected and posted at such locations as the city council directs to carry out the provisions of subsections a and b of this section 19   presence of persons on roofs prohibited no person shall be on the roof of any commercial retail or manufacturing business or any public building without the express consent of the owner of the building or his or her designate 20   unauthorized presence a no student who is under suspension expulsion or other disciplinary procedures excluding him or her for attending any school located within the city or any other school district or any person not a student presently enrolled or not an employee of such schools or not a parent or guardian of a student or not an otherwise authorized person shall be present within any school building or upon any school grounds without having first secured authorization to be there from the principal or other person in charge of the school building or school grounds except while in direct route to secure such authorization b any unauthorized person who shall come upon school property and fail to secure authorization or refuses to leave upon request by the school principal or any person acting under the direction of the school principal or any police officer has committed a violation of this section c unauthorized presence shall include any vehicle that is found on school property which has not received permission to be there if the occupants or owners are not on school property for some legitimate business or activity or are parked in an area that regulates parking to certain authorized vehicles they are in violation such vehicle may be issued a city parking citation and may be towed away at the direction of the school principal or person in charge of such school building law enforcement officers may also have any vehicle towed away which because of its location creates a hazard to life or property d authorized person shall include 1 any person who is present at any school building or school grounds for the purpose previously authorized by the school or their designee  2 any person transporting a student and who utilizes the driveway specified for loading and unloading personnel  3 any person utilizing a designated area for attending an athletic or other organized or authorized school event  4 any student in good standing at that particular school  5 any person acting in the normal course of business activities 22   failure to return library material a definitions library has the same definition as lb of the wis stats library materials has the same definition as lc wis stats b no person who checks out on loan library materials or who allows another to use their library authorization to check out library materials shall fail to return any or all the materials according to the established procedure of the library 1 no person shall use provide or give false or fictitious identification or information to obtain library loan authorization or to obtain or check out any library materials c all library authorizations issued to children age seventeen 17 or younger shall require parental or legal guardian authorization any parent or guardian of a child who has given authorization for that child to check out on loan library materials shall assume coliability for any violation of this section by the child d any person violating this section and failing to return any or all of the library materials is liable to the city and subject to the following 1 replacement costs of the unreturned materials  2 suspension of their library privileges  and 3 suspension of the privilege of receiving any city license or permit e the library board is authorized to promulgate rules and regulations for library checkoutloan procedures conduct and behavior and operations of the library these rules shall be conspicuously posted for public notice at the library the rules and regulations established by the library board as posted shall be incorporated by reference into this section as fully as if set forth herein no person shall violate the posted rules or regulations of the library f any person violating this section in addition to the penalties contained in subsection d of this section shall be subject to the penalties contained in of this municipal code 24 trespassing purpose the purpose of this chapter is to enable private owners of real property situated within the city and to which the public has some implicit right of access to exclude persons from that property where the person has committed a crime on the premises or violated the properly posted rules of conduct for the property 211   definitions the following words and terms when used in this chapter shall have the following meanings unless the context clearly indicates otherwise common areas means all areas of the property which are maintained for the common use of its tenants or the general public incidental to the conduct of the normal and legitimate activities upon the premises including but not limited to parking lots and ramps private roadways reception areas rotunda waiting areas hallways restroom facilities elevators escalators and staircases covered premises means any improved real property or portion thereof to which the public has an implicit right of access including but not limited to places of worship shopping malls retail sales facilities hotels motels nursing homes restaurants multiplefamily residential buildings hospitals medical and dental offices clubs lodges office buildings banks and financial institutions transit stations athletic and recreational facilities personal service establishments theaters and day care facilities property manager means any owner of a covered premises or an agent thereof who is authorized to exercise control over the property including common areas the term property manager includes any tenant who is an owner of the property or agent of the owner and authorized to exercise control over the property including common areas tenant means any authorized occupant of a covered premises or the agent thereof trespass notice means a written notice which contains minimally the following information 1 a verbatim copy of   2 the name date of birth and address of the person to whom the notice is issued and the name of the persons custodial parent or guardian where that person is a juvenile  3 a description of the specific conduct which serves as a basis for the notices issuance  4 a description of the specific property to which the trespass notice applies  5 the period during which the trespass notice is in effect including the date of its expiration  6 the name title and telephone number of a person with authority to modify amend or rescind the trespass notice prior to its normal expiration  7 the method by which the trespass notice was served upon the person to whom it was issued  8 the written notice attached to this ordinance and incorporated herein by reference shall be deemed to have complied with this section 212   when trespass notice may be issued a property manager tenant or police officer may issue a trespass notice as provided under this chapter under the following circumstances a where there is probable cause to believe that the person has committed an act prohibited by state statute or city ordinance while on the covered premises whether on common areas or a tenants space  or b where there is probable cause to believe that the person has violated the rules of conduct for the property which have been conspicuously posted at all public entrances to the property or have been personally provided to the person in writing by the property manager or tenant 213   prohibited conduct a no person shall trespass in or upon any private property and without claim of right refuse to depart therefrom on demand of the property manager tenant or police officer b no person who has been served with a trespass notice in conformity with this chapter shall enter the premises described therein during its effective period without the written permission of the issuing property manager or tenant or the authorized agent thereof named in the notice violation of the terms of the notice is a violation of this chapter c no person shall enter any area of private property in violation of conspicuously posted signs prohibiting or restricting access thereto including but not limited to the following signs no trespassing authorized personnel only private employees only emergency exit only 214   additional provisions a where a trespass notice is issued by a tenant who is not the property manager the notice is effective only as to that portion of the premises over which the tenant is entitled to exercise control b no trespass notice shall be effective for more than one year from the date of its original issuance c all trespass notices issued pursuant to this section must be properly served upon the person named therein as follows 1 personal service documented by either a receipt trespass notice signed by the person to whom it was issued a written statement by the issuer or documentation by a police officer in the official police report or by certified mail to the individual named in the notice  or if the person named in the notice is under age eighteen 18 to the parent guardian or underage person 2 where the person named in the trespass notice is arrested by a police officer for an act prohibited by state statute or city ordinance the arresting officer may personally serve the notice on behalf of the property manager or tenant and so document that fact in the officers official police report detailing the incident 215   other forms of trespass prohibited in addition to the regulations encompassed by of this chapter the following shall constitute trespass a no person shall enter into sleep or take temporary habitation or remain in any privately owned building without first receiving the express or implied permission of a tenant lawfully renting the premises or the property owner or designee if private property and the property is not currently leased or rented b exceptions the following acts shall constitute exceptions to the prohibitions of this chapter 1 this section shall not prohibit any person from participating in lawful conduct in labor disputes pursuant to  10353 wis stats 2 this section shall not apply to law enforcement officers emergency personnel or other personnel acting in an official capacity or as part of their employment who enter upon property for purposes attending to performance of their official duties or in the course of emergencies  curfew   hours of curfew a no child under the age of sixteen 16 shall loiter idle be upon or remain on any street or other public place whether on foot or in any means of conveyance being driven or parked in the city between the hours of eleven pm and five am any day except friday when curfew hours are extended until twelve midnight nor shall such a child loiter in be in or remain in a place of amusement or entertainment during the prohibited hours b no person operating a place of amusement or entertainment within the city or any agent servant or employee of such person shall permit a child under the age of sixteen 16 years to enter or loiter in such place of amusement or entertainment in violation of the curfew hours of this chapter unless such child is accompanied by his or her parent guardian or other adult person having legal custody of such child c it shall be a defense to a violation of subsection a or b of this section that the child is engaged in prohibited conduct while 1 accompanied by his or her parent guardian or other person having his or her legal custody  2 participating in going to or returning from a gainful employment b a school sanctioned activity c a religious event d an errand or some other function at the direction of the minors parent or guardian without any detour or stop e an emergency involving the protection of a person or property from an imminent threat of serious bodily harm or substantial damage f an activity involving the exercise by the child of his or her rights protected under the 1st amendment to the united states constitution or  and 4 of the wisconsin constitution or both and the right of assembly g an activity conducted by a nonprofit or governmental entity that provides recreation education training or other care under the supervision of one or more adults h interstate travel to or from locations outside of the city of river falls or i an exception granted by resolution of the common council for a specific event or activity 3 on property owned leased or otherwise controlled by his or her parent guardian or legal custodian  4 on property owned leased or otherwise controlled by persons other than the childs parent guardian or legal custodian with the permission of his or her parent guardian or legal custodian but not including public places or places of amusement or entertainment c with respect to activities involving the exercise by a child of his or her rights protected under the 1st amendment to the united states constitution or  and 4 of the wisconsin constitution at the time he or she is confronted with an alleged violation of this chapter as is commanded undersubsection b2e of this section such a child shall not be taken into custody or charged with a violation of this chapter additionally however under circumstances in which a reasonable law enforcement officer charged with enforcing this chapter should develop a perception that a child confronted with an alleged violation of this chapter had been engaged in an exercise of those protected rights prior to being confronted or intended thereafter to engage in an exercise of those protected rights before such child may be taken into custody or charged with a violation of this chapter the law enforcement officer shall perform an investigation to determine whether or not that child had been engaged in prior to being confronted or was enroute at that time to engage in an exercise of 1st amendment rights under the united states constitution or an exercise of rights under  and 4 of the wisconsin constitution  part   definitions for purposes of this chapter the following definitions shall be applied emergency means an unforeseen combination of circumstances or the resulting state that calls for immediate action the term includes but is not limited to a fire a natural disaster or automobile accident or any situation requiring immediate action to prevent serious bodily injury or loss of life legal custodian shall have the meaning set forth at 480211 wis stats loiter means to congregate idly with others linger wander stand delay walk or stroll about aimlessly or to remain idle in essentially one location in a manner and under circumstances manifesting an unnecessary or aimless purpose place of amusement or entertainment shall include but not be limited to arcades pool parlors video game parlors bowling alleys fairs or youth centers public place shall include but not be limited to any park school school ground vacant lot parking lot sidewalk pedestrian bridge or other property generally open to the public owned operated or maintained by the city a county a school district or other governmental entity both with respect to buildings and open spaces street shall include any public way thoroughfare or bridges upon the same whether operated and maintained by the city or another governmental entity  part   parental violation no parent guardian or other legal custodian of a child under the age of sixteen 16 years shall permit such child to engage in acts prohibited under this chapter subject only to the defenses set forth thereunder  part   general penalty a any parent guardian legal custodian or person who operates a place of amusement or entertainment and who violates b or be subject to the penalty prescribed at ch 120 of this code b any child who violates this chapter shall after being detained and released be dealt with under chapters 48 and 938 wis stats as the circumstances dictate  part weapons discharge of firearms no person shall discharge any firearm within the city except law enforcement officers or other agents or employees of the city as authorized by the chief of police the council may authorize additional exceptions by resolution for organized gun clubs to engage in target practice  and for special events eg parades funerals and american legion activities on public property provided no projectiles are associated with the discharge  prior code  902   reserved editors note  1 adopted  repealed   which pertained to airguns and slingshots and derived from prior code  903 and adopted    carrying concealed knives prohibited no person shall carry or wear concealed about his or her person any bowie knife dirk knife dagger or other device commonly known as a surth knife spring blade knife or push button knife 04 truancy statutory authority this chapter regulating truancy in the city of river falls is adopted pursuant to the authority of wsa part   definitions the following terms shall have the following meanings when used in this chapter habitual truant means a pupil who is absent from school without an acceptable excuse under wsa 164 for part or all of five days or more on which school is held during a school semester truant means a pupil who is absent from school without an acceptable excuse under wsa 164 for part or all of any day on which school is held during a school semester part   prohibitionsdispositionstruants no person shall be a truant any truant seventeen 17 years of age or younger shall be subject to the following dispositions the court may impose either or both dispositions a an order for the person to attend school b a forfeiture of not more than fifty dollars $5000 plus costs for a first violation or a forfeiture of not more than one hundred dollars $10000 plus costs for any second or subsequent violation committed within twelve 12 months of a previous violation subject to wis stats and subject to a maximum cumulative forfeiture amount of not more than five hundred dollars $50000 for all violations committed during a school semester all or part of the forfeiture plus costs may be assessed against the person the parents or guardian of the person or both part   prohibitiondispositionshabitual truants no person shall be a habitual truant any habitual truant seventeen 17 years of age or younger shall be subject to the following dispositions the court may impose any or all dispositions a suspension of the persons operating privileges for a period of not less than thirty 30 days nor more than one year the court shall immediately take possession of any suspended license and shall forward it to the department of transportation together with a notice stating the reason for and the duration of the suspension b an order for the person to participate in counseling or a supervised work program or other community service work as described in 5g wis stats the court may also order the persons parent guardian or legal custodian to participate in counseling at the parents guardians or legal custodians own expense or to attend school with the person or both c an order for the person to remain at home except during hours in which the person is attending religious worship or a school program including travel time required to get to and from the school program or place of worship the order may permit a person to leave his or her home if the person is accompanied by a parent or guardian d an order for the person to attend an educational program under 7d wis stats e a forfeiture of not more than five hundred dollars $50000 plus costs subject to all or part of the forfeiture plus costs may be assessed against the person the parents or guardian of the person or both f an order for the person to attend school g an order to revoke a work permit 2e wis stats h an order to be placed in a teen court program 2f wis stats i an order placing the person under formal or informal supervision for up to one year 2j wis stats j any other reasonable conditions consistent with 2 wis stats including a curfew restrictions as to going to or remaining on specified premises and restrictions on associating with other children or adults part   contributing to truancy a except as provided in subsection b of this section no person seventeen 17 years of age or older shall by act or omission knowingly encourage or contribute to the truancy of a person subject to school attendance laws b of this section does not apply to a person who has under his or her control a child who has been sanctioned under wis stat 1h c an act or omission contributes to a truancy of a child whether or not the child is adjudged to be in need of protection or services if the natural and probable consequences of that act or omission would be to cause the child to be truant part miscellaneous offenses reserved editors note  2 adopted  repealed   which pertained to traps and derived from prior code  905   sale and discharge of fireworks restricted a subject to subsection b of this section wis stats regulating the sale and use of fireworks exclusive of any penalty imposed thereby is adopted by reference and made a part of this chapter as though set forth in full b in accord with 5b wis stats which authorizes cities to adopt regulations of fireworks which are more restrictive than is the statute the city declares that it is illegal for any person acting as a wholesaler to possess and sell at wholesale any fireworks within the city limits for the purposes of this subsection wholesaler means any person who is engaged in the sale of goods or commodities in quantity for resale as defined the term wholesaler includes any person who sells fireworks to persons outside of this state  prior code  906   abandoned or unattended refrigerators prohibited no person shall leave or permit to remain outside of any dwelling building or other structure or within any unoccupied or abandoned building dwelling or other structure under his or her control in a place accessible to children any abandoned unattended or discarded ice box refrigerator or other container which has an airtight door or lid snap lock or other locking device which may not be released from the inside unless such door or lid snap lock or other locking device has been removed from such ice box refrigerator or container or unless such container is displayed for sale on the premises of the owner or his or her agent and is securely locked or fastened 12   possession and consumption of liquor and beer restricted a possession outside taverns or picnic areas prohibited no person shall consume possess or carry about an open container of intoxicating liquor or fermented malt beverage outside a licensed tavern or off the premises of an established picnic area where such possession and consumption is not prohibited b intoxicants in vehicles no person shall consume possess or have under his or her control any open container of intoxicating liquor or fermented malt beverage while in a vehicle whether parked or moving on any public thoroughfare or public parking lot c exceptions this section shall not apply to any person on private property with the permission of the owner or occupant of the property the city council by resolution may authorize an exception to the section such exception shall be specific as to occasion location and length of time 17   fighting events prohibited no person shall sponsor sanction condone or permit to be held or carried out on any real estate under his or her ownership or control any mixed martial arts fighting event or any amateur wrestling or amateur boxing events except for those amateur wrestling events sanctioned by usa wrestling or amateur boxing events sanctioned by usa boxing this limitation on the holding of fighting events shall apply whether or not admission is charged to the public for attendance at the same this section shall not apply to curricular or extracurricular athletic events held or sponsored by secondary schools or universities   12142010 title 10  vehicles and traffic chapters traffic control regulations adopted state traffic laws adopted a the city hereby adopts all relevant provisions of chs 340 of the wis stats that pertain to traffic motor vehicle and such provisions where not a criminal offense are so adopted and made a part of this section by reference b any amendments creations or supplementation of chs 340 of the wisconsin statutes shall serve to so modify and amend this section     prior code  701   motor vehicles on public and private property a definitions 1 motor vehicle means any vehicle which is selfpropelled 2 public property includes all lands owned by the city or by any other public agency within the city limits including schools parks playgrounds and golf courses 3 private property includes all land within the city limits not publicly owned b prohibited operation 1 public property no person shall use operate or park any motor vehicle or device towable by a motor vehicle on public property in the city except a upon streets highways alleys parking lots or trails designated as such for the purpose of vehicular travel or parking  or b upon any land designated by the city for vehicular use for special events or programs as recommended by the park and recreation board 2 private property no person shall operate any motor vehicle on private property within the city without the express or implied consent of the owner or occupant of such property c vehicles to be towed away the city may tow away by its employees or any other person any motor vehicle or device towable by a motor vehicle found upon public property in violation of this section any such vehicle or device shall be impounded and the procedures herein set forth shall be employed d procedure for impoundment 1 notification to owner upon the impounding of any motor vehicle or device towable by a motor vehicle hereunder the chief of police shall immediately make reasonable effort to ascertain the name and address of the person owning such vehicle or device and advise the owner by letter that such vehicle or device has been impounded such letter shall a give the general description of the vehicle or device and the license number thereon if any  b give the approximate time of the removal and reason therefor and the place where such vehicle or device is stored  c state the towing charge and the daily storage charge and advise the owner that such charges must be paid prior to the release of the vehicle or device  d advise the owner that such vehicle or device shall not be released to him or her without reasonably satisfactory evidence that he or she is in fact the owner of such vehicle or device 2 deposit of funds any employee receiving any money for the release of an impounded vehicle or device shall deliver such money to the city treasurer within twentyfour 24 hours of receipt thereof together with a statement identifying the released vehicle and the amount of money collected 09   use of flashing red lights by school buses a school bus operators shall use flashing red lights in residential or business districts when pupils or other authorized passengers are to be loaded or unloaded b school bus operators shall be allowed to load and unload pupils or other authorized passengers in residential or business districts only at locations at which there are no traffic signals and only where a sidewalk or curb are laid on both sides of the road 13   engine braking prohibited no operator of any vehicle or truck shall employ the use of an engine braking system which utilizes engine exhaust to slow the vehicle commonly referred to as compression braking engine braking or jake braking except in the case of an emergency emergency service vehicles are exempt from this provision violations shall be enforced by means of the city citation procedure under of this code and the deposit for such violation which is approved of separately by the common council    prohibiting riding in the cargo bed of pickup trucks a no driver of a motor truck with a cargo area shall permit a passenger to ride in the cargo area of a motor truck while the vehicle is in motion unless in a seated position within the cargo area specifically prohibited are persons who are standing seated on the bed rail or seated on the open or closed tailgate of such a truck b this section shall not apply to low speed travel while participating in a parade sanctioned by the city council  5102011 administration and enforcement official traffic control map a the official traffic control map shall be as represented on the document titled official traffic control map   the original version will be kept in the engineering department hard copies of the official traffic control map will be made available in the police department and municipal court to the extent that this section is at variance from or conflicts with prior ordinances pertaining to the subject matter of this section this section shall control and previous ordinances in conflict herewith shall be deemed to be amended or when appropriate repealed by this section b erection of signs and changes the street superintendent shall cause to be erected such traffic control signs and marking changes as are necessary to give adequate notice of the restrictions prohibitions and limitations as shown on the official traffic control map c violation prohibited a violation of any properly noticed restriction prohibition or limitation shown on the official traffic control map shall be a violation of the provisions of this municipal code   prior code  7072   official signs and markers a chief of police responsible the chief of police shall procure erect and maintain appropriate standard parking and traffic signs signals and markings conforming to the rules of the state department of transportation giving notice of the provisions of this title as required by state law signs shall be erected in such locations and in such manner as the chief determines shall best effect the purposes of this title to give adequate warning to users of the streets and highways and parking areas b prohibited signs and markers in highways no person other than the chief of police or his or her designee shall place within the limits of any street or highway maintained by the city any sign signal marker mark or monument unless permission is first obtained from either the chief of police or wisconsin state department of transportation any sign signal marker mark or monument placed or maintained in violation of this subsection shall be subject to removal as provided in subsection c of this section c removal of unofficial signs markers signals and traffic control devices the chief of police shall have the authority granted by wis stats to remove any sign signal marking or other device which is placed maintained or displayed in violation of this title or state law cost for removal of a prohibited or illegal sign signal marking or device shall be reported for review and certification to the city council it shall be charged against the premises from which removed any charge not paid on or before the next succeeding november 15th shall be placed upon the tax roll for collection as other special municipal taxes d the chief or police or his her designee has the authority to erect and establish temporary traffic control restrictions prohibitions or limitations in accordance with this section for the purpose of highway maintenanceconstruction snow removal efficient facilitation of pedestrian and vehicular traffic or in the interest of public safety these restrictions prohibitions or limitations are in effect and enforceable for a period up to sixty 60 days without official council action   prior code  708   appointment of volunteer adult school crossing guards a the police department shall be empowered to appoint from time to time volunteer adult school crossing guards for the protection of persons who are crossing a highway in the vicinity of a school the tenure of the volunteer adult school crossing guards and other terms and conditions of employment shall be set by the police department at the time of such appointment b all volunteer adult school crossing guards who are appointed pursuant to this section shall wear insignia or uniform which designate them as school crossing guards and shall be equipped with signals or signs to direct traffic to a stop at school crossings 11   violationpenalty the penalty for violation of any provision of this title shall be a forfeiture and penalty assessment if required by wis stats a jail assessment if required by 1 wis stats plus any applicable fees prescribed in ch 814 wis stats a state forfeiture statutes any forfeiture for violation of chs 340 of the wisconsin statutes adopted by reference in conform to the forfeiture permitted to be imposed for violation of such statutes including any variations or increases for subsequent offenses b local regulations except as otherwise provided in this chapter the penalty for violation of   shall be as provided in of this municipal code c citations shall be subject to a schedule of deposits which shall be revised by the municipal court judge from time to time and as revised approved of by the common council by motion or resolution d lien and disposal for towed vehicles 1 whenever a motor vehicle is ordered to be towed by a police officer of the city in the enforcement of the provisions of the federal state or this municipal code or in the exercise of the police power in furtherance of the public safety health or welfare the city shall have a lien on the vehicle for all reasonable towing charges incurred by the police department in ordering the tow 2 the vehicle that has been ordered towed unless otherwise needed for evidentiary purposes shall be released to the owner or their designee upon the payment to the police department of the towing fee 3 any vehicles that are not claimed by the owner shall be disposed of in accordance with of this municipal code  part 18  prior code  715   enforcement a enforcement procedure this title shall be enforced according to 11 to 34561 35017 and ch 800 wis stats b deposit 1 any person arrested for a violation of this title may make a deposit of money as directed by the arresting officer at the police station or at the office of the clerk of court or by mailing the deposit to such places the arresting officer or the person receiving the deposit shall notify the arrested person orally or in writing that a if the person makes a deposit for a violation of a traffic regulation the person need not appear in court at the time fixed in the citation and the person will be deemed to have tendered plea of no contest and submitted to a forfeiture and penalty assessment if required by wis stats a jail assessment if required by 1 wis stats plus any applicable fees prescribed in ch 814 wis stats not to exceed the amount of the deposit that the court may accept as provided in wis stats  b if the person fails to make a deposit for a violation of traffic regulation or appear in court at the time fixed in the citation the court may enter a default judgment finding the person guilty of the offense or issue a warrant for his or her arrest 2 the amount of the deposit shall be determined in accordance with the deposit schedule established by the wisconsin judicial conference and shall include the penalty assessment established under wis stats a jail assessment if required by 1 wis stats and court costs if a deposit schedule has not been established the arresting officer shall require the alleged offender to deposit the forfeiture established by the chief of police which shall include the penalty assessment established under wis stats deposits for nonmoving violations shall not include the penalty assessment 3 the arresting officer or the person receiving the deposit shall issue the arrested person a receipt therefor as required by 3b wis stats c petition to reopen judgment whenever a person has been convicted in this state on the basis of a forfeiture of deposit or a plea of guilty or no contest and the person was not informed as required under 1 and 2 wis stats the person may within sixty 60 days after being notified of the revocation or suspension of the operating privilege petition the court to reopen the judgment and grant him an opportunity to defend on merits if the court finds that the petitioner was not informed as required under 1 and 2 the court shall order the judgment reopened the court order reopening the judgment automatically reinstates the revoked or suspended operating privilege amended during supplement #1   part  prior code  716 parking generally reserved parking a reserved parking the parking premises adjacent to the north side of the city hall is designated as a reserved parking area for the city officers and employees no person shall park a vehicle within the designated parking stalls except as authorized by the city b marking the street department shall have such stalls appropriately marked and maintained 05   overnight parking a oddeven parking 1 there shall be oddeven parking on all city streets from november 1st to march 31st of each year between the hours of one am and six am unless other no parking regulations are in effect streets that are subject to a ban on parking during specific times andor days shall remain subject to this oddeven regulation when the more specific parking prohibition is not in effect 2 oddeven parking means vehicles will be parked on the odd side of a street designated by property addresses on odd days of the month and on the even side of the street on even days of the month b snow emergency requirements 1 a snow emergency shall be in effect when declared upon public notice by the superintendent of public works and will remain in effect until cancelled 2 when a snow emergency is in effect a vehicle may be towed when it is in violation of the parking regulations prohibiting parking any time between the hours of one am and six am 3 signs and warning markers the superintendent of public works shall erect such signs and warning markers necessary to give notice of the restrictions prohibitions and limitations of this subsection and as are shown on the official parking control map   part  prior code  706   official parking control maps a the official parking control map shall be as represented on the document titled official parking control map   the original version will be kept in the engineering department hard copies of the official parking control map will be made available in the police department and municipal court to the extent that this section is at variance from or conflicts with prior ordinances pertaining to the subject matter of this section this section shall control and previous ordinances in conflict herewith shall be deemed to be amended or when appropriate repealed by this section b erection of signs and changes the street superintendent shall cause to be erected such parking signs and marking changes as are necessary to give adequate notice of the restrictions prohibitions and limitations as shown on the official parking control map c violation prohibited a violation of any properly noticed restriction prohibition or limitation shown on the official parking control map shall be a violation of the provisions of this municipal code d towing of parked vehicles any vehicle parked in violation of statutory provisions or contrary to the restrictions prohibitions and limitations of this section and the municipal generally may be towed additionally vehicles may be towed as deemed to be necessary for snow removal highway maintenanceconstruction or in the interest of public safety including but not limited to situations in which the parked vehicle is blocking traffic or otherwise creating an emergency the police department shall facilitate towing under this section 2 beyond the circumstances described under subsection e1 of this section as justifying the towing of vehicles a parked vehicle may be ordered to be towed by the police department if its owner has received at least three parking or moving vehicle violations in the city which as of the date in question remain unpaid and uncontested upon the issuance of the third violation a notice shall be mailed to the owners last known address advising the owner that if he or she fails to pay the outstanding forfeitures within ten 10 days in the event that another violation occurs his or her vehicle shall be subject to being towed under this subsection if found parked at any location in the city in the event that a vehicle is towed under this paragraph the following procedure shall be applied a immediate notice of the fact of a towing shall be mailed to the vehicle owners last known address together with a copy of the citation for violation of this section the notice shall inform the owner of the following rights 1 the right to an immediate hearing to be held within two business days of his or her receipt of the notice to determine the validity of the tow the hearing shall be held by the municipal court clerk the sole issue at the hearing shall be whether or not the owner has three outstanding violations 2 upon payment of security in the form of a bond the amount of which shall be established under authority granted hereby to the chief of police and which shall be equivalent to the total amount of the unpaid forfeitures outstanding against the motor vehicle in question and towing charges listed in the citation the right to reobtain possession of the vehicle 3 pursuant to the citation the right to defend the citation in the manner prescribed by wisconsin law and the municipal ordinances e the chief of police or his or her designee has the authority to erect and establish temporary parking restrictions prohibitions or limitations in accordance with this code for the purpose of highway maintenanceconstruction snow removal efficient facilitation of pedestrian and vehicular traffic or in the interest of public safety these restrictions prohibitions or limitations are in effect and enforceable for a period up to sixty 60 days without official council action    4    part prior code  7071   temporary handicapped parking permits a permit to be issued the chief of police or his or her authorized officer shall issue to an applicant a temporary handicapped parking permit to any individual who is temporarily physically disabled by any physical condition which renders the person unable to walk or unable to walk without great difficulty b application any person applying for a temporary handicapped parking permit shall submit to the chief of police or his or her authorized officer an application consisting of 1 applicants name  2 applicants address  3 a statement of a licensed physician stating a a description of the disability including a statement that the applicant is unable to walk or is unable to walk without great difficulty b the duration of the temporary disability c the physicians name address and signature d the date of the physicians statement c contents of parking card upon compliance with subsection b of this section the chief of police or his authorized officer shall issue a temporary handicapped parking card on an eight inch by two and three quarter inch paper stating 1 the name and address of applicant  2 card number  3 the date of issue and the date of expiration  4 an indication that the card is an original  5 the words physically disabled parking privileges at the top of the card d display and effect the card shall be prominently displayed on the left sun visor left dashboard or the left front windshield of the vehicle the effect of the card shall allow the temporarily handicapped person to park in all designated handicapped parking stalls in the city during its period of validity e fee there shall be no fee 18 public property while the motor is running or the starting key is in the ignition b operation on sidewalks and paved trails no person shall operate a snowmobile on any sidewalk paved trail pedestrian way or upon the area outside of the curb lines of a street within the city unless for the purpose of crossing to obtain immediate access to an authorized area of operation c operation on icebound waters no person shall operate or ride upon a snowmobile on lake george lake louise or the kinnickinnic river within the city at any time or place d operation near hospitals no person shall operate a snowmobile within three hundred 300 feet of hospitals and nursing homes e operation in park or other city property no person shall operate a snowmobile within any park or other land owned by the city of river falls 107  111009   reserved editors note  1 adopted  repealed   which pertained to snowmobile renters licensed and derived from prior code  7108 neighborhood electric vehicles definitions neighborhood electric vehicle nev means a selfpropelled electric motor vehicle meeting the definition of 36r wis stats which is registered and licensed by the wisconsin department of transportation a slowmoving vehicle sign is not required  part  part   use of nev a person may operate an nev on any roadway within the municipal boundaries of the city of river falls that has a speed limit of thirtyfive 35 miles per hour or less subject to the following restrictions a the person operating the nev must hold a valid wisconsin operators license or a valid operators license from another state b the person operating the nev must obey all state and local traffic regulations not inconsistent with this chapter c operation of nevs shall be prohibited on or across the following streets 1 south main street sth 2935 south of east johnson street except that crossings shall be permitted at cemetery road  2 north main street north of paulson road d the city shall create and the city clerk shall at all times maintain a map highlighting those roadways within the city limits on which nev use is permitted  part  part   enforcement use of an nev within the city limits which is contrary to or not in compliance with this chapter shall be subject to the assessment of a forfeiture for each violation plus court costs as outlined in the approved municipal court bond schedule in addition the operation of an nev within the city limits in a manner contrary to city ordinance or state law regulating the use of streets or highways by motor vehicles shall be subject to such sanctions as are provided thereunder  part  part title 12  streets sidewalks other public places and property use impacts chapters streets and sidewalks generally standards and specifications a establishment the city engineer may from time to time establish standards and specifications for work to be done on or over the public rightofway the grades of all streets alleys and sidewalks shall be established and described by the city engineer and recorded in his or her office the council may grant variances from the standard by a majority vote of the whole council subject to concurrence by the city engineer that the variance would not negatively affect the public welfare or the safeguarding of life health or property and does not run contrary to any code or specification published by the state of wisconsin b required no street alley or sidewalk shall be worked until the grade thereof is established c altering prohibited no person shall alter the grade of any street alley sidewalk or public ground on any part thereof unless authorized or instructed to do so by the city engineer   prior code  801   safety standards for sidewalk openings a all service openings in sidewalks when not in use by the person for whose benefit the same have been installed or maintained shall be protected by a cover so as to allow pedestrian traffic to safely walk on and over it such protective cover shall be level with the sidewalk of nonslippery smooth surface and shall be so fastened as not to expose the opening without an intentional effort being made to do so b the service openings in sidewalks when exposed shall have protective devices designed and adequate to prevent pedestrian traffic from falling into or tripping over such openings such protective devices shall not interfere with normal pedestrian traffic along such sidewalk except across such opening and shall be so designed as to be clearly visible and to restrict but not be a hazard to pedestrian traffic over or across such openings c the owner and occupant of the premises designed to be served by such sidewalk openings shall be jointly responsible for complying with the provisions of subsections a and b of this section d no person shall serve any premises sidewalk openings unless the provisions of subsection b of this section are complied with at the time of such service 03   snow and ice removal a sidewalks to be kept clear the owner or occupant of any lot or parcel shall within twentyfour 24 hours of cessation of each continuous period of snowfall remove all snow and ice which may have fallen or accumulated upon the sidewalk in front of such lot or parcel provided when ice or packed snow has so formed that it cannot be removed the owner or occupant shall keep the same sprinkled with a nonskid material which will prevent the sidewalk from being dangerous to pedestrians this requirement shall also apply to the main sidewalk as it extends from a corner lot to the curbline of an intersecting street b deposits of snow restricted excepting the clearing of snow from sidewalks or entries located upon a public rightofway no person shall cause snow to be deposited on boulevards sidewalks streets or avenues or any other city owned property without permission therefore from the city payment of a fee sufficient to reimburse the city for the cost of removing any snow so deposited without permission may be required c depositing of snow on private property all snow from private property driveways or parking lots shall be either deposited on the originating owners property or hauled away by the owner on their agent property owners shall not place their snow on other property without permission from the owner of the other property d abatement 1 if the provisions of this chapter are not complied with the city or designee shall serve written notice once per calendar year upon the owner lessee or occupant or any person having care or control of any such lot or land to comply with the provisions of this chapter 2 if the person upon whom the notice is served fails neglects or refuses to shovel within twentyfour 24 hours of date of such notice or if no person can be found in the city who either is or claims to be the owner of such lot or land or who represents or claims to represent such owner the city shall cause such snow to be removed 3 the cost of such removal and other costs associated with it at the discretion of the city shall be billed to the property owner and payable to the city within thirty 30 days costs shall be invoiced per the citys current fee schedule 4 failure to pay the city for the services billed will result in the costs being assessed against the property as a special charge per 04  392010   1 2 6262018   official map a intent it is the intent of the common council to establish an official map for the purpose of conserving and promoting the public health safety convenience economy orderliness and general welfare of the community  to further the orderly layout in the use of land  to stabilize the location of real property boundary lines to insure proper legal description and proper monumenting of land  to facilitate adequate provision for transportation parks playgrounds and stormwater drainage  and to facilitate the further subdivision of larger tracts into smaller parcels of land b authority the ordinance codified in this chapter is enacted under the authority granted by 6 wis stats c definitions the following definitions shall control the interpretation and application of this section 1 boundaries means the corporate limits of the city 2 city means the city of river falls 3 parkway means and includes any rightofway for vehicular or pedestrian traffic or both with full or partial control of access and usually located within a park or a ribbon of parklike development such parkway may include land area which is required for stormwater drainage purposes where the drainage improvement is to include parklike treatment and where pedestrian vehicular travel may be permitted 4 subdivision plat means and includes certified survey maps 5 waterway means and includes rivers streams creeks ditches drainage channels watercourses lakes bays ponds impoundment reservoirs retention and detention basins marshes and other surface water areas regardless of whether the areas are natural or artificial d jurisdictioneffect 1 the official map is hereby established for the city together with those parts of the towns of clifton kinnickinnic river falls and troy as are described and referenced on the official map in accord with 6e wis stats the street highway waterway and parkway system may be shown on the official map as extending beyond the boundaries of the city to a distance not greater than that which is within the approval jurisdiction of the city for subdivision plats in accord with 1b2 wis stats all notations references and other information shown on the official map shall be as much a part of this chapter as if fully set forth herein 2 the official map shall show the location and width of streets highways waterways parkways parks and playgrounds which have been laid out adopted and established by law as well as the location of width and exterior lines of planned new streets highways waterways parkways parks and playgrounds 3 the official map shall be deemed to be conclusive with respect to the location and width of streets and highways waterways and parkways and the location and extent of parks and playgrounds shown on the map e extraterritorial areas as set forth in 6d wis stats the street highway waterway and parkway systems shown on the official map may be shown as extending beyond the boundaries of the city into its extraterritorial subdivision approval jurisdiction f amendments 1 the common council may amend the official map of the city from time to time so as to establish the exterior lines of the planned new streets highways waterways and parkways parks or playgrounds  or to widen narrow extend or close existing streets highways waterways and parkways parks or playgrounds when adopted amendments become a part of the official map and are conclusive with respect to location and width of the streets highways waterways and parkways and the location and extent of parks and playgrounds shown thereon 2 the common council shall refer any proposed amendment to the official map to the plan commission for review and report thereon prior to adoption the plan commission shall report its recommendation to the common council within sixty 60 days in the event the plan commission does not make its report within sixty 60 days of such reference it forfeits the right to further suspend action 3 a public hearing before the common council of parties in interest and citizens shall be required before any amendments to the official map as defined in 6 wis stats are effective notice of the time place and purpose of such hearing shall be given by publication as a class 2 notice under ch 985 wis stats in the official city newspaper 4 the locating widening or closing of or the approval of the locating widening or closing of streets highways waterways and parkways parks or playgrounds by the city under provisions of law other than this section shall be deemed to amend the official map and are subject to 6 wis stats except that changes or additions made by a subdivision plat approved by the city under do not require the public hearing specified in 6c if the changes or additions do not affect any land outside the plat area g building permits 1 no permit may be issued for any building within the limits of any street highway waterway or parkway shown or laid out on the map except as provided in this section 2 any person desiring to construct a building within the limits of a street highway waterway or parkway shown on the official map within the city may apply to the planning department for a building permit any person desiring to construct a building within the limits of a street highway or parkway extending beyond the city boundaries may also apply to the planning department of the city for a building permit unless an application is made and the building permit granted or not denied within thirty 30 days the person is not entitled to compensation for damage to the building in the course of such construction 3 the applicant for such a permit shall submit with his application an accurate plat plan certified by a qualified surveyor showing the location of the proposed building with reference to any street highway waterway parkway or park or playground shown on the official map 4 no permit for the erection of any building may be issued unless the street highway or parkway giving access to such proposed building has been duly placed on the official map for purposes of this section a street highway or parkway shall be considered duly placed on the official map at the time that the governing body accepts such street highway or parkway h municipal improvements no public sewer or other municipal street utility or improvement shall be constructed in any street highway or parkway until such street highway or parkway is duly placed on the official streethighway map for purposes of this section a street highway or parkway shall be considered duly placed on the official map at the time that the governing body accepts such street highway or parkway i appeals 1 the zoning board of appeals of the city may review any administrative decision of the planning department denying a permit for the erection of a building under this chapter and may grant conditionally grant or refuse a permit by the vote of a majority of its members in the manner provided for under 6d g wis stats 2 in taking action authorized in this subsection the board of appeals shall follow the procedure set forth in 6f wis stats j certified copy of map 1 a certified copy of the official map shall be kept in the office of the city engineer and shall be available for inspection by any interested person during regular office hours it shall bear on its face a certification that it is a true copy of the official map described in the ordinance and shall show the date of adoption of the ordinance codified in this chapter and shall be signed by the mayor and countersigned by the city clerk thereafter every amendment of the official map shall be indicated on the aforesaid certified copy of the official map and a certificate placed thereon or attached thereto bearing the number or date of adoption of the amendment the certificate shall be signed by the mayor and countersigned by the city clerk for purposes of this section plats and certified survey maps do not require certification when being placed on the official map 2 a certified copy of the official map and amendments thereto affecting the towns of troy kinnickinnic river falls and clifton shall be sent to the town clerks of the appropriate towns and the st croix and pierce county zoning administrators k filing with register of deeds upon adoption of the official map the city clerk shall immediately file with the st croix county and pierce county register of deeds a certificate showing that the city has established such official map l effect of placement upon the official map the placing of any street highway waterwayparkway park or playground line or lines upon the official map does not constitute the opening or establishment of any street waterwayparkway park or playground of the taking or acceptance of any land for these purposes m enforcement it shall be the duty of the planning department to enforce the provisions of this chapter n penalties any person firm or corporation who fails to comply with the provisions of this chapter shall upon conviction thereof forfeit not more then two hundred dollars $20000 and not less than fifty dollars $5000 and cost of prosecution for each violation o severability if any section or part of this chapter is adjudged unconstitutional or invalid by any court of competent jurisdiction the remainder of this chapter shall not be affected thereby    residential parking permit system   purpose it is declared necessary in the interest of the residents of the city to establish a residential parking permit system in accord with 1g wis stats whereunder motor vehicles bearing a valid residential parking permit may be parked on city streets in excess of the time limits on specifically designated streets within a specified zone or zones the reason in support of this chapter is that there exists in the city at this time an excess of commuter parking on city streets which limits or prevents residents of neighborhoods from parking their own motor vehicles on the streets adjoining their places of residence it is the intent of this chapter to provide greater opportunity to those residents to avail themselves of the ability to park their motor vehicles on city streets while regulating the length of time generally during which commuters may park their motor vehicles on the same streets it is further intended that this chapter shall assist in reducing automobile commuting and alleviate traffic congestion illegal parking and related health and safety hazards in the zones established pursuant hereto it is also the position of the city that the acquisition of a permit under this chapter confers no rights upon the holder it is merely a privilege which is subject to revocation at the pleasure of the city  part   1 11222016   definitions the following definitions shall control the interpretation and application of this chapter block means both sides of a street between two intersecting streets dwelling unit means one or more rooms which are arranged designed or used as a living quarter for one family only individual bathrooms and complete kitchen facilities are always associated with a dwelling unit lodging house means a residential building containing lodging rooms which accommodate five or more persons who are not members of the family of the owner or keeper of the house who are provided with lodging or board and lodging in exchange for compensation motor vehicle means a vehicle which is selfpropelled including but not limited to automobiles trucks and motorcycles and which are registered for and eligible to travel on the streets and highways of the state of wisconsin parking manager means the city employee or officer designated by the common council to administer the residential parking permit system residence means a dwelling place house apartment room or other place of accommodation which constitutes the true fixed permanent place of abode or home to which a resident intends to return whenever absent resident means a person whose place of residence is so located in the city as to render him or her eligible for procurement of a residential parking permit under this chapter residential street means a street eligible for designation under this chapter for use of residential parking permits street means a route of public travel opened and maintained by the city and located within the city limits temporary resident means a person who lives in river falls for the academic year at the university of wisconsinriver falls or for some other purpose for a duration shorter than that of one year in length  part   part   1 11222016   zone designationsapplication to residential streets and withdrawal of residential streets from application a the designated zones in which residential parking permits may be obtained by residents shall include the following 1 zone a zone a shall consist of the following blocks or described partial blocks of these named streets a fifth street between spring street and elm street b sixth street between spring street and maple street c locust street between second street and third street d walnut street and elm street between second street and sixth street e third street and fourth street between spring street and maple street  2 zone aa zone aa shall consist of the following blocks or described partial blocks of these named streets a valley view dr b south fork dr c broadway st from valley view dr to south fork dr 3 zone b zone b shall consist of the following blocks or described partial blocks of these named streets a state street between cascade avenue and vine street b vine street from main street west to its end c maple street and pine street between second street and eighth street d third street fourth street and seventh street between maple street and cedar street e eighth street between spring street and cedar street f hazel street and lake street between sixth street and eighth street g spring street between sixth street and crescent street h hillcrest street and pierce street between spring street and oak knoll i crescent street between spring street and cascade avenue j birch street between cascade avenue and morgan road k birch crest lane between cascade avenue and birch street l birchcrest drive from cascade avenue north to its end  4 zone bb zone bb shall consist of the following blocks or described partial blocks of these named streets a oak knoll avenue between cascade avenue and crescent street 5 zone c zone c shall consist of the following blocks or described partial blocks of these named streets a spring street between westerly most fifth street and sixth street b fifth street between cascade avenue and spring street c sixth street between cascade avenue and spring street b within zones a aa and c residents of the designated streets shall be deemed to be eligible for the issuance of residential parking permits as follows upon application under this chapter no more than two permits shall be issued for each singlefamily residence for each multifamily residence or lodging house one permit per tenant to a maximum number as allowed by the zoning code c petition for designation of zone for residential parking permit purposes for the inclusion of one or more of the streets designated as being in zones b and bb the street must abut a street with similar parking restrictions or be adjacent to the university of wisconsinriver falls campus and greater than fifty 50 percent of the property owners of a given block shall petition the common council all properties abutting a given block shall be considered in the event such a petition is filed with the city the common council shall hold a public hearing to be preceded by a public notice published in the citys official newspaper which shall identify the residential streets proposed for consideration of inclusion under the residential parking permit system based upon the criteria stated above as well as setting forth the reasons for such consideration only after the holding of such a public hearing may the city officially declare by resolution one or more of the residential streets within zones b and bb to be subject to this chapter d withdrawal of residential streets from application of this the decision has been made by the common council to designate the residential streets in one or more of the defined zones as being subject to this chapter none of the streets may be withdrawn from application of this chapter for a period of at least twelve 12 months next following the date of common council action activating this chapter in a given zone thereafter a change may be made upon the petition of greater than fifty 50 percent of the property owners of a given block such petitions to contain the same information as is required of original petitions under subsection c of this section in such event withdrawals of streets may be accomplished on less than a zonebyzone basis but shall not apply to anything less than a particular street in a particular block prior to ordering the withdrawal of a particular street in a particular block from operation of this chapter the common council shall hold a public hearing in accord with subsection c of this section and the city police chief or his or her designee shall provide the city with a recommendation as to the petition for withdrawal after the public hearing has been held the common council may in its discretion continue operation of this chapter as to a given street and block or it may rescind the same by resolution in the event that it rescinds operation of this chapter as to a given street and block permits shall no longer validate residential parking  part  part   part   part   2 9132016   1 11222016   implementation of system for each street in zone a and those in zones aa b and bb which are included upon petition under the operation of this chapter this chapter shall be in effect from september 1st each year to may 31st of the following year during the hours of seven am to four pm excluding saturdays sundays and legal holidays for each street in zone c this chapter shall be in effect at all times during the hours of seven am to seven pm excluding saturdays sundays and legal holidays in zones a b and c  parking on the even side of each affected street shall be limited to those vehicles displaying valid residential parking permits during the stated hours each day and any vehicle whether displaying a valid residential parking permit or not may be parked on the odd side of each affected street unless otherwise restricted in zones bb  parking on the odd side of each affected street shall be limited to those vehicles displaying valid residential parking permits during the stated hours each day and any vehicle whether displaying a valid residential parking permit or not may be parked on the even side of each affected street unless otherwise restricted in zone aa  parking on both sides of each affected street shall be limited to those vehicles displaying valid residential parking permits during the stated hours each day for purposes of this chapter the even and odd sides of each street shall be determined by the address numbering system  part  part   part   1 11222016   issuance of permits a residential parking permit shall be issued upon application to the owner or operator of a motor vehicle who resides within one of the zones designated under a which shall allow the owner or operator to park on any street designated for residential parking in the zone as long as the permit is valid subject to other designated restrictions if any such a permit shall not be issued to any owner or operator who has outstanding citations for parking or moving violations in the city the cost of such permit including guest permits shall be approved by the city council and established in the city fee schedule  part  part  part   1 11222016   application each application shall be made on a form prepared by the city and shall include the following information 1 the name of the owner or operator of the motor vehicle his or her residential address the make model and registration number of the motor vehicle  and 2 the owners drivers license the city parking manager may request further information from the applicant to verify his or her eligibility for issuance of a permit including but not limited to the following if the applicants drivers license or motor vehicle registration reflects a place of residence other than within the zone in question or one which is not situated on one of the designated residential streets the applicant shall be required to attest to the fact that the motor vehicle in question is kept only at the address listed on the application located on an affected residential street if a tenant at the listed residence the applicant may be required to present a copy of an executed lease or proof satisfactory to the city that he or she actually resides at the place of residence listed each application shall be attested to meaning that the applicant shall swear or affirm as to the correctness of the information supplied therein  part   1 11222016   term and form of permit each permit for zones a aa b and bb shall be valid from september 1st to may 31st of the new following year permits issued for zone c shall be valid from september 1st to august 31st of the new following year permits shall automatically be voided prior to the expiration date of such a term should the owner or operator of the motor vehicle in question remove his or her place of residence to a street which is not designated as residential to an area of the city which is not contained within the designated zone for which it was issued or outside of the city each permit shall display the motor vehicles license number and permit expiration date and shall be displayed by hanging upon the rear view mirror so as to be clearly visible windshield of the motor vehicle to which it applies in the case of a motorcycle permit shall be displayed as directed by the parking manager  part  part   part   1 11222016   temporary residents temporary residents of one of the designated zones in the city may apply for temporary residential parking permits upon compliance with all of the provisions of this section such applicant shall attest under oath on the application that he or she 1 maintains his or her permanent residence in another jurisdiction and shall provide the address thereof  2 owns or operates a motor vehicle registered in the jurisdiction of his or her permanent residence whether or not that is the state of wisconsin for which vehicle the permit is being sought  3 is living in one of the zones subject to this chapter under a valid lease at a particular place of residence specifying the address therefore as well as the name address and telephone number of the landlord or his or her agent  4 that it is understood by the applicant that any change in circumstances materially affecting continuing eligibility for the permit or any false information or representation made in the process of applying for and receiving a permit shall be cause for immediate revocation of such a permit furthermore each applicant for a temporary permit shall be required to provide a copy of his or her lease at the time of making such application temporary permits issued under this section shall be valid only for the remaining term of the lease in question or one year whichever is shorter  part   1 11222016   guests or invitees of residents for use by guests of invitees of residents of streets subject to this chapter two guest permits shall be provided to the owner of each property containing one or more dwelling units in the same manner and subject to the same restrictions as are resident permits guest permits are only valid for the city block in which they were issued  part  part   1 11222016   parking permits a a residential parking permit is valid only when it is displayed pursuant to a motor vehicle parked along one of the residential streets subject to this chapter use of the parking permit shall be restricted to streets designated for residential parking permits within each specified zone a residential parking permit shall not guarantee or reserve to the holder a parking space whether on a given residential street or on any residential street within the zone in question b a residential parking permit shall not authorize the holder to cause to stand or park a motor vehicle at such places where parking is prohibited or during such times as when the stopping standing or parking of motor vehicles is set aside for specified types of vehicles nor exempt the holder from observance of any traffic regulation other than the specified hourly parking limit residential parking permits do not exempt holders from abandonment regulations towing regulations overnight parking restrictions or snow emergency regulations and the privilege afforded by it may temporarily be suspended for emergency or construction purposes c at the expiration of a permit term the permit shall be removed from the motor vehicle in question by the owner or operator  part   part   1 11222016   transferabilityviolations and revocation of residential parking permits a only the registered motor vehicle designated on the permit application shall be eligible for exercise of the privileges afforded under a residential parking permit any transfer of such a permit without the permission of the parking manager to a motor vehicle other than the one described in the permit application shall constitute a violation of this chapter transfers of permits shall be allowed automatically upon presentation of proof that the motor vehicle to which the permit applied has been abandoned sold or otherwise conveyed to a third person or is no longer operable in which event the permit holder seeks its transfer to another designated motor vehicle b it shall constitute a violation of this chapter for any person to falsely represent him or herself as eligible for a residential parking permit or to furnish any false information in connection with an application for a permit should any person to whom a permit has been issued change his or her address without notifying the city parking manager within seven days of moving it shall constitute a violation of this chapter c the parking manager is authorized and directed to revoke the residential parking permit of any person found to be in violation of this chapter and upon written notification of such revocation the person in question shall surrender his or her permit to the parking manager failure to surrender a parking permit so revoked shall constitute a violation of this chapter as such that no
