requirements must be met before a well operation permit is issued a the well has a functional pumping system and its use can be justified in addition to or in lieu of water provided by the public water system b the well has a history of producing bacteriological safe water and presently produces bacteriological safe water as demonstrated by providing a copy of the results of a water sample analyzed at a state certified laboratory within three months preceding the request for the well operation permit or permit renewal c the well and pump installation meets the requirements of ch nr 812 wis adm as certified by a department of natural resources licensed well driller or pump installer or by department of natural resources staff evaluation no less than every ten 10 years d no physical connection exists between the piping of the public water system and the private well e a fee of twentyfive dollars $2500 is paid to the city for processing a permit part  part prior code  13173   12102013    abandonment methods wells shall be abandoned according to the procedures outlined in ch nr 812 wis adm pump and piping must be removed and the well checked for obstructions prior to abandonment any obstruction or liner must be removed if possible filling with unapproved materials or use of unacceptable procedures is prohibited and is considered a violation of the ordinance codified in this chapter part  part prior code  13174   report and inspection an abandonment report form department of natural resources no 33005 is available at the utility office and must be submitted to the utility office within ten 10 days of abandonment completion fortyeight 48 hour advance notice of well abandonment work must be provided to the utility office so the filling may be observed by a representative of the water utility the utility shall send a copy of form 33005 to the appropriate department of natural resources district office within ten 10 days of receipt of the completed form part  part prior code  13175   violationspenalties any person firm or other well owner violating any provision of this chapter shall upon conviction be subject to a forfeiture of not less than fifty dollars $5000 nor more than five hundred dollars $50000 together with the cost of prosecution each day during which a violation exists shall be deemed and constitute a separate offense if any person fails to comply with this chapter for more than ten 10 days after notice in writing the city may impose a penalty or may cause the abandonment to be done and any expense shall be assessed as a special tax against the property part prior code  13176   12102013  stormwater utility findings and necessity the city finds that the management of stormwater and other surface water discharge within and beyond the kinnickinnic river classified an outstanding water resource is a matter that affects the health safety and welfare of the city its citizens and businesses and others in the surrounding area failure to effectively manage stormwater affects the sanitary sewer utility operations of the city by among other things increasing the likelihood of infiltration and inflow in the sanitary sewer in addition surface water runoff may create erosion of lands threaten businesses and residences with water damage and create sedimentation and other environmental damage in the kinnickinnic river those elements of the system which provide for the collection of and disposal of stormwater and regulation of groundwater are of benefit and provide services to all property within the city including property not presently served by the storm elements of the system the cost of operating and maintaining the city stormwater management system and financing necessary repairs replacements improvements and extension thereof should to the extent practicable be allocated in relationship to the benefits enjoyed and services received therefrom in order to protect the health safety and welfare of the public the common council is exercising its authority to establish a stormwater utility and set the rates for stormwater management services the city is acting under the authority of chapters 62 and 66 of the wisconsin statutes and particularly at least the following statutes 11 62162 6218   and  amended during supplement #1  part   establishment there is established a city stormwater utility the operation of the stormwater utility shall be under the supervision of the common council the city engineer or designee will be in charge of the stormwater utility part   authority the city stormwater utility may acquire construct lease own operate maintain extend expand replace clean dredge repair conduct manage and finance such facilities as are deemed by the city to be proper and reasonably necessary for a system of storm and surface water management these facilities may include without limitation by enumeration surface and underground drainage facilities sewers watercourses retaining walls and ponds and other facilities as will support a stormwater management system part   definitions for the purpose of this chapter the following definitions shall apply words used in the singular shall include the plural and the plural the singular  words used in the present tense shall include the future tense  the word shall is mandatory and not discretionary  the word may is permissive words not defined herein shall be construed to have the meaning given by common and ordinary use as defined in the latest edition of websters dictionary director means the city engineer or designee of the common council equivalent runoff unit eru means the typical area of singlefamily homes within the city and on the date of adoption of the ordinance codified in this chapter impervious area or impervious surface means a horizontal surface which has been compacted or covered with a layer of material so that it is highly resistant to infiltration by rain water it includes but is not limited to semiimpervious surfaces such as compacted clay as well as streets roofs sidewalks parking lots and other similar surfaces part   rate charges a by this chapter the common council is establishing the rate structure for each lot and parcel within the city for services and facilities provided by the stormwater utility the actual charges to be imposed the establishment of formulas for calculations of the charges the establishment of specific customer classifications and any future changes in those rates formulas rate charges and customer classifications may be made by resolution all rates established pursuant to this chapter will be fair and reasonable the current rates will be on file with the city clerk b rate charges shall be used to share the costs of the stormwater utility these rate charges may include 1 base charge bc the base charge may be imposed on all property in the city the base charge will be designed to reflect the fact that all properties benefit from the stormwater management activities of the city and that all property contribute in some way to the stormwater discharge that must be managed by the city the bc will be designed to collect the administrative costs of the stormwater utility and the portion of capital costs not covered by special assessments the bc may be based on the size of a parcel of property 2 equivalent runoff unit charge eru the eru will be designed on the basis of a typical residential unit of property other units of property will be charged multiples of the eru based on the impervious area contributing to surface water runoff 3 special charge sc this charge may be imposed on property that is in an area specifically benefitted by a particular stormwater management facility the sc will be developed to reflect the benefits services in a particular area that may not be appropriate to spread to property throughout the city the sc will be calculated on an eru basis c the common council may make such other customer classifications as will be likely to provide reasonable and fair distribution of the costs of the stormwater utility in so doing the common council may provide credits against certain of the charges set forth above for facilities installed and maintained by the property owner for the purpose of lessening the stormwater flow from that given property d the city department of finance is appointed as the collection agency for the city stormwater utility bills shall be prepared monthly according to established procedure and sent to the owner or occupant of each premise served in their public utility bill the department of finance shall allocate the actual cost of billing and collecting e the bills for stormwater utility charges shall be mailed to the designated utility bill recipient but this mailing shall not relieve the owner of the property from liability for rental property in the event payment is not made as required in this chapter the owner of any property served which is occupied by tenants shall have the right to examine collection records of the city for the purpose of determining whether such rates and charges have been paid for such tenants  provided that such examination shall be made at the office at which the records are kept and during the hours that such office is open for business f stormwater utility charges shall not be payable in installments if stormwater utility charges remain unpaid after a period of twenty 20 days from the date of utility bill such bill shall become a delinquent special charge and shall become a lien as provided in wis stats 13 the charges shall automatically be extended upon the current or next tax roll as a delinquent tax against the property and all proceedings in relation to the collection return and sale of property for delinquent real estate taxes shall apply to such special charges unpaid charges shall be assessed a late fee and interest rate per city policy g all delinquent special charges shall be subject to a ten 10 percent penalty in addition to all other charges and prior penalties or interest when the delinquent special charge is extended upon the tax roll amended during supplement #1  part   new construction a the property owner excluding single family residential properties shall be responsible for completing the stormwater utility service application form any time a building permit is issued or a site plan review is conducted the form shall be provided by the department of community development with each application exclusive of single family residential for a building permit or application for site plan review failure to submit a completed stormwater utility service application form or providing false information on said form shall result in the forfeiture of not less than ten dollars $10 nor more than two hundred dollars $200 b the owner shall also be liable for stormwater charges under this chapter for the improvement from the date construction of the improvement began part   method of appeal a in addition to rights of review provided by 5 wis stats to the public service commission the stormwater utility charge may be appealed as follows 1 a written appeal shall be filed with the city clerk prior to the utility charge due date  or 2 within thirty 30 days of payment a written challenge to the stormwater charge must be filed with the city clerk on behalf of the customer specifying all bases for the challenge and the amount of the stormwater charge the customer asserts is appropriate failure to file a challenge within thirty 30 days of payment waives all right to later challenge the charge b a review committee shall be formed consisting of no 1 the city engineer  no 2 a council person appointed by mayor and approved by common council  no 3 one other person appointed by mayor and approved by common council who shall serve at the pleasure of the common council person no 3 shall have suitable expertise in stormwater management 1 person no 1 above shall serve as chair of the review committee 2 the city clerk will coordinate the processing of all appeals and challenges and schedule the meetings of the review committee to assure that all appeals and challenges are processed within the times established by this chapter 3 the review committee shall meet as needed but no more often than once per month to review appeals and challenges and make a determination of whether the stormwater charge is fair and reasonable or whether a refund is due the customer c the customer has thirty 30 days from the decision of the review committee to file a written appeal to the common council d if the common council or review committee determines that a refund is due the customer the refund will be applied as a credit on the customers next quarterly stormwater billing if the refund will not exceed the customers next quarterly stormwater billing or will be refunded at the discretion of the director of finance   amended during supplement #1   part   special assessment authority in addition to any other method for collection of the charges established pursuant to this chapter for stormwater utility costs the common council finds that these charges may be levied on property as a special charge pursuant to wis stats the charges established hereunder reasonably reflect the benefits conferred on property and may be assessed as special charges the mailing of the bill for such charges to the owner will serve as notice to the owner that failure to pay the charges when due may result in them being charged pursuant to the authority of stats in addition the city may provide notice each october of any unpaid charges to the stormwater utility which charges if not paid by november 15th may be placed upon the tax roll under stats amended during supp # 1  part   budget excess revenues the stormwater utility finances shall be accounted for in a separate stormwater fund by the city the city shall prepare an annual budget which is to include all operation and maintenance costs debt service and other costs related to the operation of the stormwater utility the budget is subject to approval by the common council the costs shall be spread over the rate classifications as determined by the common council any excess of revenues over expenditures in a year will be retained by the stormwater fund for subsequent years needs part natural gas franchises authorization the city council may grant an exclusive franchise to construct and maintain underground facilities within the city for the distribution and sale of natural gas propane gas or any other gas to customers within such city which permits the company to enter upon and use and occupy the streets alleys bridges avenues and public grounds and places of the city to construct lay maintain operate and extend thereon thereunder such mains pipes apparatus equipment and appliances as may be necessary or appropriate for the sale distribution and delivery of gas to consumers within the city subject to the conditions set forth in this chapter 131   privileges and responsibilities for the purpose of carrying into effect the franchise and privileges granted by a the company is authorized to make all necessary excavations in streets alleys avenues and public grounds and places which shall be done with reasonable dispatch in a workmanlike manner and with the least possible interference with or inconvenience to the rights of the public b the company shall restore all streets alleys avenues public grounds and places when excavated by it to substantially their same condition of safety utility and aesthetic appearance as prior to the excavation c the restoration shall be as soon as reasonably possible after the excavation has been made and the obligation to maintain against any defect arising because of such excavation shall be continuous d if the company shall use any bridges or viaducts on which to lay mains or other facilities it shall lay or place such mains or facilities over under or upon such bridges or viaducts with the least practicable interference with or inconvenience to the rights of the public e no above ground pipe shall be laid except on established bridges or viaducts as hereinabove provided without the approval of the city council f except in cases of actual emergency where public health or safety is endangered the company shall give the city fortyeight 48 hours notice of its intention to excavate any street alley avenue or public ground or place and such excavation shall be made on the side or portion of the street alley avenue public ground or place as may be directed by the city 132   franchise cancellation the franchise granted pursuant to this municipal code is subject to all lawful and reasonable rules and regulations of the city council and to all provisions of statutory law applicable thereto and all legal orders rules and regulations of the public service commission of wisconsin and of any other state agency having authority under law from time to time over any phase of the company under or pursuant to the franchise granted in this chapter in the event the said company should fail to fulfill any of its obligations to be performed under the franchise or under any regulatory or administrative agency commission or statute of wisconsin or lawful rules regulations or ordinances of the city then the franchise shall be cancellable at the option of the council the council shall give written notice by its duly authorized officer or agent of such breach and shall give the company thirty 30 days to correct the same if the breach has not been corrected or remedied within such period then the franchise is to be cancellable at the option of the council upon its own motion and without further prior notice in construing what is intended by the word reasonable whenever and wherever it is used that construction is to be adopted which is most beneficial for the residents of the city in the specific situation where a construction of such word becomes necessary or desired 133   liability insurance the franchised company shall post a liability bond or policy insuring against all liability to others including the city as a result of the installation or operation of a gas distribution system in the city which shall remain in force until this franchise is cancelled in an amount of not less than one million dollars $1000000 for any one claimant and five million dollars $5000000 134 city service accounts footnotes  4  editors note  1 adopted  amended in its entirety to read as herein set out former  pertained to utility funds and accounts and derived from prior code  1314  amended during supplement #1 and delinquent city service accounts pursuant to the authority granted in 3 wis stats the following procedures shall apply to the collection of delinquent accounts for water sewer electric service garbage snow and ice removal weed elimination and other city services for which property owners andor occupants are responsible a between october 1 and october 15 of each year the city treasurer shall prepare a list of the owners and occupants of all lots or parcels of real estate for which payment is owing and in arrears for the services described above these overdue service charges shall include those due to the city as of october 1 whether they were incurred in the year in question or before b on october 15 of each year or on the last business day before october 15 if the same shall fall upon a weekend the city treasurer shall cause a notice to be sent by mail to the owner or occupant of the lots or parcels of real estate in question the notice shall be in writing and shall state the amount of arrears including any penalty assessed pursuant to the rules of the city  that unless the amount is paid by november 1 a ten 10 percent penalty of the amount of arrears will be added  and that unless the arrears and any added penalty are paid by november 15 the arrears and penalty will be levied as a tax against the lot or parcel of real estate to which the municipal service was provided and for which payment is delinquent c on november 16 the city treasurer shall certify and file with the city clerk a list of all lots or parcels of real estate giving the legal description for which notice of arrears was given and for which arrears remain unpaid stating the amount of arrears and added penalty each delinquent amount including the penalty becomes a lien upon the lot or parcel of real estate to which the municipal service was furnished and payment for which is delinquent and the clerk shall insert the delinquent amount and penalty as a tax against the lot or parcel of real estate all proceedings in relation to the collection of general property taxes and to the return and sale of property for delinquent taxes apply to the tax if it is not paid within the time required by law for payment of taxes upon real estate   8272013  title 14  impact fees and sewer services connection fees connection fee for sewer service   short title this chapter shall be known and may be cited as the connection fee for sewer service of the city of river falls municipal utility ordinance part   10142014    introduction and purpose pursuant to the authority of wisconsin statutes the local connection fee for sewer service enabling legislation the purpose of this chapter is to establish the mechanism for the imposition of connection fee for sewer services upon new development to finance the construction reconstruction improvement or extension of the sewerage system this chapter is intended to assure that new development bears an appropriate share of the cost of capital expenditures necessary to provide public facilities within the city of river falls and its service areas as they are required to serve the needs arising out of land development part   10142014    definitions building permit means the written approval issued in accordance with the provisions of 09 of the wisconsin administrative the citys office of the building inspector for any construction repair enlargement improvement or alteration of any building or structure within the city it does not include the fast start permit or preliminary permit issued at the time of excavation or installation of footings for any such building or structure capital costs means the capital costs to construct expand or improve public facilities including the cost of land and including legal engineering and design costs to construct expand or improve public facilities except that not more than ten 10 percent of capital costs may consist of legal engineering and design costs unless the city can demonstrate that its legal engineering and design costs which relate directly to the public improvement for which the connection fee for sewer services were imposed exceed ten 10 percent of capital costs capital costs does not include other noncapital costs to construct expand or improve public facilities or the costs of equipment to construct expand or improve public facilities city means the city of river falls connection fee for sewer service means cash contributions contributions of land or interests in land or any other items of value that are imposed on a developer by the city council under this section developer means a person that constructs or creates a land development development means any manmade change to improved or unimproved real property the use of any principal structure or land or any other activity that requires issuance of a permit for a new meter or a change in meter size dwelling unit means a building or portion thereof with rooms arranged designed used or intended to be used for one family guest houses with kitchen and bathroom facilities are considered dwelling units land development means the construction or modification of improvements to real property that creates additional residential dwelling units within the city or results in nonresidential uses that create a need for new expanded or improved public facilities within the city lowcostlowincome housing means that per statute 7 the city council may discount sewer connection fees on lowcostlowincome housing developments the impact of these fees on the availability of lowcostlowincome housing is difficult to quantify on an overall basis the impact of the fees on the developments that qualify for lowcostlowincome housing will be assessed at the time of final platting multifamily units means any residential dwelling greater than a duplex or twin home public facilities for purposes of this section means facilities for collecting and treating sewage residential equivalent unit reu means a unit of measure for connection fee for sewer service equivalent to one residential dwelling unit for purposes of this chapter one residential equivalent unit is considered equal to the basic residential meter size of fiveeighths inch or threefourths inch the residential equivalent unit is used as a single unit of measurement for all residential nonresidential commercial industrial and institutional land developments because of the relationship between size of the water meter and generation of sewage by the user or owner of record service area means a geographic area delineated by the city council within which there are public facilities service standard means a certain quantity or quality of public facilities relative to a certain number of persons parcels of land or other appropriate measure as specified by the city council sewer utility means the river falls municipal sewer utility part   10142014    connection fee for sewer service revenue administration a revenues from connection fee for sewer services shall be placed in one or more segregated interest bearing accounts and shall be accounted for separately from other funds connection fee for sewer service revenues and interest earned thereon may be expended only for capital costs including interest expense for which the connection fee for sewer services were imposed b connection fee for sewer service revenues imposed and collected but not used within a reasonable period of time after collection to pay the capital costs for which they were imposed shall be refunded to which the connection fee for sewer services were imposed together with interest at the rate of two percent per annum reasonable time periods for expenditure of connection fee for sewer service revenues shall be within fifteen 15 years after the recommended time for commencement of construction expansion or improvement of a specific public facility identified in a facilities need assessment report or within twenty 20 years after the projected loan obligations undertaken for a project should be satisfied whichever is longer part   10142014    use of connection fee for sewer service funds collected from connection fee for sewer services shall be used solely for the purpose of paying the proportionate costs of providing public facilities that may become necessary due to land development to the extent authorized by wisconsin statutes  these costs may include the costs of debt service on bonds or similar debt instruments when the debt has been incurred for the purpose of proceeding with designated public facilities projects prior to the collection of all anticipated connection fee for sewer services for that project to reimburse the utility for advances of other funds or reserves and such other purposes consistent with wisconsin statutes  which are recorded and approved by the city council part   10142014    payment of connection fee for sewer service for all development whether in the form of new subdivisions commercial development or such other development at the time a building permit is issued for construction requiring installation of a water meter or expansion of an existing water meter or at the time of the installation of a new water meter or expansion of an existing water meter under circumstances in which a building permit is not required the sewer service connection fee shall be paid in full rates which are in effect at the time of issuance of a sewer service connection permit will be applied payment of the connection fee for sewer service shall be the responsibility of the owner of record of the property at the time of application for the sewer service connection permit fees shall be paid at the river falls municipal utility office a in addition to this fee being imposed upon new subdivisions and commercial development it shall be imposed upon each of the following types of development 1 new residential commercial industrial and institutional development which does not require the subdivision of land under ch 236 wis stats or city ordinances and which development requires connection to the municipal sewer system 2 preexisting development on land which was formerly located in a town adjoining the city which developed land is annexed to the city and is required or requested to be connected to the municipal sewer system b a development shall be deemed to be connected to the public water system for purposes of this section at such time as when a water meter is first installed or when an expanded water meter in the case of existing development is installed  part    part  12610   10142014    appeals the payment of a connection fee for sewer service imposed under this section may be contested as to the amount collection or use of the connection fee for sewer service by appeal to the city council provided that the applicant files a written notice of appeal with the city clerks office within fourteen 14 days of the approval by the building inspector of an application for a building permit upon which the connection fee for sewer service is imposed such notice of appeal shall be entitled notice of appeal of connection fee for sewer service and shall state the applicants name address telephone number address if available and legal description of the land development upon which the connection fee for sewer service is imposed and a statement of the nature of and reasons for the appeal the city clerk shall schedule the appeal for consideration by the city council at a meeting as soon as reasonably practicable under the circumstances and shall notify the applicant of the time date and place of such meeting in writing by regular mail deposited in the mail no later than at least three days before the date of such meeting upon review of such appeal the city council may adjust the amount collection or use of the connection fee for sewer service upon just and reasonable cause shown  part part   10142014    connection fee for sewer service a the basis for the imposition of the sewer connection fees is the study and assessment conducted to establish the amount implementation schedule and rational basis for imposition of the connection fee for sewer service which has been summarized in the comprehensive sanitary sewer study october 1998 addendum to comprehensive sanitary sewer study august 2000 and sanitary sewer collection system study 2009 prepared by ayres and associates and the sewer connection fee and water impact fee update august 2014 prepared by trilogy consulting llc which are on file in the office of the city clerk and open to public inspection during normal business hours b to place effect the city adopts a sewer connection fee schedule a current copy of which is on file with the city clerk where it shall be available for public inspection upon recommendation of the utility advisory board the common council reserves the right from time to time to amend said schedule by means of a resolution to that effect c connection fee for sewer services for singlefamily units will be based on residential equivalent meters fiveeighths inch and threefourths inch meter   one reu duplexes and twin homes will pay connection fee for sewer services based on two residential equivalent meters all other residential buildings threeplexes or larger and any other buildings commercial industrial schools etc will pay connection fee for sewer services based on the size of the water meter required d a connection fee for sewer service as set forth in subsection c of this section is levied against each residential equivalent unit constructed altered or improved within the city after the effective date of this section 1 for new construction each residential equivalent unit constructed or caused to be built by the owner of record shall be subject to the assessment of the connection fee for sewer service 2 for alterations or improvements to an existing residential equivalent unit where a change in water meter size is requested the owner of record shall be assessed a connection fee for sewer service equal to the difference between the new water meter size and the existing water meter size on the residential equivalent unit 3 the residential equivalent unit is the unit of measurement for assessment of the connection fee for sewer service regardless of whether or not the proposed land development is residential commercial industrial or institutional in nature   part  12610   10142014    exemptions the following situations shall be exempted from payment of the connection fee for sewer services as outlined in a alterations or expansion of an existing building where no additional or larger meter connections are requested b the replacement of a building or structure with a new building or structure of the same size and use where no additional or larger water andor sewer connections are requested and where the use is not changed c a change in water meter size shall not be exempted from payment of the connection fee for sewer service  however a credit shall be given for the current connection fee for sewer service on the old meter size based on current rates for example at the time of an application for a change from a fiveeighths inch meter to a oneinch meter the connection fee for sewer service would equal the current connection fee for sewer service for a oneinch meter less the current connection fee for sewer service for a fiveeighths inch meter d no connection fee for sewer service shall be required nor credited for a change in water meter size that results in a decrease in meter size e any claim for exemption shall be made and filed prior to the time required for payment as provided by any claim not so made shall be deemed waived f no connection fee for sewer service shall be imposed in an amount necessary to address existing deficiencies in public facilities g upon city council approval an exemption from or a reduction in the amount of connection fee for sewer services on land development that provides lowincome housing may be made no amount of an connection fee for sewer service for which an exemption or reduction is provided under this subsection may be shifted to any other development in the land development in which the lowincome housing is located or to any other land development in the city  part  part   10142014    reserved editors note of adopted  repealed   which pertained to review and derived from in its entirety water utility impact fees   short title this chapter shall be known and may be cited as the water impact fees of the city of river falls municipal water utility ordinance part   10142014    introduction and purpose pursuant to the authority of wisconsin statutes the local impact fees enabling legislation the purpose of this chapter is to establish the mechanism for the imposition of impact fees upon new development to finance the capital costs of constructing expanding or improving public facilities which are necessary to accommodate land development this chapter is intended to assure that new development bears an appropriate share of the cost of capital expenditures necessary to provided public facilities within the city of river falls and its service areas as they are required to serve the needs arising out of land development part   10142014    definitions building permit means the written approval issued in accordance with the provisions of 09 of the wisconsin administrative the citys office of the building inspector for any construction repair enlargement improvement or alteration of any building or structure within the city it does not include the fast start permit or preliminary permit issued at the time of excavation or installation of footings for any such building or structure capital costs means the capital costs to construct expand or improve public facilities including the cost of land and including legal engineering and design costs to construct expand or improve public facilities except that not more than ten 10 percent of capital costs may consist of legal engineering and design costs unless the city can demonstrate that its legal engineering and design costs which relate directly to the public improvement for which the impact fees were imposed exceed ten 10 percent of capital costs capital costs does not include other noncapital costs to construct expand or improve public facilities or the costs of equipment to construct expand or improve public facilities city means the city of river falls developer means a person that constructs or creates a land development development means any manmade change to improved or unimproved real property the use of any principal structure or land or any other activity that requires issuance of a permit for a new meter or a change in meter size dwelling unit means a building or portion thereof with rooms arranged designed used or intended to be used for one family guest houses with kitchen and bathroom facilities are considered dwelling units impact fee means cash contributions contributions of land or interests in land or any other items of value that are imposed on a developer by the city council under this section irrigation meter means a meter installed to measure the flow of outdoor water use land development means the construction or modification of improvements to real property that creates additional residential dwelling units within the city or results in nonresidential uses that create a need for new expanded or improved public facilities within the city lowcostlowincome housing means that per statute 7 the city council may discount impact fees on lowcostlowincome housing developments the impact of these fees on the availability of lowcostlow income housing is difficult to quantify on an overall basis the impact of the fees on the developments that qualify for lowcostlowincome housing will be assessed at the time of final platting multifamily units means any residential dwelling greater than a duplex or twin home public facilities for purposes of this chapter as defined in wisconsin statutes  means facilities for pumping storing treating and distributing water residential equivalent unit reu means a unit of measure for impact fees equivalent to one residential dwelling unit for purposes of this chapter one residential equivalent unit is considered equal to the basic residential meter size of fiveeighths inch or threefourths inch the residential equivalent unit is used as a single unit of measurement for all residential nonresidential commercial industrial and institutional land developments because of the relationship between size of the water meter and generation of water by the user or owner of record service area means a geographic area delineated by the city council within which there are public facilities service standard means a certain quantity or quality of public facilities relative to a certain number of persons parcels of land or other appropriate measure as specified by the city council water utility means the river falls municipal water utility part   10142014    impact fee revenue administration a revenues from impact fees shall be placed in one or more segregated interestbearing accounts and shall be accounted for separately from other funds impact fee revenues and interest earned thereon may be expended only for capital costs including interest expense for which the impact fees were imposed b impact fee revenues imposed and collected but not used within a reasonable period of time after collection to pay the capital costs for which they were imposed shall be refunded together with accumulated interest under 9 wis stats to the then current owner of the property with respect to where the impact fees were imposed reasonable time periods for expenditure of impact fee revenues shall be within ten 10 years after the recommended time for commencement of construction expansion or improvement of a specific public facility identified in a facilities need assessment report subject to the adoption by the common council of a resolution extending said expenditure period for three years in accord with 9b wis stats  part  part  6222010   10142014    use of impact fees funds collected from impact fees shall be used solely for the purpose of paying the proportionate costs of providing public facilities that may become necessary due to land development to the extent authorized by wisconsin statutes  these costs may include the costs of debt service on bonds or similar debt instruments when the debt has been incurred for the purpose of proceeding with designated public facilities projects prior to the collection of all anticipated impact fees for that project to reimburse the utility for advances of other funds or reserves and such other purposes consistent with wisconsin statutes  which are recorded and approved by the city council part   10142014    payment of impact fees all structures construction of which is commencing after the effective date of this chapter and the use and development of all lots shall be subject to the following water service fee structure unless otherwise expressly provided herein all required impact fees shall be paid one hundred 100 percent upon the issuance of the building permit for the purpose of defining the required payment methods the following will apply all new residential subdivisions that include singlefamily units twinhomes duplexes boarding houses or townhomes will pay for the impact fee as defined in the previous sentence any property annexed to the city of river falls containing a land development shall pay one hundred 100 percent of impact fee at the time in which the permanent meter is requested to accommodate the land development rates which are in effect at the time of final plat and at the time of issuance of building permit will be applied impact fee payments shall be assumed to be the responsibility of the owner of record of the property for which final plat approval is requested the owner of record at the time of application for building permit or the owner of record at the time of request for connection to the public water system whichever is applicable all fees shall be paid at the river falls municipal utility office a preexisting development on land that is annexed to the city and is required or requested to be connected to the public water system shall pay a water connection fee equal to the amount of the water impact fee in effect at the time of connection connection fees shall be paid at the time an application for water service is filed with the water utility no meter will be installed prior to payment in full of the connection fee associated therewith b a lot or development shall be connected to the public water system for purposes of this section at such item as a permanent connection has been made to that system and the city has allowed the lot or development to begin receiving water from the system c any impact fee imposed due to installation of a larger meter pursuant to be paid prior to installation of the larger meter  part    part  6222010   10142014    appeals the payment of an impact fee imposed under this section may be contested as to the amount collection or use of the impact fee by appeal to the common council provided that the applicant files a written notice of appeal with the city clerks office within fourteen 14 days of the approval by the building inspector of an application for a building permit upon which the impact fee is imposed such notice of appeal shall be entitled notice of appeal of impact fee and shall state the applicants name address telephone number address if available and legal description of the land development upon which the impact fee is imposed and a statement of the nature of and reasons for the appeal the city clerk shall schedule the appeal for consideration by the common council at a meeting as soon as reasonably practicable under the circumstances and shall notify the applicant of the time date and place of such meeting in writing by regular mail deposited in the mail no later than at least three days before the date of such meeting upon review of such appeal the common council may adjust the amount collection or use of the impact fee upon just and reasonable cause shown  part part   10142014    impact fees a the basis for the imposition of the water impact fees is the study and assessment conducted to establish the amount implementation schedule and rational basis for imposition of the impact fee which has been summarized in the comprehensive water study plan 2007 prepared by short elliott hendrickson inc and the sewer connection fee and water impact fee update august 2014 prepared by trilogy consulting llc both of which are on file in the office of the utility director and open to public inspection during normal business hours b to place effect the city adopts an impact fee schedule a copy of which shall be placed on file with the office of the city clerk where it shall be available for public inspection upon recommendation of the utility advisory board the common council reserves the right from time to time to amend said schedule by means of a resolution to that effect c beginning in january 201 the fees adopted pursuant to this section will be adjusted for inflation on an annual basis this adjustment will apply to all fees in the schedule and will be based on the yeartoyear change in the midwest consumer price index for all urban consumers cpiu during the previous twelve 12 months d singlefamily units will be assessed one residential equivalent meter fiveeighths inches and threequarters inches meter equals one reu duplexes and twin homes will pay impact fees based on two residential equivalent meters all other residential buildings threeplexes or larger and any other buildings commercial industrial schools etc will pay impact fees based on the size of the water meters required irrigation meters greater than one inch will pay impact fees based on the size of the water meters required e an impact fee as set forth in subsection d of this section is levied against each residential equivalent unit constructed altered or improved within the city after the effective date of this section 1 for new construction each residential equivalent unit constructed or caused to be built by the owner of record shall be subject to the assessment of the impact fee 2 for alterations or improvements to an existing residential equivalent unit where a change in water meter size is requested the owner of record shall be assessed an impact fee equal to the difference between the new water meter size and the existing water meter size on the residential equivalent unit 3 the residential equivalent unit is the unit of measurement for assessment of the impact fee regardless of whether or not the proposed land development is residential commercial industrial or institutional in nature f these impact fees shall be collected until the capital costs associated with the projects specified in the report on impact fees have been incurred and satisfied unless such time period exceeds the limitations prescribed in b   part   10142014    1 2282017   exemptions the following situations shall be exempted from payment of the impact fees as outlined in a alterations or expansion of an existing building where no additional or larger water meter connections are requested b the replacement of a building or structure with a new building or structure of the same size and use where no additional or larger water andor sewer connections are requested and where the use is not changed c a change in water meter size shall not be exempted from payment of the impact fee  however a credit shall be given for the current impact fee on the old meter size based on current rates for example at the time of an application for a change from a fiveeighths inches meter to a one inch meter the impact fee would equal the current impact fee for a one inch meter less the current impact fee for a fiveeighths inches meter d no impact fee shall be required nor credited for a change in water meter size that results in a decrease in meter size e any claim for exemption shall be made and filed prior to the time required for payment as provided by any claim not so made shall be deemed waived f no impact fee shall be imposed in an amount necessary to address existing deficiencies in public facilities g upon city council approval an exemption from or a reduction in the amount of impact fees on land development that provides lowcost housing may be made as set forth in 7 wisconsin statutes no amount of an impact fee for which an exemption or reduction is provided under this subsection may be shifted to any other development in the land development in which the lowcost housing is located or to any other land development in the city part   10142014    review the impact fees contained herein shall be reviewed by the utility advisory board and city council when necessary as a result of changing facility needs revised cost estimates capital improvements changes in other funding sources applicable to public facility projects and other relevant factors in accordance with the standards for impact fees set forth in 6 wisconsin statutes until changed by this process the current fees shall stay in full force and effect part   10142014  park and fire impact fees   purpose and intent pursuant to the authority of wisconsin statutes the local impact fees enabling legislation the purpose of this chapter is to establish the mechanism for the imposition of impact fees upon new development to finance the capital costs of acquiring establishing upgrading expanding and constructing public facilities which are necessary to accommodate land development this chapter is intended to assure that new development bears an appropriate share of the cost of capital expenditures necessary to provide public facilities within the city of river falls and its service areas as they are required to serve the needs arising out of land development part   definitions a building permit means the written approval issued in accordance with the provisions of 09 of the wisconsin administrative the citys office of the building inspector for any construction repair enlargement improvement or alteration of any building or structure within the city it does not include the fast start permit or preliminary permit issued at the time of excavation or installation of footings for any such building or structure b capital costs means the capital costs to construct expand or improve public facilities including the cost of land and including legal engineering planning and design costs to construct expand or improve public facilities except that not more than ten 10 percent of capital costs may consist of legal engineering planning and design costs which relate directly to the public improvement for which the impact fees were imposed exceed ten 10 percent of capital costs capital costs does not include other noncapital costs to construct expand or improve public facilities or the costs of equipment to construct expand or improve public facilities c city means the city of river falls d developer means a person that constructs or creates a land development e development means the construction or modification of improvements to real property that requires issuance of a building permit to create additional residential dwelling units within the city or that results in new expanded or improved nonresidential uses within the city f impact fee means a fee to be collected per this chapter for the construction or modification of improvements to real property that creates additional residential dwelling units or creates new or additional square footage of nonresidential buildings g multifamily means any residential dwelling greater than a duplex or twin home h public facilities for purposes of this chapter as defined in wisconsin statutes  means facilities for parks playgrounds and other recreation and fire protection i residential equivalent unit reu means a unit of measure for impact fees equivalent to one singlefamily residential dwelling unit j service area means a geographic area delineated by the city council within which the city provides or will provide facilities part   10142014    impact fee revenue administration a an impact fee shall be imposed on developers to pay for capital costs of public facilities that are necessary to accommodate land development b revenues from impact fees shall be placed in one or more segregated interest bearing accounts and shall be accounted for separately from other city funds impact fee revenues and interest earned thereon may be expended only for capital costs including interest expense for which the impact fees were imposed c impact fee revenues imposed and collected but not used within a reasonable period of time after collection as defined by 9 wis stats to pay the capital costs for which they were imposed shall be refunded on a prorated proportional basis to the current record owner or owners of the property with respect to which the impact fees were imposed reasonable time periods for expenditure of impact fee revenues shall be within ten 10 years after collection of the impact fee subject to the adoption by the common council of a resolution extending said expenditure period for three years in accord with 9b wis stats   part  12610   use of impact fees funds collected from impact fees shall be used solely for the purpose of paying the proportionate costs of providing public facilities that may become necessary due to development these costs may include reimbursements to the city for advances of other funds or reserves and for such other purposes consistent with wisconsin statutes which are recorded and approved by the city council  part   payment of impact fees all required impact fees unless expressly exempted in a section of this chapter shall be paid one hundred 100 percent upon the issuance of a building permit rates that are in effect at the time of building permit issuance shall be applied impact fee payments shall be the responsibility of the owner of record at the time of building permit issuance  part  12610   appeals the payment of an impact fee imposed under this section as a condition of a building permit may be contested as to the amount collection or use of the impact fee to the city council provided that the applicant files a written notice of appeal with the city clerks office within fifteen 15 days of the approval by the building inspector of an application for a building permit upon which the impact fee is imposed such notice of appeal shall be entitled notice of appeal of impact fee and shall state the applicants name address telephone number address if available and legal description of the land development upon which the impact fee is imposed and a statement of the nature of and reasons for the appeal the city clerk shall schedule the appeal for consideration by the city council at a regular meeting as soon as reasonably practicable under the circumstances and shall notify the applicant of the time date and place of such meeting in writing by regular mail deposited in the mail no later than at least three days before the date of such meeting upon review of such appeal the city council may adjust the amount collection or use of the impact fee upon just and reasonable cause shown part   refunds of fees paid any funds not expended within the period of time as established by state statute and implemented by the city council after collection to pay the capital costs for which they were imposed shall be returned to such current landowner with interest at a rate of two percent per annum  part   impact fees a the basis for the imposition of the parks and fire protection facilities impact fees is the facilities needs assessment report and its attachments included in the report on impact fees prepared by virchow krause and company llp in april 200 as amended by the impact fee needs assessment for park facilities prepared by seh inc in april 200 which are on file in the office of the city clerk of the city of river falls b the common council shall adopt by resolution and may from time to time amend a schedule of fees to implement this chapter a copy of which shall be maintained at all times for public inspection in the office of the city clerk a copy of the initial fee schedule is attached hereto and incorporated therein by reference as if fully set forth  part   exemptions the following situations shall be exempted from payment of the impact fees a the replacement of a building or structure with a new building or structure of the same size and use where no additional residential units are added and no additional nonresidential square footage is added b demolition of residential units or nonresidential building square footage with out replacement does not prompt a refund of previously paid impact fees c upon city council approval an exemption from or a reduction in the amount of park impact fees on land development that provides city state or federal approved low cost housing programs may be made as set forth in 7 wisconsin statutes no amount of an impact fee for which an exemption or reduction is provided under this subsection may be shifted to any other development in the land development in which the lowcost housing is located or to any other land development in the city any claim for exemption must be made no later than the time of application for a building permit d upon city council approval an exemption from or a reduction in the amount of park impact fees on development located within a tax incremental district may be made as set forth in 7 wisconsin statutes no amount of an impact fee for which an exemption or reduction is provided under this subsection may be shifted to any other development in the land development in which a tax incremental district is located or to any other land development in the city any claim for exemption must be made no later than the time of application for a building permit part   review the council may review the impact fees contained herein every two years part   other means of financing park and fire protection improvements pursuant to 2b wisconsin statutes the imposition of park and fire protection facilities impact fees under this section does not prohibit or limit the citys authority to finance park and fire protection facilities by other means as authorized by law including but not limited to the land dedication under of the city code which are not impact fees as the term is used in wisconsin statutes  part   severability if any sections phrase sentence or portion of this chapter is for any reason held invalid or unconstitutional by any court of competent jurisdiction such portions shall be deemed separate distinct and independent of the remainder of this chapter which shall be unaffected by such a holding  library impact fees   purpose and intent pursuant to the authority of wis stats the local impact fees enabling legislation the purpose of this chapter is to establish the mechanism for the imposition of impact fees upon new development to finance the capital costs of acquiring establishing upgrading expanding and constructing public facilities which are necessary to accommodate land development this chapter is intended to assure that new development bears an appropriate share of the cost of capital expenditures necessary to provide public facilities within the city and its service areas as they are required to serve the needs arising out of land development  part   definitions a building permit means the written approval issued in accordance with the provisions of section sps 32009 of the wis admin the citys office of the building inspector for any construction repair enlargement improvement or alteration of any building or structure within the city it does not include the fast start permit or preliminary permit issued at the time of excavation or installation of footings for any such building or structure b capital costs means the capital costs to construct expand or improve public facilities including the cost of land and including legal engineering planning and design costs to construct expand or improve public facilities except that not more than ten 10 percent of capital costs may consist of legal engineering planning and design costs which relate directly to the public improvement for which the impact fees were imposed exceed ten 10 percent of capital costs capital costs does not include other noncapital costs to construct expand or improve public facilities or the costs of equipment to construct expand or improve public facilities c developer means a person that constructs or creates a land development d development means the construction or modification of improvements to real property that requires issuance of a building permit to create additional residential dwelling units within the city for purposes of this chapter development does not include new expanded or improved nonresidential uses within the city e impact fee means a fee to be collected per this chapter for the construction or modification of improvements to real property that creates additional residential dwelling units nonresidential buildings are excluded from library impact fees f multifamily means any residential dwelling greater than a duplex or twin home g public facilities for purposes of this chapter as defined in wis stats   means facilities for library services h residential equivalent unit reu means a unit of measure for impact fees equivalent to one singlefamily residential dwelling unit i service area means a geographic area delineated by the city council within which the city provides or will provide facilities j city means the city of river falls  part   10142014    impact fee revenue administration a an impact fee shall be imposed on developers to pay for capital costs of public facilities that are necessary to accommodate land development b revenues from impact fees shall be placed in one or more segregated interest bearing accounts and shall be accounted for separately from other city funds impact fee revenues and interest earned thereon may be expended only for capital costs including interest expense for which the impact fees were imposed c impact fee revenues imposed and collected but not used within a reasonable period of time after collection to pay the capital costs for which they were imposed shall be refunded on a prorated proportional basis as defined by 9 wis stats to the current record owner or owners of the property with respect to which the impact fees were imposed under this chapter the reasonable and appropriate time period for expenditure of impact fee revenues shall be within ten 10 years after collection of the impact fee subject to the adoption by the common council of a resolution extending said expenditure period for three years in accord with 9b wis stats  part  12610   use of impact fees funds collected from impact fees shall be used solely for the purpose of paying the proportionate costs of providing public facilities that may become necessary due to development these costs may include the costs of debt service on bonds or similar debt instruments when the debt has been incurred for the purpose of proceeding with designated public facilities projects prior to the collection of all anticipated impact fees for that project to reimburse the city for advances of other funds or reserves and such other purposes consistent with wis stats which are recorded and approved by the city council  part   payment of impact fees all required impact fees unless expressly exempted in a section of this chapter shall be paid one hundred 100 percent at the time of building permit issuance rates that are in effect at the time of building permit issuance shall be applied impact fee payments shall be the responsibility of the owner of record at the time of building permit issuance  part  12610   appeals the payment of an impact fee imposed under this section as a condition of a building permit may be contested as to the amount collection or use of the impact fee to the city council provided that the applicant files a written notice of appeal with the city clerks office within fifteen 15 days of the approval by the building inspector of an application for a building permit upon which the impact fee is imposed such notice of appeal shall be entitled notice of appeal of impact fee and shall state the applicants name address telephone number address if available and legal description of the land development upon which the impact fee is imposed and a statement of the nature of and reasons for the appeal the city clerk shall schedule the appeal for consideration by the city council at a regular meeting as soon as reasonably practicable under the circumstances and shall notify the applicant of the time date and place of such meeting in writing by regular mail deposited in the mail no later than at least three 3 days before the date of such meeting upon review of such appeal the city council may adjust the amount collection or use of the impact fee upon just and reasonable cause shown  part   refunds of fees paid any funds not expended within the reasonable period of time after collection as defined by 9 wis stats to pay the capital costs for which they were imposed shall be returned to such current landowner with interest at a rate of two percent per annum  part  12610   impact fees a the basis for the imposition of library impact fees is the impact fee needs assessment report and its attachments prepared by short elliott and hendrickson inc seh in june 200 which are on file in the office of the city clerk of the city of river falls b the library impact fee will be adopted by resolution c the common council shall adopt by use of fees which are not impact fees as the term is used in   wis stats  part title 15  buildings and construction chapters building code officer a how appointed the code enforcement officer shall be appointed in accordance with the adopted personnel policy officer shall be a title given any individual who is certified by the state of wisconsin for inspection of udcconstruction udchvac udcelectrical udcplumbing and commercial buildings signifying sole responsibility for enforcing this chapter per chapters sps 320 to 325 of the wis adm or she shall also enforce other building and housing related ordinances as adopted by the city council b officers shall be under the supervision of the city administrator or his designee c powers and duties the code enforcement officer shall have the power and duty to enforce the provisions of this chapter and all other ordinances and all laws and orders of the state which relate to building construction plumbing hvac electrical installations moving regulations regarding buildings and shall assist with site and zoning enforcement and erosion control except as specifically provided by other ordinances for these purposes the code enforcement officer shall have the authority to enter buildings and premises in the city at reasonable times d maintenance all public and private buildings and structures new and existing shall be maintained in a safe and sanitary condition the code enforcement officer may cause any building or structure to be inspected in order to assure compliance with this section e cooperation of other city officials and officers the code enforcement officer may request and shall receive the assistance and cooperation of other officers of the city in the discharge of his or her duties f liability the code enforcement officer when acting in good faith and without malice in the performance of his or her duties shall not be held personally liable for any damage that may accrue to persons or property as a result of any act or by reason of any act or omission in the discharge of his or her duties suits brought against the code enforcement officer shall be defended by legal counsel provided by the city until final termination of such proceedings by enforcing the building codes the city shall not be held liable for damages to persons or property or assume any responsibility as a result of the inspections authorized by this chapter or any certificates of completionoccupancy issued under this chapter amended during supplement #1  part   2 5102016   designation of unfit buildings and dwellings and procedures for condemnation a whenever the code enforcement officer or health officer finds any building or dwelling or part thereof to be in his or her judgment so old dilapidated decayed out of repair vermin infested lacking in illumination and ventilation decaying unsafe unsanitary or otherwise unfit for human habitation occupancy or use he or she shall condemn the property and after notification of his supervisor shall placard it as such the code enforcement officer or health officer shall not be prohibited from taking independent action when in his or her judgment an immediate threat to life or safety exists 1 any building or dwelling placarded as unfit for human habitation or use shall be vacated within thirty 30 days or less as determined by the code enforcement officer or health officer 2 no person shall deface or remove the placard from any building or dwelling which has been condemned except as provided in subdivision 3 of this subsection 3 no building or dwelling which has been condemned and placarded as unfit for human habitation shall again be used for human habitation until written approval is secured from and such placard is removed by the code enforcement officer or health officer the code enforcement officer or health officer shall remove such placard when he or she determines that the conditions upon which the condemnation was predicated are eliminated b the owner shall be notified in writing of the placarding the conditions which warranted such action and the options noted herein for correcting the violations 1 if a building or dwelling or part thereof can be made habitable by repairs the owner may with approval from the code enforcement officer or the health officer make it safe and sanitary 2 if the building or dwellings is ordered to be razed such order and proceedings shall be as provided in wisconsin statutes c any person affected by any notice or order relating to the condemning and placarding of a building or dwelling may request and shall be granted a hearing on the matter as provided in of this code d nothing herein shall be construed as conflicting in any way with appropriate codes of the state and wherever such conflict exists the more restrictive code shall apply part   building permits fees and inspections a permits required 1 no building or any part thereof shall be erected or ground broken for the same within the city except as herein provided until a permit therefor has first been obtained by the owner or his or her authorized agent from the code enforcement officer 2 additions alterations and repairs additions alterations or repairs to any building within the city shall require a building permit and be made to comply with current codes as determined by the code enforcement officer who shall consider issues of life safety structural or occupancy overload and other hazards b exempt work a building permit is not required for the following work 1 onestory detached accessory structures not on a permanent foundation and under one hundred fifty 150 square feet in projected roof area  all accessory structures shall be anchored and shall maintain all setback requirements per title 17 of this municipal code  2 fences less than or equal to six feet in height see title 17 of this municipal code for the requirements of fences greater than six feet in height  3 landscape retaining walls which do not affect the structural integrity of a structure  4 platforms patios and walks set on or within eight inches of finished grade  5 decorating work such as painting papering or carpeting  6 minor repairs and alterations which do not change occupancy area structural strength fire protection ingress and egress natural light and ventilation  7 replacement of roof covering  8 replacement or repair of bathroom fixtures and faucets  9 replacement of electrical outlets and light fixtures  10 replacement of siding  11 replacement of doors and windows  12 replacement of water heaters  13 replacement of furnaces boilers or air conditioners  14 replacement of driveways and parking lots  15 installation of bypass water meters and backflow preventers c application application for a building permit shall be made in writing upon a form furnished by the city and shall state the following 1 the name and address of the property owner  2 the legal description of the land upon which the building is located or the street address assigned by engineering  3 the name and address of the designer general contractor subcontractors and such other information as the code enforcement officer may require d plans for all construction pertaining to oneand twofamily dwellings two complete sets of plans and specifications including a site plan showing the location of the proposed building with respect to adjoining streets alleys lot lines and other buildings located on the property shall be submitted with an application for a building permit one set of plans to be returned after approval as herein provided and the other set to remain on file with the code enforcement officer 1 for buildings required to comply with the state commercial codes a single set of original plans bearing a stamp of approval from the state department of commerce and the signature of the engineer or architect shall be submitted as a condition of the building permit 2 the site plan shall show positive drainage away from all buildings the site plan shall also indicate the elevation of all property lines the elevations of the driveway and adjacent street and the elevation of the garage floor or parking lot the new garage floor must be elevated above or below the front property line such that the slope of the driveway is between two 2 and fifteen 15 percent the elevation of the front property line shall meet the existing or proposed sidewalk elevations as established by the city engineers office e waiver of plans if the code enforcement officer finds that the character of the work is sufficiently described in the application he or she may waive the filing of plans for alterations or repairs if he or she determines that the work is such that compliance can be gained without the submission of detailed plans f approval of plans if the code enforcement officer determines that the proposed building will comply with all ordinances of the city and all applicable laws and orders of the state he or she shall officially approve and stamp one set of the plans and return it to the owner and shall issue a building permit therefor which shall be kept and displayed at the site of the proposed building after approval the plans and specifications shall not be altered in any respect which involves the safety of the building or occupants except with written consent of the code enforcement officer if adequate plans are presented for part of the building only the code enforcement officer may issue a permit for that portion of the building only before receiving plans and specifications for the entire building g retention of plans 1 the applicant shall keep a set of plans approved by the code enforcement officer available at the construction site at all times while work is in progress for use by the contractors and the code enforcement officer 2 the issuance of approved plans shall not lessen the responsibility of the owner or contractor to build to the provisions of this chapter the code enforcement officer shall require any violations or errors in such plans or work resulting from same to be corrected h responsibility for posting permit card any homeowner contractor or subcontractor working on a job shall insure that a building permit card is posted at the site before starting any work i relationship to housing person constructing a building within the city intended for occupancy by third persons which would require any permit or license under of this municipal code shall be advised that the specifications and design standards contained in including but not limited to all room sizes and egress requirements shall be adhered to if the owner or applicant intends to later obtain any necessary licenses or permits to rent or lease such building j fees fees shall be approved by the common council and on file with the city clerk 1 schedule a building permit fee schedule shall be kept on file at the community development department payment of fees shall be prerequisite to issuance of a building permit 2 new construction alterations additions and repairs the fees for all new construction alterations additions and repairs required under this chapter shall be in accordance with the current fee schedule 3 plan check fee when a plan is required to be reviewed for financing or other purposes but no permit is requested a plan check fee according to the current fee schedule shall be paid to the city if a permit is requested within six 6 months of the review the fee shall be applied toward permit fees 4 signs fees for sign permits shall be calculated in accordance with title 17 of this municipal code 5 voluntary inspection the fee for conducting a voluntary inspection of an existing structure upon the request of an owner or lawful occupant shall be charged according to the current fee schedule k inspection of work 1 all inspections required to enforce this chapter shall be performed by the code enforcement officer he or she shall notify the permit holder andor owner of any noted violations these include erosion footings foundation roughin inspections for general construction framing electrical plumbing hvac drain tiles insulation and finaloccupancy inspection 2 the building permit holder or an authorized representative shall in writing or orally request inspections of the city which are noted herein the code enforcement officer shall perform the requested inspections within two business days after notification except the final inspection for purposes of occupancy see also subsection m of this section 3 all inspections shall be performed prior to concealment of each phase of construction exception construction may proceed if the inspection has not taken place within two business days of notification except if otherwise agreed between the applicant and the code enforcement officer l inspection record the building permit card shall be conveniently located on the construction site as required under this chapter to allow the code enforcement officer to record inspections its location shall be such that any person seeing the work in progress can also reasonably determine that a proper permit is issued work shall not proceed beyond the indicated stage on the permit card without the approval of the code enforcement officer m final inspection certificate of occupancy completion upon completing the final inspection the code enforcement officer shall sign and date the occupancy category on the building permit card the signed building permit card shall then serve as the certificate of
