occupancycompletion 1 new residential construction no occupancy shall be allowed prior to the completion of the final inspection 2 additions and alterations no occupancy andor use of the area affected by the building permit shall be allowed prior to the completion of the final inspection n voluntary inspection the code enforcement officer at the request of an owner or a lawful occupant may enter and inspect a building subject to the provisions of chapters 1504 to ascertain compliance with those codes 1 this inspection shall be specific to the code items in question by the owner and shall not serve as a general point of sale inspection or as verification or confirmation of the disclosure statement which is required of the seller pursuant to ch 709 wis stats 2 if any violations are noted during the voluntary inspection which are directly related to the specific areas in question the owner or authorized agent of the owner shall be required to obtain all required permits and to correct the violations 3 per this chapter the property owner shall disclose all orders to correct outstanding violations of this chapter and chapters 1508 of this municipal code amended during supplement #1  part  6222010   demolition permits a deposits a refundable deposit as determined by the community development department utilities and engineering may be required prior to the issuance of a demolition razing permit to insure proper abandonment of water and sewer facilities electrical service the restoration of the building site and any repairs to the street sidewalks or curb and gutter caused by the demolition utility department staff shall inspect and sign off on the disconnecting or temporary abandonment of electrical service and water and sewer lines the municipal utility shall specify the manner in which the disconnection or abandonment shall be conducted b time limits water and sewer lines shall be properly abandoned within ten 10 days of the permit issuance all work and restoration of the site including city property shall be completed within sixty 60 days failure of the applicant to complete the required work shall constitute forfeiture to the city of costs incurred by the city to complete the required work if the costs incurred by the city exceed the deposit amount the owner andor applicant shall be responsible for the additional expenses c fee the fee for a demolition razing permit shall be in accordance with the current building permit fee schedule and shall be in addition to the deposit required in subsection a of this section d site cleanup as part of the demolition project all building components and materials associated with the building including but not limited to foundation footings gas or oil storage tanks and abandoned appliances shall be removed from the site in an approved manner e inspection an inspection must be completed by the code enforcement officer or the appropriate inspection agency prior to the backfilling of open excavations part   electrical permits and inspections all electrical work including the placing of wires and other equipment shall conform to wis adm of this municipal code no electric wiring or other equipment shall be installed or altered without first securing a permit as provided in of this municipal code amended during supplement #1  part   2 5102016   plumbing permits and inspections all plumbing shall be done in compliance with of this municipal code part   issuance of permits a payment of fees all fees shall be paid upon application to the city and shall be nonrefundable the building permit shall be issued by the code enforcement officer after review and approval of the application and any required documentation b permit lapses a permit issued under this chapter shall lapse and be void unless operations under the permit are commenced within six months from the date of issuance additionally a building permit issued pursuant to  of this chapter shall be valid for a period of two years within such time the construction shall be completed and a certificate of compliance issued subject to a reasonable extension thereof as provided in of this municipal code c exception a permit issued for moving a building shall be good for a period of six months from the date of issuance d revocation if the code enforcement officer finds at any time that the provisions of this chapter are not being complied with and that the holder of the permit refuses to conform after a written warning or instruction has been issued the code enforcement officer shall revoke the building hvac electrical or plumbing permit by written notices posted at the site of the work when any permit is revoked no further work shall be done until the permit is reissued except such work as the code enforcement officer may order as a condition to the reissuance of the permit or as he or she may require for the preservation of human life and safety e reporting of violations all officers of the city shall report at once to the code enforcement officer any building hvac electrical or plumbing work which is being carried on without a permit as required by this municipal code f records the code enforcement officer shall keep a record of all permits fees and inspections under this chapter and shall make an annual report thereon to the city council part   moving permit a required no building shall be moved from outside of the city limits onto a lot piece or parcel of land within the city limits nor shall any building be moved from a lot piece or parcel of land within the city limits without the person desiring to move such building having first obtained a moving permit from the code enforcement officer b exempt a structure that is loaded to meet dot requirements and will not cause local road damage may be moved without a moving permit if a structure is of sufficient size to cause a traffic problem a permit will be required c review and approval of application the code enforcement officer will review the application and all required documentation submitted by the owner or mover the documentation shall include but not be limited to approvals from the following agencies  river falls municipal utilities the department of transportation zoning engineering police natural and propane gas companies cable companies phone companies and tree services upon receipt of such approvals and the appropriate fees andor deposits the code enforcement officer may issue the permit d application the application forms for a moving permit shall be provided by the code enforcement officer e conditions on alterations 1 where the applicant proposes to move and alter a building in addition to obtaining the required building permits the community development department shall designate a time within which the alterations must be completed failure to complete alterations in such designated time shall constitute a violation of this chapter and each day in which such alterations remain uncompleted shall be a separate violation 2 the foundation for a moved building and reconnected heating plumbing and electric systems shall be made to comply to current building codes as determined by the code enforcement officer at the applicants option a voluntary inspection preinspection will be conducted and a list of potential repairs noted f movers responsibility applicants shall be responsible for all expenses associated with moving a building including but not limited to public safety utility relocation street repair and any damages to public property and shall as part of the application process hold and save the city harmless for all damages or injuries that may result from moving a building in addition the applicant shall prior to receiving a permit deposit with the city the sum of five hundred dollars $500 or such greater amount as may be determined by the community development department and utilities sufficient to cover the costs of any utility or other work necessary to permit moving the building posting a deposit does not relieve the applicant of any liability for costs and damages exceeding the amount of the deposit upon the completion of the move the city and utility shall determine any damages caused by the move the ownerapplicant shall be responsible for all costs incurred by the city and utility including the repair caused to the street and any public or private property along with any other costs associated with the move should the applicant fail to reimburse the city for such expenses and settle damage claims the city and utility shall apply the deposit and release the balance to the applicant g fee the permit fee for moving a structure shall be in accordance with the current fee schedule h display and term of permit a moving permit issued under the provisions of this chapter shall be prominently displayed at all times on the building to be moved or to be moved and altered until all conditions established by the city have been complied with such permit shall be good for a period of six months from the date of issuance i appeal any person aggrieved by the granting or denial of a moving permit by the code enforcement officer may appeal to the board of appeals the board of appeals in the absence of proof to the contrary adduced in such hearing shall deem the refusal to grant such moving permit to be based on the inability of the building to meet the findings required by subsection e of this section for approval by the code enforcement officer j violation each day that a building which has been moved in violation of this chapter remains on any site other than its original site shall constitute a separate violation of this chapter part   construction of buildings a state codes adopted 1 one and twofamily the wisconsin uniform dwelling chapters sps 320 to 325 wis adm all amendments thereto is made by reference a part of this chapter with respect to those classes of buildings to which the uniform dwelling applies a copy of such uniform dwelling available at the public library dwellings constructed prior to the wisconsin uniform dwelling  additions and the portion of existing dwellings which are being altered shall be made to comply with the current udc requirements as per a2 2 commercial buildings chapters sps 361 to 365 wis adm all amendments and references thereto and contained therein are made by reference a part of this chapter b twin home construction 1 setbackfire walls each singlefamily dwelling unit constructed as part of a twin home for the purpose of separate ownership of each dwelling unit shall be provided with a onehour rated fire wall at the common property line the fire wall shall extend from the lowest point of the foundation to the underside of the roof sheathing and to the outermost projection of the eaves 2 sharing of foundation wall each singlefamily dwelling unit may share a single foundation wall composed of cement or masonry at the common property line c terms the building terms used in this chapter shall have the meaning given them in the code that applies to the structure or work in question where a conflict is present the most restrictive definition shall prevail d workmanship workmanship in the fabrication preparation and installation of materials shall conform to generally accepted good practice e applications buildings not covered under applicable state codes shall be constructed or altered in such a manner as to bring them as close as practical into compliance with the current codes and in such a manner as to not increase a fire or life safety problem amended during supplement #1  part   2 5102016   yard and setbacks yard and setbacks shall be as set forth in title 17 of this municipal code part   fire district the fire district shall be as set forth in of this municipal code part   regulations within fire district of this municipal code shall govern the erection enlargement or placing of any building within the fire district part   razing old andor damaged buildings in fire district any existing frame building within the fire limits which may hereafter be damaged by fire or which has deteriorated to an amount less than onehalf of its fair market value exclusive of the foundation shall not be repaired or rebuilt but shall under the provisions of  101141c wis stats be ordered removed by the code enforcement officer amended during supplement #1  part   installation of liquefied petroleum gas systems wis adm is made by reference a part of this chapter with respect to the installation of liquefied petroleum gas systems in the city and shall be enforced by the fire department andor a state inspector amended during supplement #1  part   2 5102016   existing supplemental heating units supplemental heating units chimneys and fireplaces judged by the code enforcement officer to be in violation of safe operating standards shall be tagged by the code enforcement officer as faulty the owner of faulty installations and the occupants of the dwelling unit shall be notified immediately upon inspection and advised of corrective action needed failure to take corrective action on faulty installations within the time frame ordered by the code enforcement officer shall constitute a violation of this section part   smoke detectors a any building occupied for sleeping purposes shall have smoke detectors installed and maintained in accordance with the laws of this state reference  sps 32109 ch sps 328 and  sps  wis admin no unauthorized person shall tamper with alter or remove any detector fire extinguisher fire apparatus or alarm from any building or unit required by this section or required by the laws of this state except for necessary testing or maintenance amended during supplement #1  part   2 5102016   building numbering required all buildings in the city shall be numbered in accordance with the following a numbers shall be easily seen from the street the building is addressed numbers shall be block style and a minimum of three inches in height unless otherwise specified the use of words to write out the required street number is not permitted the color of the numbers shall distinctly contrast the color of the covering they are placed on b multiple dwellings shall be identified with numbers which are a minimum of five inches in height and individual apartment identification shall be minimum of three inches in height c when practical the required numbers shall be placed as close to the main entry door as possible but not be placed on garage doors or in similar locations on the building that may become covered d buildings exempt from this requirement include secondary buildings if there is a properly numbered building on the same lot e in the event of conflict the code enforcement officer shall determine compliance f all new structures shall meet the minimum requirements of this section prior to occupancy being granted retroactive all existing structures shall meet the minimum requirements of this section part   disclosure pursuant to ch 709 wis stats the property owner shall disclose all orders to repair alter or correct outstanding violations of this chapter and chapters 1508 of this municipal code amended during supplement #1  part   violationpenalty except as otherwise provided any person found to be in violation of any of the provisions of this chapter or any order rule or regulation made hereunder shall be subject to a penalty as provided in of this municipal code each day an owner andor contractor willfully violates a provision of this chapter shall constitute a separate violation part   disclaimer this chapter shall not be construed as lessening the responsibility or liability of any person who engages in any activity falling within the provisions of this chapter for damages to persons or property part   appeals any person officer department board or bureau aggrieved by any decision of the administrative officers of the city under this chapter may obtain review of such determination under of this municipal code part   building contractor requirementsstate certification or proof of insurancebonding a all building contractors required to be certified by the state of wisconsin per wis adm must provide the city with proof of such certification prior to commencement of any building project within the city b with the exception of an owner of a dwelling who resides or will reside in a singlefamily dwelling all other building contractors unable to satisfy the requirements of subsection a of this section including contractors for commercial projects which fall under chapters sps 361 to 365 wis adm must provide the city with a completed building permit application and proof of general liability insurance minimum of two hundred fifty thousand dollars $25000000 or surety bond minimum of twentyfive thousand dollars $2500000 prior to the commencement of any project within the city amended during supplement #1  part   2 5102016   hvac contractorsstate certification required all hvac contractors must be registered with the state of wisconsin per wis adm code and provide the city with proof of such certification with the exception of an owner who currently resides in a singlefamily dwelling all livac work including the installation andor replacement of equipment and related duct work shall be performed by a certified hvac contractor amended during supplement #1  part   2 5102016 plumbing code state regulations adopted a adopted by reference 1 wis stats and the state plumbing sps 381 to 387 wis adm are adopted and by reference made a part of this chapter with the same force and effect as though set out in full failure to comply with any of the provisions of such regulations shall constitute a violation of this chapter punishable as provided herein 2 the city further emphasizes that backflow prevention pressure reducing values or similar state approved devices may be required by the city per the following reasons a to prevent contamination of public water distribution systems  b to assure that adequate pressures are maintained in private water systems b to be on file a copy of the state plumbing be on file in the office of the building inspector amended during supplement #1  prior code  1501   2 5102016   plumbing defined in this chapter plumbing means and includes a all piping fixtures appliances equipment devices and appurtenances in connection with the water supply water distribution and drainage systems including hot water storage tanks water softeners and water heaters connected with such water and drainage systems and the installation thereof  b the construction connection or installation of any drain or waste piping system from the outside or proposed outside foundation walls of any building to the mains or other sewerage system terminal within bounds of or beneath an area subject to easement for highway purposes including private domestic sewage treatment and disposal systems and the alteration of any such systems drains or waste piping  c the water service piping from the outside or proposed outside foundation walls of any building to the main or other water utility service terminal within bounds of or beneath an area subject to easement for highway purposes and its connections  d the water pressure systems other than municipal systems as provided in ch 145 wis stats  e a plumbing and drainage system so designed and vent piping so installed as to keep the air within the system in free circulation and movement  to prevent with a margin of safety unequal air pressures of such force as might blow siphon or affect trap seals or retard the discharge from plumbing fixtures or permit sewer air to escape into the building  to prohibit cross connection contamination or pollution of the potable water supply and distribution systems  and to provide an adequate supply of water to properly serve cleanse and operate all fixtures equipment appurtenances and appliances served by the plumbing system   prior code  1502   enforcement a general the building inspector shall enforce all provisions of this chapter and all other state and city provisions relating to the construction installation alteration and repair of all plumbing within the city and shall make such inspections perform such tests and issue such orders as may be necessary for such enforcement b authority to enter premises 1 in the discharge of his or her duties the building inspector or his or her authorized agent may enter any building upon presentation of the proper credentials during reasonable hours for the purpose of inspection and may require the production of any permit or license required hereunder no person shall interfere with the supervisor or his or her authorized agent while in the performance of his or her duties  and any person so interfering shall be in violation of this chapter and subject to a penalty as provided by  if consent to entry to personal or real properties which are not public buildings or to portions of public buildings which are not open to the public for inspection purposes has been denied the building inspector shall obtain a special inspection warrant under 1 2 and 3 wis stats c permits the building inspector or his or her authorized agent shall prepare suitable forms for permit applications and permits shall take applications and issue to qualified applicants permits as required for all work contemplated by this chapter and shall maintain suitable records of the permits issued he or she shall weekly submit permit fees collected by his or her office to the city treasurer d records and reports 1 to the city council the building inspector shall keep in his or her office a daily record of all the transactions of his or her office including permits issued and fees received and shall make such reports thereon to the city council as it may require 2 to the department of health and social services the building inspector shall make such reports to the department of health and social services as are required under 3 wis stats 3 record of special locations the building inspector shall insure that proper records are kept of all sewer and water connections and maps showing the locations of the same e stop work orders the building inspector may order work stopped on the construction installation alteration or repair of plumbing when such work is being done in violation of this chapter work so stopped shall not be resumed except with written permission of the building inspector provided if the stop work order is an oral one it shall be followed by a written order within a reasonable period of time f inspections it shall be the responsibility of the plumber in charge to notify the building inspector when work is ready for inspection as required in the state plumbing to notify the building inspector shall be considered a violation of this chapter amended during supplement #1  prior code  1503   plumbing permits a required no work contemplated by this chapter shall be started until a permit therefor has been obtained from the building inspector or his or her authorized agent provided no permit shall be required for minor repairs to faucets or the removal of stoppages in soil and waste pipes b application the application shall be in writing upon forms which the plumbing supervisor shall provide and shall include the name of the owner and the description of the property on which the work is to be done along with such pertinent information as the building inspector may require and shall state that the property owner and the applicant shall be bound by and subject to the provisions of this chapter c issuance term suspension and revocation when the building inspector is satisfied that the work proposed by the applicant can be done in conformity with the provisions of this chapter and after the appropriate fees have been paid to him or her he or she shall issue the permit such permit shall be good for the continuous performance of the work named thereon a permit shall automatically expire when work ceases for a period of sixty 60 days without good and reasonable cause for same and shall automatically expire on completion of the work for which it was issued  provided the building inspector may upon notice suspend or revoke such permit for violation of the provisions of this chapter d restrictions on issuance 1 no plumbing permit shall be issued to any person who is in violation of this chapter until such violation has been corrected 2 no plumbing permit shall be issued to any person against whom an order issued by the building inspector is pending provided this restriction may be waived by the building inspector e appeals for failure to issuesuspension and revocation any person directly interested who is aggrieved by the decision of the building inspector to refuse to issue a permit or to suspend or revoke such permit or to order work stopped under obtain review of such determination under of this municipal code 04   plumbers to be licensed all plumbing work shall be done only by a plumber licensed by the state for such work provided a property owner may make repairs or installations in a singlefamily building owned and occupied by him or her as his or her home if a permit therefor is issued and the work is done in compliance with the provisions of this chapter 05   registration of plumbers a all plumbers must be licensed by the state of wisconsin per ch sps 305 wis adm provide the city with proof of such state license and proof of general liability insurance minimum of two hundred fifty thousand dollars $25000000 or surety bond minimum of twentyfive thousand dollars $2500000 prior to the commencement of any plumbing work within the city b registration requirements limited the purpose of this section is solely to provide for the administration of state licensing requirements and this chapter no fee shall be charged by the city for the plumbers registration nor is any further information than that in subsection a of this section required part  prior code  1506   2 5102016 electrical code purpose the object and purpose of this chapter is to safeguard persons and property from hazards arising from the use of electrical energy by establishing minimum standards for the installation and maintenance of electrical equipment 01   state code and regulations adopted all electrical work including installations and alterations shall conform to ch sps 316 wis adm appropriate rules and regulations of the public service commission which are by reference made a part of this chapter a copy of the electrical code shall be kept on file in the office of the building inspector wisconsin public service commission rules and regulations shall be on file in the municipal utilities office amended during supplement #1  prior code  1602   2 5102016   permit no electrical wiring or other equipment shall be installed or altered without first securing a permit therefor from the building inspector except that repairs or replacements of broken or defective sockets switches or base receptacles may be made without a permit the application for such permit shall be on a form furnished by the building inspector and shall state clearly the work planned alterations to be made and equipment and materials to be used and all later deviations from such plans shall be submitted to and approved by the building inspector 03   fees fees for electric permits shall be as computed for permits in this municipal code 04   inspection of work after roughing in the wiring of any building and before any such work is covered up or upon completion of any outside wiring construction work the person doing such work shall notify the building inspector who shall at once inspect the same upon completion of such wiring the inspector shall be notified and shall inspect the finished work failure to notify the building inspector shall constitute a violation no electrical equipment shall be used except for temporary emergency use until approved by the building inspector if no inspection is made within fortyeight 48hours exclusive of holidays saturdays and sundays after notification construction may be completed and the wiring covered up 05   licenses all electrical contractors must be licensed by the state of wisconsin per ch sps 305 wis adm must provide the city with proof of such state license prior to the commencement of any electrical work within the city 06 part   1 6262018   electrical contractorsstate certification required all electricians engaged in the business of installing altering or repairing any electrical wiring fixtures or apparatus in the city must hold a license or certification as a licensed electrical contractor by the state of wisconsin per ch sps 30541 wis adm provide the city with proof of such state certification prior to the commencement of any electrical work within the city part prior code  16061   2 5102016   2 6262018   reserved editors note  3 adopted  repealed   which pertained to public liability insurance and derived from prior code  1608   affidavit requirement all qualified electricians or electrical firms performing any installation or alteration of electrical systems served by the city municipal electric utility shall upon completion of the work file an affidavit certifying that the work was performed by a qualified licensed electrician and that the work completed conforms to wisconsin state electric the wisconsin public service commission utility service rules and to the municipal code 09   inspections a dangerous wires or equipment whenever the building inspector finds wires or equipment in a dangerous condition or so placed as to interfere with the work of the fire department he or she may order the persons using or operating the same to place them in a safe and noninterfering condition within fortyeight 48 hours and on failure to comply with such order or direction the inspector shall order such wires disconnected failure to comply with such orders shall constitute a violation of this chapter any person who resists or obstructs any lawful exercise of authority by the inspector shall be subject to the penalty provided in this chapter b right of entry the building inspector shall have the authority to enter any building or premises at any reasonable hour in the discharge of his or her duties he or she shall also have the authority to enter any building used in whole or in part for the purpose of public assemblage when occupied by the public or at any time in order to examine electrical equipment in such building 10   interpretation this chapter shall not be construed to relieve or lessen the responsibility or liability of any person supplying electricity to or selling renting leasing owning using operating controlling installing altering repairing removing replacing disturbing connecting disconnecting or maintaining any electrical equipment for damage to persons or property caused by any defect therein or therefrom  nor by reason of the issuance of or revocation of any permit or the inspection or reinspection authorized by this chapter or by reason of the approval or disapproval of any electrical equipment sales rentals drawings plans specifications materials samples test reports literature information or schedules authorized in this chapter nor shall the city be held liable for any damages resulting from the enforcement of this chapter any act done by any person appointed to carry out the duties or obligations under this chapter or their representatives shall be given the same rights immunities and privileges as the city 11 housing code purpose since there are or may be in the future dwelling structures which are so dilapidated unsafe dangerous unhygienic or unsanitary as to constitute a menace to the health and safety of the people of this city this chapter is enacted for the following purposes a to establish minimum standards governing supplied utilities and facilities and other physical things and conditions essential to make rental dwellings safe sanitary and fit for human habitation these minimum standards shall also include all standards covered by chapters 1504   b to fix certain responsibilities of owners and occupants of dwellings and the condemnation of dwellings unfit for human habitation  c to coordinate the activities and functions of the code enforcement officer and health officer of the city  d to fix penalties for violations and a time when the same shall take effect part   definitions the following definitions shall apply in the interpretation and enforcement of this chapter except that whenever the words dwelling dwelling unit rooming house rooming unit or premises are used in this chapter they shall be construed as though they were followed by the words or a part thereof basement means that portion of a dwelling below the first floor or ground floor with its entire floor below grade officer means the authorized representative of the city certified by the state of wisconsin or his or her authorized representative dwelling means a building or portion thereof including a trailer or mobilehome designed or used exclusively for residential occupancy including onefamily twofamily and multiplefamily dwelling units but not including motels hotels or temporary housing dwelling unit means a structure or that part of a structure which is used or intended to be used as a home residence or sleeping place efficiency apartment means a dwelling unit with minimal kitchen and bath facilities and whose habitable areas are not separated by walls the tenant occupancy limit for an efficiency unit is determined per the requirements of a extermination means the control and elimination of insects rodents or other pests by eliminating their harborage places by removing or making inaccessible materials which may serve as their food by poisoning spraying fumigating trapping or by other recognized and legal pest elimination methods family means two or more persons related by blood or marriage fraternity for the purposes of the housing code is considered to be under the requirements of a rooming house as approved by the state commercial garbage means solid animal and vegetable wastes resulting from the domestic and commercial handling preparation cooking and dispensing or consumption of food and from the handling storage and sale of produce grandfathered for the purposes of this code section means any dwelling used for rental purposes prior to  the effective date of the city municipal housing code guest means a temporary invitee residing in a dwelling unit for a period up to but not exceeding fourteen 14 days within any three month period the tenants shall be liable for any property damage waste or neglect caused by the negligence or improper use of the premises habitable room means any room used for sleeping living or dining purposes excluding such enclosed spaces as kitchens closets pantries bath or toilet rooms hallways laundries storage spaces utility rooms and similar spaces health officer means the health officer of the city or his or her authorized representative infestation means the presence within or around a dwelling of any insects or rodents license means a written formal permit which gives authorization to the holder thereof manufactured dwelling means any structure or component thereof which is intended for use as a dwelling and is of closed construction and is fabricated or assembled on site or off site in manufacturing facilities for installation connection or assembly and installation at a building site or is a building of open construction which is fabricated or assembled in manufacturing facilities away from the building site for installation connection or assembly and installation on the building site and for which certification is sought by the manufacturer mobilehome means a prefabricated unit with walls of rigid construction that is designed to be towed as a single unit or in sections upon a highway by a motor vehicle and that is used or intended to be used for human habitation multiple dwelling means a dwelling designed and approved for and containing three or more dwelling units occupant means any person living in or having actual possession of a dwelling unit or rooming unit owner means any individual firm association copartnership corporation trust or any other legal entity who alone jointly or severally with others holds sufficient proprietary interest person means any individual firm trust partnership public or private association or corporation company organization municipality joint stock company society group joint venture unincorporated association county or state agency within wisconsin the federal government or any combination thereof plumbing means piping fixtures appliances appurtenances devices and systems as defined in state statutes refuse see garbage rental income means payment or other considerations including but not limited to housesitting babysitting elderly care housework lawn care and general maintenance exceptions must be reviewed and approved by the city attorney and the code enforcement officer rooming unit means a single room rented as sleeping and living quarters without cooking facilities or eating purposes and with or without an individual bathroom in a suite of rooms without cooking facilities each room which provides sleeping accommodations shall be counted as one rooming unit rooming house means a dwelling approved under ch comm 57 wis adm any grandfathered dwelling containing six or more rooming units which are let for pay or other considerations it is intended that fraternities cooperatives communes or other unchartered groups of people be included under this definition for the purposes of this code any grandfathered dwelling with five or less roomers will be categorized as a singlefamily dwelling unit rubbish means combustible or noncombustible waste materials except garbage and shall include the residue from the burning of wood coal coke and other combustible materials paper rags cartons boxes wood excelsior rubber leather tree branches yard trimmings leaves tin cans metals mineral matter glass crockery or dust supplies means paid for furnished or provided by or under the control of the owner or manager temporary housing means any tent trailer or other structure used for human shelter which is designed to be transportable and which is not attached to the ground to another structure or to any utilities system on the same premises for more than thirty 30 consecutive days trash see rubbish voluntary inspection means an inspection completed by a code enforcement officer upon the request of a potential owner of a property which is not currently licensed by the city for rental purposes for adherence to the current municipal housing code upon taking ownership all noted corrections must be completed within thirty 30 days or a time period determined by the code enforcement officer as part of the requirements for obtaining a housing license  2  amended during supplement #1  part   inspection of dwellings dwelling units rooming units and premises the code enforcement officer shall determine the condition of dwellings dwelling units and premises located within the city in order that he or she may perform his or her duty of safeguarding the health and safety of the occupants of dwellings and the general public for the purpose of making such inspections the code enforcement officer may enter examine and survey at proper times upon receipt of verbal authorization to or after twelve 12 hours notice to the owner andor occupant all dwelling units rooming units and premises the owner andor occupant of every dwelling unit and rooming unit or the person in charge shall give the code enforcement officer access to such dwelling dwelling unit or rooming unit and its premises at reasonable times after due notice for the purpose of each inspection examination and survey every occupant of a dwelling unit or dwelling shall give the owner thereof or his or her agent or employee access to any part of such dwelling or dwelling unit or its premises at all reasonable times for the purpose of making such repairs or alterations as are necessary to effect compliance with the provisions of this chapter part   enforcement a notice of violation whenever the code enforcement officer or health officer determines that there has been a violation of any provision of this chapter he or she shall give notice of such violation to the person or persons responsible therefor and to any known agent of such person as therein after provided such notice shall 1 note in writing the violations that exist  2 allow a reasonable time up to thirty 30 days as determined by the code enforcement officer for the performance of any act it requires an extension may be granted at the discretion of the code enforcement officer if substantial progress towards compliance has been documented  3 be served upon the owner or his or her agent or the occupant as the case may require  provided that such notice shall be deemed to be properly served if a copy thereof is served upon any of the above personally or if a copy is sent by registered mail to his or her last known address or if a copy is posted in a conspicuous place in or about the dwelling affected by the notice or if he or she is served with such notice by any other method authorized or required under the laws of this state 4 such notice shall contain an outline of remedial action which if taken shall affect compliance with the provision of this chapter b hearing any person affected by any such notice issued by the code enforcement officer or health officer may request and shall be granted a hearing in the matter as provided in of this code c emergency orders whenever the code enforcement officer or health officer finds that an emergency exists which requires immediate action to protect the public health or safety he or she may without notice or hearing issue an order reciting the existence of such an emergency and require that such action be taken as he or she deems necessary to meet the emergency notwithstanding the other provisions of this chapter such order shall be effective immediately d all hvac work and construction projects requiring a building permit must be completed by certified contractors per e all plumbing work shall be performed by a licensed plumber per exception the repair or replacement of faucets and fixtures may be completed by the owner or occupant f all electrical work shall be performed by a licensed electrician per exception the replacement of electrical outlets and light fixtures may be completed by the owner or occupant part   minimum standards for basic equipment and facilities no person shall let to another for occupancy any dwelling or dwelling unit for the purpose of living sleeping cooking or eating therein which does not comply with the following requirements a every dwelling unit shall contain a kitchen sink in good working condition and properly connected to a water and sanitary sewer system approved by the state plumbing inspector andor code enforcement officer b every dwelling unit shall contain a room with its walls separate from the habitable room or rooms which affords privacy and security to a person within and which is equipped with a flush water closet a lavatory basin and a bathtub or shower and the necessary fixtures and accessories therefor in good working condition and properly connected to hot and cold water lines and sanitary sewer system approved by the code enforcement officer c every dwelling unit shall be supplied with adequate rubbish and garbage storage facilities that are structurally sound and have tight fitting covers number and size shall be as follows 1 one and twofamily residences shall have containers as specified by of this municipal code in sufficient number to adequately store the rubbish and garbage generated without spillage 2 multiplefamily residences shall have container space available equal to or greater than 04 cubic yards eighty 80 gallons per dwelling unit 3 other uses shall be supplied with rubbish and garbage storage facilities of adequate size and number such that the rubbish and garbage generated can be stored with covers closed and without spillage 4 the code enforcement officer or health officer may require greater storage requirements than those stated herein if in his or her judgment the minimum requirements as stated prove to be inadequate in specific instances d every dwelling unit shall have safe unobstructed means of egress leading to safe and open space at ground level as defined by the wis adm all bedrooms or rooming units shall have at least one operable door or window or which opens to the outdoors the window shall allow a clear opening of twenty 20 inches by twentyfour 24 inches for egress or rescue the window sill shall be within fortysix 46 inches of the floor and the window sash and stormscreen shall be openable from the inside without the use of tools the removal of the sash or special knowledge 1 if an existing window is used to meet the egress requirement and the sill does not meet the maximum allowable height above the floor of fortysix 46 inches an approved permanent steps must be provided below the window 2 if the door or window is located below grade an approved areaway shall be installed 3 coverings that prevent rain and snow from entering the areaway are allowable as long as egress or rescue can be achieved without the use of separate tools or special knowledge f hot water requirements every dwelling unit shall be supplied with water heating facilities which are installed in an approved manner properly maintained and capable of heating water to such a temperature as to permit an adequate amount of water to be drawn at every required kitchen sink lavatory basin bathtub shower and laundry facility or other similar units at a temperature of not less than one hundred ten 110 degrees and no greater than one hundred twentyfive 125 degrees per the ch sps 382 wis adm ch 704 wis stats g minimum number of electrical outlets andor fixtures per room 1 every habitable room of a dwelling unit shall contain at least three separate and remote outlets a wall switched light fixture may be counted as one of the three required outlets 2 every public hall bathroom laundry room or furnace room shall contain at least one electric outlet in addition to a light fixture 3 every furnacemechanical room shall be provided with a light fixture h screen requirements from may 1st to october 1st every door opening directly from a dwelling unit to outdoor space shall have supplied and installed screens and a selfclosing device and every window or other device with openings to outdoor space used or intended to be used for ventilation shall likewise be supplied with screens installed i smoke detectors any building occupied for sleeping purposes shall have smoke detectors installed and maintained in accordance with no unauthorized person shall tamper with alter or remove any detector fire extinguisher fire apparatus or alarm from any building or unit required by except for necessary testing or maintenance j building numbering required all buildings in the city shall be numbered in accordance with amended during supplement #1  part   2 5102016   minimum standards for light ventilation and heating no person shall let to another for occupancy any dwelling or dwelling unit for the purpose of living therein which does not comply with the following requirements a every habitable room shall have at least one window or skylight facing directly to the outdoors the minimum total window area measured between stops for every habitable room shall be eight percent of the floor area of such room b every habitable room shall have at least one window or skylight which can be easily opened the total clear opening window area in every habitable room shall be equal to not less than three and a half percent of the floor area habitable rooms other than bedrooms without openable windows may be provided with a balanced mechanical ventilation system producing one air change per hour of fresh outside air while the room is occupied c every bathroom and water closet compartment shall have five percent clear opening window or skylight area except that no window or skylight shall be required in bathrooms and water closet compartments equipped with a mechanical ventilation system as defined in the wis adm every dwelling shall have heating facilities which are properly installed and maintained and are capable of safely and adequately heating all habitable rooms bathrooms and water closet compartments in every dwelling unit located therein to a temperature of at least seventy 70 degrees fahrenheit at a distance of thirty 30 inches above floor level under ordinary minimum winter conditions e every public hall and stairway in every rental unit shall be lighted in conformity with the national electrical every basement bedroom shall receive natural light and shall be ventilated according to wis adm every basement or cellar window used or intended to be used for ventilation and every other opening to a basement which might provide an entry for rodents or insects shall be supplied with a screen or such other device as will effectively prevent their entrance g all hvac work including the installation of new or replacement heating or cooling equipment associated electrical or plumbing work and the installation of new or replacement ductwork shall be performed by an hvac contractor credentialed by the state of wisconsin changing of filters or grilles may be performed by the owner or occupants part   general requirements relating to the safe and sanitary maintenance of parts of dwellings and dwelling units no person shall let to another for occupancy any dwelling or dwelling unit for the purpose of living therein which does not comply with the following a every foundation floor wall ceiling and roof shall be reasonably weather tight watertight and rodent proof shall be capable of affording privacy and security and shall be kept in good repair b every window skylight exterior door and basement hatchway shall be reasonably weather tight watertight secure and rodent proof and shall be kept in sound working condition and good repair c every inside and outside stair every porch corridor and every appurtenance thereto shall be so constructed as to support eighty 80 pounds per square feet in commercial applications and forty 40 pounds per square feet in oneandtwo family applications d every plumbing fixture and waste water pipe shall be properly installed and maintained in good sanitary working condition free from defects leaks and obstructions e every water closet compartment floor surface and bathroom floor surface shall be constructed and maintained to be impervious to water and to permit such floor to be easily kept in clean and sanitary condition f every appliance or facility piece of equipment or utility which is required under this chapter or supplied by the landlords shall be so constructed or installed as to function safely and effectively and shall be maintained in satisfactory working condition g no owner manager or occupant shall cause any service facility equipment or utility which is required under this chapter to be removed from or shut off from or discontinued for any occupied dwelling let or occupied by him or her except for such temporary interruption as may be necessary while actual repair or alterations are in progress or during temporary emergencies or when discontinuance of service is approved by the code enforcement officer or health officer h no owner shall let to any other occupant any vacant dwelling unit unless it is clean sanitary and fit for human occupancy part   minimum space and occupancy requirements no person shall let to another for occupancy any dwelling or dwelling unit for the purpose of living therein which does not comply with the following requirements a every dwelling unit shall contain a minimum gross floor area of not less than one hundred fifty 150 square feet for the first occupant one hundred 100 square feet for the second occupant and seventyfive 75 square feet for each additional occupant the floor area shall be calculated on the basis of the total area of all habitable rooms b in every dwelling unit of two or more habitable rooms every room occupied for sleeping purposes by one occupant shall contain at least eighty 80 square feet of floor space every room occupied for sleeping purposes by more than one occupant shall contain at least forty 40 square feet of additional floor space for each occupant over twelve 12 years and at least an additional thirty 30 square feet of additional floor space for each occupant under twelve 12 years 1 exception the occupancy for efficiency apartments shall be determined per the requirements of subsection a of this section c at least onehalf of the floor area of every habitable room shall have a ceiling height of a least seven feet and the floor area of that part of any room where the ceiling height is less than five feet shall not be considered as part of the floor area in computing the total floor area of the room for the purpose of determining the maximum permissible occupancy thereof d no dwelling unit as defined in shall be occupied by more than one of the following 1 one family as defined in provided that the family does not exceed the maximum allowable occupants as determined under and subject to subsections a and b above 2 in an r1 zoning district up to four unrelated persons as determined under and subject to subsections a and b above 3 in all other zoning districts up to five unrelated persons as determined under and subject to subsections a and b above  4  part   responsibilities of owners and occupants a every owner of a dwelling unit shall be responsible for maintaining in a clean and sanitary condition the shared or public area of the dwelling and premises thereof b every owner of a dwelling or dwelling unit shall be responsible for hanging all screens whenever the same are required under provisions of this chapter or of any rule or regulation adopted pursuant thereto except where the occupant has agreed to supply such service c every owner of a dwelling containing a single dwelling unit shall be responsible for the extermination of any insects rodents or other pests therein or on the premises and every occupant of a dwelling unit in a dwelling containing more than one dwelling unit shall be responsible for such extermination whenever his or her dwelling unit is the only one infested notwithstanding the foregoing provisions of this subsection whenever infestation is caused by failure of the owner to maintain a dwelling in a rodent proof or reasonable insect proof condition extermination shall be the responsibility of the owner d every owner shall be responsible for providing furnace filters the owner shall also be responsible for the periodic changing of the filters except where the tenant has agreed to supply such service e every occupant of a dwelling or dwelling unit shall keep in a clean and sanitary condition that part of the dwelling dwelling unit and premises thereof which he occupies and controls f every occupant of a dwelling or dwelling unit shall dispose of all his rubbish in a clean and sanitary manner by placing it in the rubbish container required by g every occupant of a dwelling or dwelling unit shall dispose of all his garbage and any other organic waste which might provide food for rodents in a clean and sanitary manner by placing it in the garbage disposal facilities or garbage storage containers required by  the owner shall supply such facilities or containers for all rooming units located on the premises 2 in all other cases the occupant shall furnish such facilities or containers h every occupant of a dwelling unit shall keep all plumbing fixtures therein in a clean and sanitary condition and shall be responsible for the exercise of reasonable care in the proper use and operation thereof part   rooming houses no person shall operate a rooming house or shall occupy or let to another for occupancy any rooming unit in any rooming house except in compliance with the provisions of every section of this chapter a at least one flush water closet lavatory basin and bathtub or shower properly connected to a water and sanitary sewer system approved by the state plumbing inspector or the code enforcement officer shall be supplied for each six persons or fraction thereof residing within a rooming house established prior to  including members of the operators family wherever they share the use of such facilities 1 in a rooming house where rooms are let only to males tank system urinals of the floor resting type fixtures may be substituted for not more than onehalf of the required number of water closets 2 all such facilities shall be so located within the dwelling to be accessible from a common hall or passageway to all persons sharing such facilities b when bed linen is furnished the manager of every rooming house shall furnish clean bed linen and towels at least once a week and prior to the letting of any room to any occupant the manager shall be responsible for the maintenance of supplied bedding in a clean and sanitary manner c the occupant capacity for each individual sleeping area within a rooming house shall be determined per the requirements of b2 in a rooming house established prior to  the occupant capacity for every room occupied for sleeping purposes shall be determined per the requirements of b d every rooming unit shall have safe unobstructed means of egress leading to safe and open space at ground level as required per e the owner of every rooming house shall be responsible for the sanitary maintenance of all walls floors and ceilings and for maintenance of a sanitary condition in every other part of the rooming house and the entire premises part   rental dwelling unit permit application and fee schedule a no owner shall operate a dwelling unit producing rental income unless he or she holds a valid permit issued by the city in his or her name and for the specific dwelling unit the owner or his or her authorized agent shall apply to the office of the community development department for a permit b the application shall contain the following information 1 name of the property owner  2 address of the rental property  3 address of the owner if different from the property  4 name of the managercaretaker if applicable  5 the work and home phone number of the owner and of the managercaretaker if applicable  6 number of units within the building  7 provide an address where all correspondence to the permit may be forwarded the rental property address unless written notice is otherwise given to the city shall be considered the address of the permit and all mail forwarded to the permit at such address shall be conclusive as to its receipt by the permit c after an application has been filled out and the fee is paid the city shall then issue a permit the permit year shall commence on january 1 and shall end on the following january 31 and shall be renewed annually d the permit shall be displayed in a conspicuous place within the dwelling at all times e the city shall be promptly notified of any changes in the names addresses and other information concerning the persons listed in the last housing permit application the owner of any dwelling which is required to be permitted by this chapter shall prior to the time of sale of the dwelling notify the buyer in writing of all unabated orders and outstanding violations which have been noticed by the city as well as the ordinance requirement that the dwelling upon acquisition by a new owner must be permitted by the city a copy of the notification shall be mailed to the city within five days of furnishing the notification to the buyer if a corporation owns the dwelling an officer of the corporation shall carry out the notification required by this section if more than one person owns the property a notification by one of the owners shall satisfy this section for the purposes of this section time of sale shall be construed to mean when a written purchase agreement is executed by the buyer or in the absence of a purchase agreement upon the execution of any document providing for the conveyance of a dwelling requiring to be permitted f fee schedule the fee schedule for new and renewal permits shall be approved by the common council and shall be on file with the city clerk the permit fee shall be prerequisite to issuance of each permit g rental housing types are as follows 1 singlefamily  2 manufactured homemobile home  3 duplex  4 townhome  5 twinhome  6 condominium  7 rooming house  8 fraternities  9 multifamily apartments  10 home with apartments existing nonconformance this describes grandfathered dwellings with two or more apartments h transfer fee this fee shall be in accordance with the current rental permit fee schedule on file in the community development department i inspection fee the fee for conducting an inspection on a property for the purpose of determining compliance with the housing code shall be charged according to the current fee schedule part  7132010   designation of unfit dwellings and legal procedure for condemnation the designation of dwellings or dwelling units as unfit for human habitation and the procedure for the condemnation and placarding of such shall be carried out in compliance with the following requirements a any dwelling or dwelling unit which is found to have any of the following defects but not limited to shall be condemned as unfit for human habitation and shall be so designated and placarded by the code enforcement officer or the health officer 1 one which is so damaged decayed dilapidated unsanitary unsafe or vermin infested that it creates a serious hazard to the health or safety of the occupants or of the public  2 one which lacks illumination ventilation or sanitary facilities adequate to protect the health or safety of the occupants or of the public  3 one which because of its general condition or location is unsanitary or otherwise dangerous to the health or safety of occupants or of the public b any dwelling or dwelling unit condemned as unfit for human habitation and so designated and placarded by the code enforcement officer or health officer shall be vacated within thirty 30 day or less as determined by the code enforcement officer or health officer no person shall deface or remove the placard from any dwelling or dwelling unit which has been condemned as unfit for human habitation and placarded as such except as provided in subsection c of this section c no dwelling or dwelling unit which has been condemned and placarded as unfit for human habitation shall again be used for human habitation until written approval is secured from and such placard is removed by the code enforcement officer or health officer the code enforcement officer or health officer shall remove such placard whenever the defect or defects upon which the condemnation and placarding action were based have been eliminated d any person affected by any notice or order relating to the condemning and placarding of a dwelling or dwelling unit as unfit for human habitation may request and shall receive a hearing before the board of appeals under the procedure set forth in this chapter e nothing herein shall be construed as conflicting in any way with appropriate codes of the state and wherever such conflict exists the more restrictive code shall apply part   equal rights of all persons to fair and open housing a the city council adopts wisconsin statutes as amended and all subsequent amendments thereto b the officials and employees of the city shall assist in the orderly prevention and removal of all discrimination in housing within the city by implementing the authority and enforcement procedures set forth in wisconsin statutes as amended c the city clerk shall maintain forms for complaints to be filed under wisconsin statutes as amended and shall assist any person alleging a violation thereof in the city to file a complaint thereunder with the wisconsin department of workforce development equal rights division for enforcement of wisconsin statutes as amended amended during supplement #1   part   disclosure pursuant to ch 709 wis stats the owner of a rental property shall disclose all orders to repair alter or correct outstanding violations of this chapter and chapters 1504 of this municipal code amended during supplement #1  part   violationspenalties except as otherwise provided any person violating any of the terms of this chapter shall forfeit not less than one hundred dollars $100 nor more than two hundred dollars $200 together with the costs of prosecution  provided that for any violations of any condition in this chapter which can be corrected by modification or repair failure to correct or rectify such defect within a reasonable time as determined by the code enforcement officer or health officer shall constitute a separate violation for each day in which the violations exists and be subject to penalties herein provided if any licensee continues to operate rental property after suspension or revocation of the license each day of operation during that period shall be considered a separate violation of this chapter the code enforcement officer may revoke suspend terminate or discontinue any housing license or may refuse to issue reissue or renew any housing license which has been or may be issued under this chapter if the owner of the concerned premises has any taxes assessments forfeitures or any other claims of the city that are delinquent or unpaid as determined by the city clerk part certificates of compliance purpose the city council deems it to be in the public interest and in keeping with the health safety and welfare of the citizens and inhabitants of the city to require the issuance of a certificate of compliance certifying that the holder of a building permit or the subdivider of any lands within the corporate jurisdiction of the city has complied with all applicable local code provisions and has completed all improvements required by the local code 171   certificate required the holder of any building permit issued in accordance with of this municipal code or the subdivider of any land within the corporate jurisdiction of the city who has been granted the necessary approvals for the development of the subdivision shall obtain at the completion of the project a certificate of compliance from the building inspector of the city which shall certify that the constructed improvements comply and are in conformity with all applicable provisions of this municipal code at the request of the holder of the building permit or at the request of the subdivider the building inspector accompanied by support staff as he or she may deem necessary to make a determination shall inspect the premises for the purpose of determining total compliance with the applicable provisions of this municipal code 172   effect of certificate the issuance of the certificate of compliance shall be prima facie evidence of compliance with all applicable provisions of this municipal code and shall entitle the holder of the certificate to immediate occupancy of the premises and the conduct of business thereon failure to obtain a certificate of compliance shall prohibit the subdivider or owner of the premises from conducting business operations on the premises leasing or occupying the premises and in the case of subdividers shall prohibit the construction of any structures within the subdivision  provided however that nothing in this section shall prohibit an owner from carrying on regularly conducted business or occupancy of the premises that was being conducted or occupied prior to the issuance of the building permit during the period of construction 173   extensions if the holder of the building permit of a previously conducted business or previously occupied premises fails to secure a certificate of compliance within the time limitations of the building permit because of inadequate code compliance the building inspector shall notify such owner or occupant in writing of the deficiencies and grant a reasonable time to rectify the deficiencies not to exceed one year such that a certificate may be issued failure to so comply will allow the city to avail itself of the remedies contained in 174   penalties not exclusive the penalties contained in this chapter shall be in addition to any other penalties contained in this municipal code that apply to specific violations 175   appeals any person aggrieved by any decision of the administrative officers of the city under this chapter or who fails to secure a certificate of compliance within any extension period granted under may obtain review of such determination under of this municipal code 176 title 16  subdivisions chapters general provisions administration and enforcement purpose the purpose of this title is to promote the public health safety and general welfare of the community to lessen congestion in the streets and highways  to further the orderly layout and use of land  to secure safety from fire and other dangers  to provide adequate light and air  to avoid undue concentration of population  to facilitate provision for transportation water sewerage schools parks playgrounds and other public requirements  and to facilitate the further resubdivision of larger tracts into smaller parcels of land these regulations are made with reasonable consideration among other things of the character of the city with the view of conserving the value of the buildings placed upon land providing the best possible environment for human habitation and for encouraging the most appropriate use of land throughout the city 01   definitions the following definitions shall apply in this title act of division means the division of a lot or parcel of land into two or more parcels alley means a public rightofway shown on a plat which serves only a secondary means of access to abutting property bikeway means a general term describing any of the following defined types of facilities used for bikes 1 bike path means a paved area completely separated from the roadway designed for the exclusive use of bicycles 2 bike lane means a striped portion of the roadway reserved for bicycles which separates motorists from bicyclists certified survey map means a map or plan which has been prepared by a registered land surveyor in accord with all of the requirements of wis stats and this title city council means the city council of river falls comprehensive plan means the comprehensive plan adopted by the city of river falls in accord with wis stats together with any and all amendments thereto as adopted from time to time by the common council deadend street or streets begin at the point where a public street or public streets can be accessed by travel on only a singular segment of public street any intersection shall be considered a singular segment of public street figure 1604a dead ends 1 permanent dead end means that the current official map for the city does not include a public street planned for future construction that if built would result in changing the streets designation as a dead end 2 temporary dead end means that the current official map for the city includes a public street planned for future construction that if built would result in changing the streets designation as a dead end figure 1604b permanent and temporary dead end division of land means the process of creating two or more lots or parcels of land from one or more preexisting lot parcel or tract of land driveway means a vehicle access from private property to a public street extraterritorial plat approval jurisdiction means the unincorporated area within one and a half miles of the incorporated city limits of the city extraterritorial subdivision jurisdiction means the unincorporated area within three miles of the incorporated city limits of the city master plan means the comprehensive plan for guiding and shaping the growth and development of the citys community area including all of the component parts as prepared by the plan commission and certified to the city council minor subdivision means a division of land which creates no more than four lots or parcels of land official map means the map indicating the location width and extent of existing and proposed streets highways parkways parks and playgrounds as adopted by the city council outlot means a parcel of land other than a buildable lot or block so designated on the subdivision plat or certified survey map which is used to convey or reserve parcels of land outlots may be created to restrict a lot which is unbuildable due to high groundwater steep slope equal to or greater than twenty 20 percent or other physical constraints or to create common open space outlots may also be parcels of land intended to be converted to lots redivided into lots or combined with lots or outlots in adjacent land divisions in the future for the purpose of creating buildable lots an outlot shall not be used as a buildable lot unless it meets the design standards of the subdivision ordinance and has been converted to a lot subdivision process plan commission means the city plan commission plat means a map of a subdivision but does not include a subdivision by means of a certified survey map preliminary plat means a map showing the necessary features of a proposed subdivision submitted to the plan commission and other approving agencies for preliminary consideration replat and resubdivision means the process of changing or the map which changes the boundaries of a recorded plat or a part thereof resubdivision means any further subdivision of land which occurs after an initial division or a redivision of land previously divided which in accord with ch 236 wis stats and this title is subject to approval as a subdivision of land street means a public way for vehicular traffic whether designated as a street highway thoroughfare parkway thruway road avenue boulevard lane place or however otherwise designated street public public streets shall meet one of the following requirements 1 streets within rightofway that have previously been platted as public rightofway  2 streets within rightofway that will be platted as public rightofway in the plat under consideration  or 3 proposed streets that have been adopted as part of the official map streets arterial arterial streets means those streets which provide for rapid movement of concentrated volumes of traffic over relatively long distances including but not limited to 1 freeways and expressways means streets or highways which provide the major interstate and interregional traffic corridors and provide the highest mobility level and a high degree of access control 2 principal arterials means a road intended to move to and from major traffic generators such as central business districts colleges or universities major industrial areas or as a route for traffic between communities and which accommodates a high degree of mobility with a high degree of access control 3 minor arterials means a road intended to collect and distribute traffic in a manner that is designed to serve minor traffic generating areas such as neighborhood commercial areas educational facilities hospitals major recreational facilities churches or designed to carry traffic from collector streets to principal arterials streets collector collector streets means streets intended to move traffic from local streets to arterial streets these streets provide moderate speed movement and serve a direct route between activity centers streets local local streets means streets designed for low speeds and low volumes which provide access from low traffic generating areas to collectors and arterial systems local streets generally provide direct access to private property 1 culdesac means a street closed at one end with a turnaround a street shall be considered closed at one end if the public street does not continue on for a culdesac shall be that portion of a street from the closed end to the nearest intersection with a public street that provides two or more alternative directions of travel figure 1604c culdesacs 2 frontage roads means roads or streets parallel and adjacent to arterial streets which provide access to abutting properties and separation from subdivision for the purpose of these regulations means the division of land within the city limits into such number of lots or parcels as are controlled by this chapter and below within the extraterritorial subdivision jurisdiction it shall be the division of land into such number of lots or parcels and of such minimum sizes as are expressed in below subdivision minor minor subdivision means a subdivision which may create not more than four parcels of building sites each of which is five acres or smaller in size or the division of a block or outlot within a recorded subdivision plat into not more than four parcels or building sites that does not change the original exterior boundaries of such block or outlot survey plat of plat of survey means the division of a lot or property which does not create a new building site and which is intended to transfer or convey a portion of a lot to an adjoining lot or property     prior code  1802  82509   exemptions no plat or certified survey map shall be required in any of the following instances a the conveyance of parcels of land or interests therein for use as rightofway for railroads or other public utility facilities which does not include the creation of any new streets or easements of access  b the conveyance of land owned by a railroad or other public utility which does not involve the creation of new streets or easements of access limited however to circumstances in which such a conveyance is not intended for the creation of a new lot or parcel for building or development purposes with respect to such a conveyance the city may require that there be appended to its legal description a covenant in favor of the public prohibiting its use for building or development purposes  c the conveyance of land for highway or other public purposes grants or conveyances relating to the dedication of land for public use or instruments relating to the vacation of land impressed with a public use  d conveyances made to correct descriptions in prior conveyances  e the sale or exchange of parcels or tracts of land existing on  and not involving the creation of any new streets or easements of access  f the transfer or conveyances of any portion of any lot to an adjoining lot such that no new building sites are created  g minor subdivisions as defined in    engineering standards for utility construction the construction of such water and sanitary sewer facilities as are required under this title in each subdivision of land shall comply with the engineering standards incorporated by reference under the city code    minor subdivisionsuse of certified survey map divisions minor subdivisions may be created subject to the following requirements a each proposal for a minor subdivision utilizing a certified survey map pursuant to wis stats and this title shall be submitted to the city plan director for approval or rejection the city plan director is expressly delegated the power to approve or reject certified survey maps in accord with 1f wis stats b each certified survey map shall be prepared by a land surveyor registered in wisconsin c compliance with all of the requirements imposed under b shall be indicated on the certified survey map to the extent applicable compliance with all other provisions of this title shall be indicated as well d compliance with all of the requirements imposed under wis stats shall be indicated on the certified survey map e twelve 12 copies of the certified survey map shall be submitted
