to the city plan director who shall approve or reject the same within ninety 90 days of submittal unless the time is mutually agreed to be extended for purposes of calculating this time period the date of submission shall be deemed to be the later of the date when the application for approval is submitted or when the required fee is paid to the city the failure of the city plan director to approve or reject a certified survey map within the designated period of time shall not however cause it to be deemed to have been approved f in the event that a certified survey map is rejected the city plan director shall set forth the reasons for the rejection and provide a written copy of the same to the proposed subdivider g no lot to be created pursuant to a certified survey map shall be offered for sale until after the certified survey map has been recorded  part   all other subdivisions to comply with each subdivision which does not qualify for consideration as a minor subdivision and review and approval in accord with be required to be created by a plat in accord with  part   variances a the city council and plan commission may grant variances from the provisions of this title but only after determining that 1 because of the unique conditions of the subdivision involved literal application of the title would impose a hardship  2 the variance shall not violate the purpose of this title or the provisions of ch 236 wis stats b the requirement of filing and recording a plat for subdivision shall not be waived  part  prior code  1810   enforcement penalties and remedies a the plan commission shall have primary responsibility for enforcing this title no land use permit shall be issued for construction on any lot until the final plat for the subdivision has been duly recorded or a certified survey map has been recorded in addition no building permit shall be issued for any lot in any area or subdivision or part thereof unless and until the improvements required by this title have been completed for the lot for which application for a building permit is made b any person who fails to comply with the provisions of this chapter shall upon conviction thereof be subject to a penalty as provided in of this municipal code in addition the remedies provided by 31 wis stats shall be available to the city  part  prior code  1815   application of title a this title shall not only apply to subdivisions and additions herein approved and accepted by the council but shall also apply insofar as the improvement of the undeveloped area and payment for the costs thereof are concerned to those subdivisions and additions or parts thereof already platted and approved which are undeveloped wholly or partially as of  b nothing in this title shall be construed as creating an assumption for or by the city of any liability for any injuries loss or damage caused by compliance or failure to comply by any subdivider or developer in maintaining all improvements in a safe condition  part  prior code  1816 platting procedure procedures for plats of survey a plats shall be submitted to the city plan director plats shall be submitted in accordance with ch 236 wis stats compliance with all requirements of which shall be indicated on the face of the plat b plats of survey shall be prepared by a wisconsin registered land surveyor c plats of survey shall clearly indicate existing and proposed property lines buildings drives streets and alleys onsite sewage disposal systems utility lines easements and any other information found necessary by the city d all requirements of the ch ae 7 wis adm minimum standards for property surveys shall be indicated on the plat of survey e nineteen 19 copies of each plat shall be submitted to the city plan director who shall approve or reject the same within ninety 90 days of submittal unless the time is mutually agreed to be extended for purposes of calculating this time period the date of submission shall be deemed to be the later of the date when the application for approval is submitted or when the required fee is paid to the city f the city council shall consider the recommendation of the city plan director and approve or deny the plat within sixty 60 days of its submission unless the time is mutually extended for purposes of calculating this time period it shall commence on the date of the first meeting at which the plat is considered for approval by the city council g in the event that a plat is rejected the city plan director shall set forth the reasons for the rejection and provide a written copy of the same to the proposed subdivider h no lot to be created pursuant to a plat shall be offered for sale until after the plat has been recorded   prior code     2 5102016   division of land a no division of land shall be permitted if it results in a subdivision unless a plat or a certified survey map is submitted and approved in accordance with this title and ch 236 wis stats b in addition to the provision of this title and ch 236 wis stats all subdivisions shall conform to the zoning ordinance the official map and the comprehensive plan for the city and its extraterritorial planning area    procedure for submitting subdivisions a preliminary meeting before filing a preliminary plat the subdivider shall consult with the plan commission or its staff for advice regarding general requirements affecting the proposed development a sketch of the proposed subdivision drawn on a topographic survey map shall be submitted the subdivider shall also submit a location map showing the relationship of the proposed subdivision to traffic arteries and existing community facilities nothing in this section shall be construed as an assumption of liability by the plan commission or its staff as to the legality or form requirements of the proposed preliminary plat nor be construed as preventing the plan commission from rejecting a preliminary plat merely because the plan commission or its staff made suggestions or gave advice with reference to it b preliminary plat 1 the subdivider shall submit to the plan commission and to those agencies having the authority to object to plats under the provisions of ch 236 wis stats a preliminary plat six copies based upon an accurate exterior boundary survey by a registered land surveyor which shows clearly the proposed subdivision at a scale of not more than one inch per one hundred 100 feet having two feet contour intervals a sketch or preliminary layout shall be included for all land contiguous of the same owner so the plat may be reviewed as a portion of a total development a plat shall be considered submitted when it is considered by the plan commission at the first meeting at which the plat is a scheduled agenda item 2 a preliminary plat shall not be acceptable for review purposes unless all of the following information is clearly indicated a description i name of the proposed subdivision  ii name address of the owner subdivider engineer land surveyor or land planner  iii date graphic scale and north point  iv location of the proposed subdivision by quarter section township range and county and a location map showing the relationship between the plan and its surrounding area b existing conditions i contours at vertical intervals of not more than two feet  ii a scaled drawing of the exterior boundaries of the proposed subdivision referenced to a corner established by the u s public land survey and the total acreage encompassed thereby  iii location of existing property lines buildings drives streams water courses dry runs lakes marches rock outcrops wooded areas and other significant features within the parcel being subdivided  iv location rightofway width and names of any adjacent existing streets alleys or other public ways easements and railroad and utility rightsofway within or adjacent to the proposed subdivision  v water elevations of adjoining lakes or streams at the date of survey regional flood elevation data and where determined high and low water elevations  vi location and size of any existing sanitary and storm sewers culverts or drain pipes and the location and size of any existing water electric and gas service on or adjacent to the proposed subdivision  vii location and names of adjacent subdivisions parks and cemeteries  viii existing land use and zoning included within or adjacent to the proposed subdivision b proposed conditions i location width and name of all proposed streets and walkways  ii layout and scale dimensions of all lots and proposed lot and block numbers  iii draft of proposed protective covenants if any to be imposed  iv location and approximate dimensions of any sites to be reserved or dedicated for parks playgrounds greenways or other public uses  v location and size of proposed utilities including sanitary and storm sewer water electric and gas service plus other required utilities and appropriate easements with widths indicated 3 after review of the preliminary plat and negotiations with the subdivider on changes recommended and the kind and extent of public improvements which will be required the plan commission shall approve approve conditionally or reject in writing the preliminary plat within ninety 90 days effective 11180 after it has been submitted as defined above unless the time is mutually extended 4 approval of the preliminary plat shall entitle the subdivider to final approval of the layout as it pertains to lots streets and other dedicated lands shown by such plat provided that the final plat conforms substantially to such layout and all conditions of approval have been met c final plat 1 final plats shall be submitted to the plan commission within twentyfour 24 months of preliminary plat acceptance the final plat shall conform to the preliminary plat as approved and to the requirements of all applicable ordinances and state laws and shall be submitted for certification of those agencies having the authority to object to the plat as provided by wis stats the final plat shall be accompanied by detailed construction plans of all improvements the final plat shall be submitted to the plan commission at a regular meeting and shall be accepted or rejected by the plan commission and the city council within sixty 60 days of its submission unless the time is extended by an agreement with the subdivider reasons for rejection shall be stated in the minutes of the council meeting and a copy thereof or written statement of such reasons shall be given to the subdivider approved final plats shall be recorded in accordance with the statutory requirements prior to the time that lots are offered for sale reference is made to the map for sale purposes or use is made of lot and block numbers shown on the plat a reproducible mylar shall be submitted to the city after all approvals and filings have been completed 2 if the original of the final plat has been filed with another approving authority the subdivider may file a true copy of such plat in lieu of the original however before approval of the plan commission and the city council shall be inscribed on the original of the final plat the surveyor and subdivider shall certify the respects in which the original of the final plat differs from the true copy and all modifications shall first be approved d approval all approvals shall be in writing and a copy attached to the final plat e fees the subdivider shall pay the city at the times specified in this section all fees as herein required to defray any administrative expenses 1 preliminary plat at the time of the filing of the preliminary plat the subdivider shall pay to the city clerk a fee plus a per lot fee for each lot in the proposed subdivision a reapplication fee shall be paid to the clerk at the time of filing of a preliminary plat which has previously been reviewed the fees will be set from time to time by resolution of the city council 2 final plat at the time of the filing of the final plat the subdivider shall pay to the clerk a fee plus a per lot fee for each lot in the proposed subdivision a reapplication fee shall be paid to the clerk at the time of filing of a final plat which has previously been reviewed the fees will be set from time to time by resolution of the city council 3 certified survey map at the time of the filing of the certified survey map the subdivider shall pay to the clerk a fee the fee will be set from time to time by resolution of the city council   prior code  1805 extraterritorial subdivisions statement of purpose the purpose of this chapter shall be to govern the subdivision of lands lying within the extraterritorial subdivision jurisdiction of the city in adjoining towns as determined pursuant to 5 and 236101b2 wis stats underlying the regulations is the need of the city to deal with the effects of growth upon the city and its potential need to provide for or to extend its provision of services and infrastructure to anticipated subdivisions and land developments also underlying the regulations is the citys need to finance the installation construction and operational costs of services and infrastructure related to development thereof upon the planning for and efficient delivery of public improvements in the city and as annexations occur in areas now adjoining the city a further basis for this chapter is the need to deal with the rapid growth in impervious surfaces resulting from development the environmental impacts of development adjacent to the kinnickinnic river and upon the bluffs surrounding the city and the corresponding problems of dealing with presently uncontrolled residential commercial and industrial development of lands in adjoining towns which in the future may require the extension of city services or may result in requests for annexation to the city resulting in haphazard or unplanned or under planned streets sewage disposal and water system extensions and other infrastructure related problems in addition unplanned or uncontrolled subdivision of lands and their development outside of the city limits may in the future restrict planned growth of the city impacting upon the need for and location of parks schools and other governmental structures and services this chapter and its regulation of extraterritorial land subdivisions is further designed to promote the public health safety and general welfare and to that end shall be used as a means of lessening congestion in the streets and highways  to further the orderly layout and use of land  to insure the use of proper legal descriptions and monumenting of land subdivisions  to secure safety from fire panic and other dangers  to provide adequate light and air  to promote development of land which is harmonious to the use of adjoining land  to prevent the overcrowding of land and avoid undue concentration of population  to facilitate adequate provision for transportation water sewage storm water drainage schools parks and parkways playgrounds and other public requirements  and to facilitate the resubdivision of larger tracts into smaller parcels of land  part   authority this chapter is adopted pursuant to the authority granted to the city under 5 236025 236101b2 and 23645 wis stats  part   goals of this chapter the city of river falls subscribes to the policy that the development of land both in and adjoining the city should be located in a compact manner so as to facilitate the efficient and cost effective provision of municipal services and facilities with this intent in mind proposed subdivisions shall be reviewed in accord with and shall conform to the following goals a preservation and enhancement of the business industrial residential and institutional climate of the city of river falls and encouragement of compact balanced growth both within and adjoining its city limits b encouragement of an appropriate array of and configuration of commercial industrial residential and institutional land uses together with promotion of employment opportunities and preservation of open space land uses including but not limited to those associated with the kinnickinnic river a regional natural resource so as to meet both the needs of present as well as future residents of the area c direction of new growth to those areas capable of providing adequate public services and facilities d prevention of scattered noncontiguous development without discouraging new desirable development e ensuring that new development will not be detrimental to the physical social and economic well being of the residents of the city or adjoining areas of pierce and st croix counties f ensuring that new development will be organized and timed so as to permit urban services and facilities to be provided as economically and efficiently as possible g discouragement of new developments in those areas which are premature in terms of planning and timing for the provision of adequate public services and facilities h preservation of high quality agricultural lands for that purpose when located in areas designated for agricultural land uses i prohibition of development in areas or forms where substantial problems will result from excessive automobile traffic volume j favoring of land use intensities and patterns which are supportive of alternative modes of transportation k fostering the preservation of significant historical properties and sites  part   definitions the following definitions shall control the interpretation and application of this chapter accessory structure means a subordinate structure that is customarily incidental to and located on the same lot as a principal structure adjacent means immediately adjoining or neighboring as in the case of properties that have common borders or boundaries agricultural lands means land which is at the time of application for approval of a proposed subdivision actively being used for agricultural purposes including commercial bee keeping dairying floriculture forestry general farming horticulture nurseries orchards paddocks pasturage stabling truck farming and viticulture or which land is vacant but in accord with soil maps and agricultural zoning regulations has been determined to be prime agricultural land approval authority means in the case of a certified survey map the city plan director and in the case of a plat the plan commission city limits means the corporate limits of the city of river falls city plan director means the city plan director and his or her designees extraterritorial subdivision jurisdiction has the same meaning as is set forth at farm means a parcel of real estate together with all structures associated with the same used for an agricultural purpose as described with reference to the definition of agricultural lands above gross area means the physical area of a lot not including any portion thereof subject to an easement or dedication for street or other public travel purposes lot means a legally identifiable and recordable parcel of land created in the process of and as a direct result of the subdividing of a larger tract of land principal structure means the main structure on a lot and is anything that is constructed or erected the use of which requires a permanent location on the ground or attachment to something having a permanent location on the ground public improvement means the same term as is used in ch 236 wis stats further defined as a type of permanent addition to or betterment of real property which improves the value or utility of the subdivision and is made available for use by the public public sewerage system means a municipally owned and operated sewage disposal system but shall not include any wis adm sps 383 systems subdivision area shall consist of that portion of the extraterritorial subdivision jurisdiction lying between the city limits and the subdivision boundary as established pursuant to below vacant land means land that at the time that its subdivision is proposed has not been improved nor is it then being used for any purpose permitted or conditionally permitted under applicable zoning regulations  part   2 5102016   subdivision area established a for purposes of this chapter and consistent with 5 and 236105 wis stats the subdivision area shall consist of all territory lying between the city limits and a line established by the common council and set forth on the city official map denominated thereupon as the subdivision boundary b determination of boundaries whenever uncertainty exists as to the boundary as shown on the city official map the following rules apply 1 where boundary lines are indicated as quarter section line or quarterquarter section line such line shall be construed to be such boundary 2 where boundary lines are indicated as approximately following lot lines such lines shall be construed to be such boundaries c in order to facilitate the administration of this chapter the following requirements shall be imposed 1 the city clerk shall file a certified copy of this chapter with the clerk of each town 2 the city clerk shall file a certified copy of the official city map with the clerk of each town 3 the city clerk shall file certified copies of all amendments or other modifications to this chapter the comprehensive plan and the official city map with the clerk of each town 4 the city clerk shall file certified copies of legislation approving the subdivision of land in accord with this chapter with the clerk of the town in which the subdivided real estate is situated d a copy of each application for a building or sanitary permit for real estate situated within the boundaries of the subdivision area shall prior to its issuance be filed by the town officer or employee designated to approve of the same with the city plan director who shall promptly review the same for compliance with the official city map and setback requirements imposed under this chapter it shall be the duty of the city plan director to file an objection with the designated town officer or employee within a reasonable period of time after receipt of a copy of the application for a permit in lieu of which it shall be presumed that the application is in compliance with city regulations e to the extent that this chapter limits the subdivision area to land lying within the subdivision boundary established with reference to the attached map it constitutes a waiver on the part of the city to approve of land subdivisions lying outside of that border and extending to the three mile limit for its extraterritorial subdivision jurisdiction as established pursuant to 5 and 23610 wis stats the city reserves the right in accord with 5 wis stats to rescind this modification of its extraterritorial subdivision jurisdiction at any time upon adoption of an ordinance modifying the provisions of subsection a of this section  part   official city map to apply no permit shall be issued to construct or enlarge any building within the limits of any street or highway waterway public transit facility or parkway shown or laid out on the official city map at any location in the subdivision area except in full accord with this chapter no subdivision of land that is inconsistent with the city map shall be approved unless conditions are imposed thereupon to prevent any development which is inconsistent therewith any person seeking to do so shall apply to the city plan director for a permit and no such permit may be issued except in full accord with this chapter the official city map  part   shoreland zoning ordinances and maps applicable no permission may be granted for the subdivision of land that violates the city floodplain protection and shoreland and wetland zoning regulations as set forth in of the city code nor may any subdivision violate the provisions of any town or county floodplain shoreland or wetland zoning regulations to the extent that subdivisions are approved subject to compliance therewith conditions shall be established so as to ensure that use of the land so subdivided meets with all of the provisions of applicable town and county floodplain shoreland and wetland ordinances  part   general requirements no person shall divide any land located in the subdivision area resulting in a subdivision as defined in this chapter without first complying with all of the following to the extent that they are applicable to the subdivision in question a the provisions of ch 236 wis stats b the most restrictive of applicable ordinances rules and regulations of each approval jurisdiction c the city comprehensive plan and official city map d all statutes administrative rules and applicable ordinances pertaining to lot size and soils if the subdivision is not served by a public sewerage system e the rules of the state department of transportation related to access and preservation of the public interest and investment in streets and highways if the subdivision or any portion thereof abuts on a state trunk highway or street connecting therewith f whenever a tract or parcel proposed to be subdivided contains any part of a street highway or parkway designated on the official city map such part of the proposed public way shall be platted and dedicated by the subdivider in the location and at the width indicated in the city map g no land shall be subdivided which is held to be unsuitable for use or development by reason of flooding bad drainage soil or rock formations which severely limit development potential tend to create severe erosion potential or for reasons of unfavorable topography or any other feature which is likely to be harmful to the safety or welfare of future residents or landowners in the proposed subdivision or in the community at large h lot sizes shall conform with the most restrictive area and width requirements imposed under state and local regulations prescribed for the territory in which the proposed subdivision is situated i to the extent applicable the city sewer service area criteria j other applicable city ordinances  part   setbacks from regulated streams it is recognized in this chapter that to the extent that streams regulated under of this code flow subdivision area they constitute unique natural features which require both protection from building encroachments as well as aesthetic protection to maintain their status as unique natural features to this effect it is deemed by the city that no principal or accessory structures shall be constructed at any location in relationship to the ordinary high water mark of any such regulated stream which is in conflict with the provisions of of the city code incorporated herein by reference under  part   subdivisions regulated within subdivision area a minimum lot size no new lot whose gross area is less than thirtyfive 35 acres in size may be created by subdivision of existing tracts or parcels of land except as is set forth in of this chapter b preexisting which have been legally created and which exist as of the effective date of the ordinance codified in this chapter and which are less than thirtyfive 35 acres in gross size shall be recognized as preexisting nonconforming lots and may be used in accord with applicable regulations however from a subdivision control standpoint the following regulations concerning such lots shall apply 1 no preexisting nonconforming lot shall be further subdivided 2 subject to complete compliance with all other provisions of this chapter preexisting nonconforming lots may be enlarged however this allowance shall be subject to the following limitation in the process of enlarging a preexisting nonconforming lot land may not be taken from an adjoining lot or parcel as a result of which the adjoining lot or parcel is reduced to less than thirtyfive 35 acres in gross area except in cases involving lot line adjustments which do not create new lots or building sites or which render either lot or parcel to become more nonconforming than it was prior to the enlargement of the adjoining lot c lands annexed to city land that adjoins the city limits for which a petition for annexation has been filed and approved by the common council subject to terms and conditions of an applicable annexation agreement may be exempted from the lot size restrictions imposed under subsection a of this section subject to the remaining criteria of this chapter d farm related land subdivision exemption the subdivision of a parcel of land from a farm which is controlled by b shall be exempt from the minimum lot size requirement of subsection a of this section    part   subdivision of existing substandard parcels permissible subject to conditions a a preexisting parcel of real estate which was not created as a lot in a plat or certified survey map division of land and which was of record prior to the effective date of which is smaller than thirtyfive 35 acres in size or which after division in accord with this section will result in the creation of one lot or parcel which shall be less than thirtyfive 35 acres in size may be legally divided subject to the following limitations 1 the preexisting parcel must already be occupied by an existing residential dwelling 2 the purpose of the division must be to split off from the remainder of the preexisting parcel containing the existing residential dwelling 3 only one division of such a preexisting parcel shall be allowed except for other divisions that are in full compliance with  in accord with subsection b3 below no building permit or other permission shall be granted to the owner or his or her successor or successors in interest to erect or build a principal structure upon that portion of the preexisting parcel which does not at the time of such division contain a principal structure if such a permit is applied for to the town in which the parcel is situated the city may bring an action in injunctive relief to enforce the covenant required under subsection b3 below b divisions of preexisting lots or parcels for the purpose of creating a lot containing an existing residential dwelling under this section shall be subject to the following standards 1 the resulting lot or parcel containing the existing house shall be no less than two acres in size nor more than five acres in size 2 the lot or parcel containing the existing house shall be configured in such a manner as to promote rather than to hinder open space use of the remainder of the preexisting lot or parcel as well as to meet the purpose and intent of this chapter in controlling the subdivision of land 3 the owner of the preexisting lot or parcel shall record a covenant against the title to that portion of the preexisting lot or parcel which does not contain the existing residential dwelling which covenant shall prohibit any further subdivision of that lot or parcel as well as prohibit the erection or building thereupon of any type of principal structure except in full compliance with other applicable ordinances of the city the city attorney for purposes of compliance with this section shall approve each such covenant 4 the division of a preexisting lot or parcel shall conform to all other applicable provisions of this chapter c a preexisting lot which was created by a division of land which was of record prior to the effective date of with a land use designation of very low infill vli as mapped on the city of river falls comprehensive plan future land use map may be divided under this chapter to lots whose sizes are authorized in city of river falls municipal zoning this type of land division shall be exempt from the requirements under subsection a above the utility director and the planning director shall approve of the creation of new lots in accord with a cost of service study and the standards under subject to the appeal of the planning commission and city council d prior to recording a division of a preexisting lot or parcel in accord with this section the owner shall meet with the plan director who shall grant permission to the proposed subdivision subject to the standards under subsection b of this section if it is in accord with this section such authorization may be conditioned upon the owner making changes in his or her proposed division so as to fulfill the objectives of subsection b2 of this section no division that fails to meet the criteria of this section shall be allowed in which event the requirements of be applied   11252008   11 6142016   criteria for land divisions a preliminary plat or certified survey map for the subdivision of land situated in the subdivision area shall not be approved unless it meets with the following criteria a the proposed subdivision shall be adequately accessible via streets or highways subject to the following conditions 1 existing streets shall be found to be adequate to accommodate the traffic that is estimated to be generated by the proposed subdivision in addition to existing traffic 2 such additional streets or street improvements as are necessary in combination with existing streets to accommodate the additional traffic which will be generated by the proposed subdivision are budgeted for construction in the current adopted budget of the town in which the subdivision is situated or shall be provided for means of financing 3 in determination of the adequacy of transportation facilities the approval authority shall consult with the city engineer and where appropriate with the department of transportation b the proposed subdivision shall be determined to have adequate stormwater drainage and retention capabilities and where improvements are required in order to conform the same to applicable statutes rules and regulations and conditions shall be imposed upon the plat or certified survey map to ensure compliance therewith including such assurances as may be deemed necessary to allow for the provision of adequate public or private funds to cause the required stormwater drainage and retention facilities to be constructed and maintained c the proposed subdivision shall be determined to have adequate private sanitary sewage disposal capability or if a community disposal system is proposed in accord with wis adm sps 383 it is in compliance therewith d the proposed subdivision shall have adequate water service e the proposed subdivision shall have adequate parks open space and recreation opportunities available to it and its residents as determined in accord with applicable rules regulations and standards  part   2 5102016   mapping requirements all subdivisions of land in the subdivision area shall conform with all applicable mapping requirements imposed under ch 236 wis stats and this title this shall include but not be limited to dimensional criteria technical mapping requirements and such other and further requirements as are imposed subject only to the limitations expressed under below  part   subdivision of agricultural lands a notwithstanding above approval for the subdivision of agricultural land shall not be granted even for the creation of a thirtyfive 35 acre parcel if it is determined in the course of the review process that to authorize such a subdivision will be detrimental to the continued agricultural use of all or any portion of the tract or parcel sought to be subdivided in making this determination the city shall take into consideration applicable town or county zoning which has placed the land in question into an exclusive agricultural district as well as the question of whether such a subdivision would violate any transfer of development rights instruments recorded against and pertaining to the same the latter limitation on subdivision approval shall not apply if the development restrictions imposed against the land in question have been legally released b as a complete exception to the limitations imposed under subsection a of this section the owner of agricultural lands who also resides upon said land may seek to legally divide from an agricultural tract of land a lot not less than two acres in size for the purpose of accommodating the construction and use of a principal structure for residential use by a person who is employed on the farm which is maintained on the remainder of the parcel to be so divided and who earns a substantial part of his or her livelihood from work on the farm in addition such a lot may be created for the parents or a child or children of the operator of the farm from which such lot is to be created for purposes of this subsection substantial part of his or her livelihood from work on the farm shall be defined to mean at least fifty 50 percent of the individuals annual gross income from his or her labor    part   subdivision of nonagricultural lands subject to the minimum lot size requirement approval of the subdivision of nonagricultural lands shall be made upon the basis that the proposed division complies with the following criteria a it is compatible with adjacent land uses and shall maintain the general land use pattern of the area in question b it will result in a development pattern that is compatible with surrounding developments and land uses measures of compatibility shall include lot sizes traffic generation access noise and visual features c the proposed subdivision and resulting development shall not adversely affect the citys ability to provide public services install public improvements or accomplish future annexations d the proposed subdivision complies with one or more of the following 1 it represents infilling of vacant land infilling is defined as a subdivision of vacant land which will accommodate the development of vacant land located such that surrounding land uses render the land impractical for anything other than uses similar to those proposed to be made of it after subdivision 2 the proposed subdivision shall provide permanent open space lands for use by the general public in conformity with the comprehensive plan and other city ordinances if applicable  part   division of land abutting major streets and highways a the city adopts by reference the purposes underlying wis adm trans 233 at 01 as forming the basis upon which it is determined that regulating the development of land adjoining designated major streets and highways is deemed to be a subject of concern for the city which concern shall be taken into consideration in the process of approving or rejecting proposed subdivisions of tracts of land as well as the construction thereupon of improvements b no person may erect or construct any structure or improvement upon any land which is subdivided under the terms of this chapter which is within one hundred ten 110 feet of the centerline of a street or highway designated in subsection c of this section or within fifty 50 feet of the rightofway line thereof whichever is further from the centerline of the street or highway if any portion of a service road rightofway lies within the setback area described above the setback shall be increased by the lesser of the following 1 the width of the service road rightofway if the entire service road rightofway lies within the setback area 2 the distance by which the service road rightofway lies within the setback area if the entire service road rightofway does not lie within the setback area c the streets and highways subject to this section shall be those which are designated on the city map as principal arterials minor arterials and collector streets designated in accord with the definitions of streets set forth at incorporated in this chapter is a map identifying these streets in the subdivision area d the restriction in subsection b of this section against the erection or construction of structures or improvements in the described setback zone shall not apply to public utility transmission lines whether above or below the surface of the ground  part   procedure for platting divisions of land a all persons desiring to subdivide land in the subdivision area by means of a plat may submit a preliminary map or plan of the proposed division to the city plan director the city plan director shall within a reasonable time from the date of submission of the same either provide the proposed subdivider with an analysis of the proposed land division or shall call for a conference to be held with the subdivider the purpose of which shall be to discuss applicable standards and the demonstration on the face of the proposed plat or map of its compliance or noncompliance therewith this step does not require formal application or the filing of a preliminary plat but is intended to inform the proposed subdivider of the objectives of the city regulations and those set forth in the comprehensive plan and the city map to assist the subdivider in planning the development in question and to informally attempt to arrive at mutual conclusions regarding the general program and objectives of the subdivision and land development in question b submittal of both preliminary plats and final plats shall conform to the requirements of which shall control the time periods to which approvals conditional approvals or rejections of preliminary or final plats are subjected shall not commence until the date of the initial meeting of the plan commission at which the preliminary or final plat is on the agenda for consideration by the said commission  part   certified survey map divisions of land a subject to the limitations on the availability of a certified survey map for use in the division of land as is set forth at 1 wis stats a certified survey map may be used in lieu of a final plat if it meets with all requirements of wis stats this chapter all other applicable ordinances unless waived by the city plan director a preliminary map shall be submitted to the city prior to the filing of a proposed certified survey map of a land division and the city plan director shall comply with the recommendations of the city engineer and the river falls municipal utilities and may require of the proposed subdivider that sketches or other information be submitted for a determination of whether or not the objectives of this chapter can be achieved by means of the proposed certified survey map b the subdivider shall file nineteen 19 copies of each proposed certified survey map with the city plan director together with a written application for approval on a form devised for that purpose by the city the application shall contain the complete legal description of the land in question and shall certify that all of the owners of the property contained within the proposed map join in the submittal a preliminary review shall be made of the proposed land division for confirmation of ownership encumbrances easements rightsofway leases unpaid real estate taxes and unpaid special assessments if necessary the city plan director shall consult with the city attorney c the city plan director shall within ninety 90 days of submittal of the said certified survey map either approve of it conditionally approve of it or reject it the failure of the city plan director to so act within the designated period of time shall constitute a rejection of the proposed certified survey map subject to the right of the subdivider to request of the plan commission that it review the nonaction of the city plan director and approve of the map d in the event that the city plan director determines that a proposed certified survey map or plat does not meet the standards of this chapter for approval or fails to react to it during the designated time period the subdivider may refer this denial to the plan commission which shall schedule the matter for review at its next regularly scheduled meeting following the receipt by it of a written request for review if the plan commission refuses to approve of the certified survey map division it shall furnish the proposed subdivider with the reasons for its action in writing such decision by the plan commission shall be made within a reasonable period of time after it has been heard by it  part   conditional approval of subdivisions allowed the city plan director and the plan commission in the case of reviews of decisions of the city plan director with respect to certified survey maps and plats shall have the authority where necessary to enforce the requirements of this chapter to impose conditions upon its approval of maps or plats for recording purposes additionally where deemed an appropriate means of securing compliance with this chapter the city plan director or plan commission may require the recording of restrictive covenants against the title of the real estate subject to a proposed land division a further condition of approval shall be the approval of the subdivision in question by all other authorities having the power to approve of or reject the same  part   design standards standards pertaining to the type method of construction of materials to be incorporated in or size length and dimensions of proposed public improvements to be constructed in proposed subdivision subject to this chapter shall be prescribed by the town in which the land is situated this limitation does not however limit application of the limitations imposed under the official city map which under 6 wis stats shall prevail with respect to limitations on construction and enlargement of building impressed with respect to the location and width of streets highways historic districts parkways parks and playgrounds however nothing in this chapter prevents the city plan director or plan commission from recommending the installation of public improvements which go beyond the specifications required of the subdivider by the town in which the subdivision is to be located nor from the city and the subdivider nor from the city the town and the developer from entering into a developers agreement specifying the types of public improvements to be installed as well as designating who shall defray the costs associated therewith  part   waiver of subdivision approval jurisdiction under certain conditions the authority of the city to approve of subdivisions may be waived by the city as to land situated outside of the city limits if more than onehalf of the legal description of a proposed subdivision lies outside of the designated subdivision area after receiving a report from the plan commission at its discretion the common council may waive the rights of the city to review such a subdivision if it finds it to be in the best interests of the city to do so  part   interrelationship between title 16 generally should there be any conflict between provisions set forth in this chapter and those found in the remainder of this title for purposes of the subject matter of this chapter the specific provisions found herein shall control in the event that a topic is not covered in this chapter the provisions of this title shall control  part   severance clause should any paragraph or section of this chapter be held by a court of competent jurisdiction to be unenforceable or unconstitutional it shall be deemed to be severed from the remainder of this chapter that shall remain in full force and effect as if the offending provision had never been adopted  part   subdivision boundaries to be governed by modifications to corporate limits of city in the event that subsequent to the date of adoption of this chapter or any amendment hereto the city perfects the annexation to itself of additional territory the city plan director shall place the issue of extension of the boundary of the subdivision area on an agenda of the plan commission for its consideration and recommendation to the common council  part   impact of intermunicipal agreements in the event that in the future the city and one or more of the four adjoining towns enter into a cooperation agreement or a wis stats cooperative boundary agreement the city agrees that it will duly consider amending this chapter in order to conform it with the terms and conditions set forth in such agreement as pertaining to subdivisions occurring in the town or towns in question  part design standards streets and lots a the subdivider shall dedicate land for and improve streets as provided herein streets shall conform to the official map ordinance of the city streets shall be located with due regard for topographical conditions natural features existing and proposed streets utilities and land uses and public convenience and safety b all lots shall have frontage on a public street except as otherwise provided for in this title or in c street locations shall be consistent with any street plans officially adopted by the city street design shall conform to the following street type rightofway minimum width minimum radius of curvature maximum culdesacs with restricted parking also loop streets not exceeding 1500 with restricted parking 50 100 10% local provides access to individual lots 60 100 10% collector collects traffic from minor streets 66 180 9% minor arterial carries traffic from collectors to arterials note individual lot access is discouraged 80 230 8% principal arterial note individual lot access is denied 100 300 6% d streets shall be laid out to provide for possible continuation wherever topographic and other physical conditions permit e minor streets shall be so laid out as to discourage their use by f the number of intersections of minor streets with major streets shall be reduced to the practical minimum consistent with circulation needs and safety requirements g where a subdivision abuts or contains an existing or proposed arterial street major or minor the plan commission shall require a frontage road nonaccess reservation along the rear of the property contiguous to such arterial street or such other treatment as may be necessary to ensure safe efficient traffic flow h reserve strips controlling access to streets from an adjacent property owner shall be prohibited except as noted in subsection g of this section i a tangent at least one hundred 100 feet long shall be required between reverse curves on arterial and collector streets j streets shall afford maximum visibility and safety and shall intersect at right angles where practicable k dedication of halfwidth streets shall be prohibited l lengths of dead end and culdesac streets shall conform with the following 1 permanent dead end streets shall not be longer than one thousand 1000 feet nor provide access to more than thirty 30 residential units whichever is more restrictive the length shall be measured along street centerlines from the center of the turnaround to the intersection of street centerlines at the nearest non dead end public street all permanent dead ends streets shall have a turnaround at their end the turnaround shall have an outside roadway diameter of at least eighty 80 feet and a street property line diameter of one hundred 100 feet a minimum twentyfive 25 feet radius shall be made at the corners formed by the street and the turnaround rightofway 2 permanent culdesac streets shall not be longer than one thousand 1000 feet nor provide access to more than thirty 30 residential units whichever is more restrictive the length shall be measured along street centerlines from the center of the turnaround to the intersection of street centerlines at the nearest intersection with a public street the turnaround shall have an outside roadway diameter of at least eighty 80 feet and a street property line diameter of one hundred 100 feet a minimum twentyfive 25 foot radius shall be made at the corners formed by the street and the turnaround rightofway 3 temporary dead end streets shall not be longer than one thousand five hundred 1500 feet nor be used for access to more than seventyfive 75 residential units whichever is more restrictive and shall have a temporary turnaround with an outside diameter of at least eighty 80 feet constructed to standards approved by the city engineer and planning commission except as follows a temporary dead end streets shall not be longer than three thousand 3000 feet nor provide access to more than one hundred fifty 150 residential units whichever is more restrictive if all of the following are met i a second access for emergency response is provided until such time that the street becomes a non dead end street the secondary access shall be a minimum of twelve 12 feet wide constructed to standards approved by the city engineer and planning commission be maintainable yearround and not require a key for access  ii location of the temporary access shall be such that no more than seventyfive residential units are provided with only one access for emergency response  and iii the temporary end of the street has a temporary turnaround constructed to standards approved by the city engineer and planning commission with an outside diameter of at least eighty 80 feet b temporary dead end streets longer than three thousand 3000 feet or providing access to more than one hundred fifty 150 residential units shall be allowed if all of the following are met i the street is part of a route conforming with the official map that when complete will cause the street to become a non dead end street  ii a second access for emergency response is provided until such time that the street becomes a non dead end street the secondary access shall be a minimum of twelve 12 feet wide constructed to standards approved by the city engineer and planning commission be maintainable yearround and not require a key for access  iii location of the temporary access shall be such that no more than seventyfive 75 residential units are provided with only one access for emergency response  iv the temporary end of the street has a temporary turnaround with an outside diameter of at least eighty 80 feet constructed to standards approved by the city engineer and planning commission 4 the planning commission and city council may grant a variance to the requirements herein for the following reasons a topographic conditions exist that do not allow for a subdivision design meeting the requirements above i constraints imposed by limited access roadways may be considered a topographic condition for the purpose of this wording ii constraints imposed by lack of ownership of adjacent developable lands shall not be considered a topographic condition for the purpose of this wording iii constraints imposed by buildings or other development on adjacent lands may be considered a topographic condition for the purpose of this wording m where possible lot lines shall be perpendicular to the street line and to the tangent at the lot corner on curved streets n follow rather than cross municipal boundary lines whenever practicable o no street names shall be used which duplicate or may be confused with the names of existing streets street names shall be subject to the approval of the plan commission p notwithstanding the above if any standard when applied to a particular plat does not meet with good engineering practices as determined by the city engineer the city council and the plan commission may require such modifications or additions to the plat so as to conform to good engineering practices part  prior code  18061   block design a the lengths widths and shapes of blocks shall be appropriate for the topography and the type of development contemplated blocks in residential areas shall not be more than one thousand 1000 feet long b to provide adequate access and circulation to community facilities a system of pedestrian circulation shall be required sidewalks either along streets or center of blocks and various kinds of improved trails may be used in blocks over seven hundred 700 feet long a pedestrian crosswalk shall be provided at or near the midpoint of the block the rightofway for center crosswalks shall not be less than ten 10 feet wide c the plan commission shall require that the developer plant or leave standing in the case of existing a minimum of one tree for each forty 40 feet of frontage on all streets within the rightofway but not so as to interfere with any utilities planting shall be a minimum of six feet high and of a species acceptable to the city forester or other agency designated by the city council d subdivision lots in the city shall be in conformance with the area and width requirements of the city zoning ordinance area and width requirements of subdivision lots in the extraterritorial planning area shall conform to the extraterritorial zoning ordinance and ch sps 385 wis adm amended during supplement #1  prior code  18062   2 5102016   zoning zoning shall be consistent with the district map and extraterritorial zoning ordinance 063   easements a the plan commission shall require recorded easements for poles wires conduits storm and sanitary sewers gas telephone water mains or other utility lines in a form approved by the city attorneys office easements between lots shall be at least sixteen 16 feet wide shall be shown on the plat and shall have the following restriction lettered on the face of the plat this utility easement shall have no permanent obstructions fences trees shrubs or other obstacles that interfere with utility installation andor maintenance and the city shall not be held liable for any damages therefrom this statement shall also be included on the abstract easements along dedicated rightofway shall be of sufficient width for the use intended b the plan commission shall require that easements or drainage ways be provided where a subdivision includes a segment or segments of water courses drainage ways channels or streams 08   steep slopes 20% or greater a subdivisions shall be designed so that no construction or grading for home sites shall be conducted on steep slopes b steep slopes shall not be considered part of the buildable area of any lot c steep slopes shall be defined as land between the base of the steep slope and the top of the steep slope defined as follows a the base of the steep slope shall be that point at which land elevation rises one foot or more over five feet and the rise over the adjacent fifty 50 feet is ten 10 feet or greater b the top of the steep slope shall be that point at which the land elevation falls one foot or more over five feet and the fall over the adjacent fifty 50 feet is ten 10 feet or greater c the horizontal distance between the base of the steep slope and the top of the steep slope must be fifty 50 feet or greater for land between them to be considered steep slopes d preliminary and final plats shall indicate areas defined as steep slopes based upon a site survey by a registered surveyor or on topographic information plotted from a verified aerial survey e overland stormwater runoff from impervious surfaces that are directed towards steep slopes shall first be directed to an onsite infiltration system a onsite infiltration system shall be designed to infiltrate a volume of water equal to one and onehalf inches over the entire impervious surface b emergency overflows from the infiltration system shall be designed to be dispersed onto the steep slope in a distributed sheetflow manner c details for such onsite infiltration system shall be submitted as part of the building permit application f these standards shall apply to both division of land within the city as well as the extraterritorial plat jurisdiction area g the following are exempt from these provisions a construction of streets and utilities b correction of erosion problems included in an approved stormwater management plan c commercial and industrial lots in existence on  h steep slopes disturbed for any reason shall be restored by planting native vegetation or vegetation as approved by the city  12809 improvements general improvements the following provisions shall apply to the subdivisions platted within the city and shall also apply to subdivisions platted within the extraterritorial plat approval jurisdiction of the city where extension of utilities andor annexation is reasonably expected within five years time as determined by the city council all improvements shall be required in the extraterritorial area no improvements are required in the remainder of the extraterritorial area a the improvements required under these regulations shall be constructed by the subdivider at his or her expense in accordance with the specifications and under the supervision of the officials having jurisdiction prior to filing with the plan commission and city council the final plat for final approval  or b in lieu of construction of the improvements as required in subsection a of this section the subdivider shall furnish the city clerk with a surety performance bond or other form of surety running to the city sufficient to cover the subdivision cost of such required improvements as estimated by the city engineers and approved by the city council thereby to secure the actual construction and installation of such improvements immediately after final approval of the plat or at a time in accordance with the requirements of the council the bond shall be in such form as approved by the city attorneys office prior to either acceptance of the improvement by the city council or release of the subdividers bond all improvements shall be inspected by the city engineer and other appropriate city officials and if they are found to be installed according to the plans and specifications and any other requirements herein defined a written report of such approval by the appropriate city officers shall be given to the city council who may then consider the same in approving the plat or releasing the bond c if the procedure under subsection b of this section is followed the construction of all improvements required by these rules and regulations shall be completed within two years from the date of approval of the final plat by the council unless good cause can be shown for the granting of an extension of time by authority of the council but the council shall not grant variances to exceed five years from acceptance of the final plat if no extension is granted the city at its option may cause all uncompleted required work to be constructed and the parties executing the bond shall be firmly bound for payment of all necessary costs thereof d the approval of the final plat by the city council shall constitute acceptance of the dedication of any public street road or highway dedicated in such plat e where unusual or exceptional factors or conditions exist the city council may modify the provisions of this title a written statement of the reasons for such modifications shall be attached to all copies of the construction plans f if the city council or city engineer make design requirements that are in excess of requirements for the immediate development as determined by the city engineer and approved by the council the excess cost shall be equally shared by the city and the developer design requirements shall include size and materials but not depth or routing g the city reserves the right to require independent testing and inspection of any or all improvements installed in a subdivision this testing and inspection shall be done at the developers expense and shall be based upon current city construction specifications 071   12 6142016   improvements the following improvements shall be required at the expense of the subdivider a streets boulevards and terraces 1 after installation of all utilities the streets shall be brought to finished grade in accordance with the approved plans and specifications subject to the soil conditions peculiar to the subdivision area after inspection by the city engineer and installation of curb and gutter the subdivider shall surface the streets with bituminous surfacing or concrete the subdivider shall be responsible for all subgrade grade and finishing materials and base 2 boulevards and terraces shall be topsoiled after the installation of underground utilities to conform to specifications established by the city engineer 3 no street shall be accepted by the city until a written report has been filed by the city engineer stating that all requirements as to fill grade compaction and finished surface have been fully complied with this report shall be made within fourteen 14 days of written request for acceptance of the street 4 the developer shall not be relieved of responsibility for any street construction until one year after the engineers report has been submitted giving acceptance 5 curb and gutter shall be installed before any street is surfaced b curb gutter and sidewalks 1 concrete curb and gutter shall be constructed to conform with specifications established by the city engineer 2 concrete sidewalks of such width and type of construction as required by title 12 of this code shall be constructed c bridges and culverts bridges and culverts large enough to take care of all natural flowage of water based upon then current state dnr standards and to take care of traffic for which the street was designed shall be constructed d utilities utilities shall be installed at the expense of the subdivider under the supervision of the city engineer and utility department prior to any water or sewer mains being installed the plans must be submitted to the utility department for review recommendation and approval when approving any subdivision under this title the council shall require the developer in addition to any other requirements imposed by this title to extend the service provided by all utilities to the end of the boundary lines of the property that is to be platted such that such utilities form a complete extension to allow the abutting property of the subdivision to connect to the utility extensions the payment for such extensions shall be done at the sole expense of the subdivider by assessing a portion of the cost to abutting benefitting properties or some combination thereof as may be contained in a developers agreement as each individual case warrants 1 sanitary sewer the developer shall install a public sanitary sewer system adequate to provide the subdivision with a complete sanitary sewer system including lateral connection initially into each lot and connected in a satisfactory manner to the city sanitary sewer system sewer mains shall be installed at sufficient depth to ensure use by the area adjacent to the subdivision installing the main the design and construction of the sanitary sewer main extension shall conform to the design criteria of the river falls engineering guidelines a minimum size of eightinch sewer is required for new development b if a pumping station is required to pump sanitary wastes the subdivider shall install at no expense to the city a pumping station and force main approved by the city engineer and utility department adequate to service a subdivision and shall deed such pumping station force main equipment and site to the city prior to acceptance of the final plat c no subdivision shall receive preliminary approval of sewer facilities installations until inspection by the city engineer and utility department the developer shall not be relieved of responsibility for any sewer installation before one full year from the date of acceptance 2 water the developer shall install a complete water distribution system adequate to serve the area being platted including laterals into each lot the system fire flow shall be adequate to meet commercial risk services standards further the design and construction of the water main extension shall conform to the design criteria of the river falls engineering guidelines calculations shall be based upon the maximum density of the lots in accordance with commercial risk services a water mains shall be looped wherever possible to ensure proper circulation of water throughout the system no deadends shall be permitted if an interconnection can be made b gate valves shall be installed wherever the city engineer or utility representative deems them necessary in order that sectionalizing of the water system can be accomplished in the event of repairs or tieins c standard minimum size of eight inches is required for new development smaller than eight inches may only be used if approved by the city engineer d water mains and services shall be so installed at seven feet of cover depth below final finished grade to insure no freezing shall occur during the coldest weather experienced by this community e before final acceptance of the installed system by the city sufficient evidence shall be presented to the city that the system has passed the state required bacteriological test the state requirements for pressure and leakage tests and the city requirements for electrical continuity testing the developer shall not be relieved of responsibility for any water main or services installation before one full year from the date of acceptance f the developer shall furnish and install all necessary fire hydrants according to specifications established by the city engineer and the utility department g all fire hydrants shall be installed with respect to final grade operation and maintenance specifications shall be adhered to when fire hydrants are installed adjustments of hydrants due to final grade shall be the developers responsibility h the plan commission upon advice from the fire chief city engineer or the utility director may require the developer to install private fire hydrants where deemed necessary such private fire hydrants shall be maintained at the developers or land owners expense further such private fire hydrants shall be installed in compliance with all appropriate city specifications 3 storm water drainage a a storm water sewer or drainage system adequate to serve the area being platted shall be required when natural flowage of water from adjacent property passes development and it is desirable in the opinion of the city engineer and approved by the council to install a larger pipe than necessary for such development the excess cost shall be determined and assessed under in a developed area seventyfive 75 percent platted where a trunk storm sewer is constructed the cost shall be borne equitably by the entire drainage area as provided by this code b all storm sewers where required shall be designed by the rational method unless otherwise agreed to by the city engineer c inlets shall be provided so that no surface water shall be carried across any intersection inlet spacing shall be determined by specifications outlined by the wisconsin department of transportation d if a pumping station is required to pump storm water the subdivider shall install at no expense to the city a pumping station and force main as recommended by the city engineer and approved by the city council and adequate to service the subdivision and shall deed such pumping station force main equipment and site to the city prior to acceptance of the final plat e when it is determined that storm water runoff from a subdivision may affect downstream drainage areas the city engineer shall study the effects of such drainage no subdivision shall be approved where the city engineer and the plan commission determine that downstream drainage problems may result because of any subdivision 4 electric underground electric utilities shall be required in all new developments unless determined to be impractical by the utility department insofar as possible lots closest to the sources of power water and sewer shall be developed first 072   13 6142016   construction plans and inspection required a approval copies of approvals and request for approval shall be in writing and attached to the final plat b construction plans whenever any improvements are required by the city construction plans for improvements to be installed shall be furnished in accordance with the specifications of the officials having jurisdiction and shall receive approval of these officials before improvements are installed the following plans may be required 1 the profile of each proposed street with tentative grades indicated 2 the cross section of each proposed street showing the width of pavement curb and gutter  the location and width of sidewalks and terraces  and the location and size of the utility mains 3 the plans and profiles of proposed sanitary sewers and storm water sewers with grades and sizes indicated or method of sewage or storm water disposal in lieu of sewers 4 any other plans or information whether enumerated herein or not may be required by the officials having jurisdiction c inspections prior to starting any of the work covered by the plans approved as above arrangements shall be made to provide for inspection by the city engineer of the work sufficient in the opinion of the engineer and council to ensure compliance with the plans and specifications as approved and written approval obtained from the city engineer and council to start the work all costs of such inspection by its engineer shall be borne by the city d contractors the subdivider is to engage his or her own contractors on his or her own responsibility for all required work subject to approval by the city engineer and other officials having jurisdiction 073   stage development in all instances where it appears to the satisfaction of the city council that the whole of the plat and its subdivision cannot immediately be fully improved with respect to the installation of all storm and sanitary sewers and related facilities water mains and related facilities and street improvements by reason of unavoidable delay in the acquisition of land necessary for such improvement or by reason of unavoidable delay in obtaining necessary engineering data and information or for any other good reason or cause the city council may in its sole discretion authorize the subdivider to proceed with the installation of improvements required under this title on a portion or part of the subdivision and in such event the requirements of this title shall apply to that portion or part thereof authorized for immediate improvement 074 dedications for parks and recreational areas recreation park or open areas a whenever a development is created or when a parcel of land is developed which involves any division of land by minor subdivision herein referred to as a certified survey map csm or subdivision eg a plat regardless of size the developer shall be required to dedicate for parks playgrounds and other open space purposes a parcel of land equal to ten 10 percent of the gross area of all property proposed for subdivision such parcel shall be shown and marked on the plat dedicated for park or recreation purposes this provision shall also apply to all outlots in existence or annexed to the city as of  b the council may require the lands dedicated for park playgrounds recreation and open space purposes be of a character size and location suitable for such use and purpose and may further require it to be relatively level and dry all such parcels shall be reviewed and recommended by the park and recreation board and the plan commission prior to council approval the formula for land dedication shall be as follows land dedication subdivision type 10% industrial commercial and office 10% 03 units per acre residential add 1% for each unit above 3 with a maximum cap of 20% c where a proposed park playground recreation or open space area is shown on the official map or master plan of the city to be located in whole or in part within the proposed development the council shall require the dedication of such area within the development if the official map or master plan provides for an area in excess of the required amount the council shall before it takes final action on the plat consider the official map or master plan and together with the appropriate boards determine if it should take the necessary steps to acquire all or part of the park playground recreation or open space area as shown on the official map or master plan d where with respect to a particular development the dedication of a parcel of land for parks playground recreation or open space purposes does not comply with the official map or the master plan  and as determined by the park board the plan commission and the council and the dedication of such parcel would not be in the public interest the city shall require a dedication fee as established in accordance with state statute 1 dedication fees shall be established fee needs assessments as implemented from time to time upon resolutions adopted by the common council 2 planned unit development with mixed land uses shall make cash payments andor land contributions in accordance with this section based upon the percentage of land devoted to the various uses 3 should the city determine that it is in the best interest of the city to require a land dedication that is less than that specified in b the fair market value of that dedication shall be determined at the time the final plat or certified survey is approved in accordance with the following a the city and developer may agree to the fair market value  or b the fair market value may be based on the current appraisal submitted to the city by the subdivider at the subdividers expense the appraisal shall be made by appraisers who are approved members of the sera or mai or equivalent real estate appraisal societies c if the city disputes such appraisal the city may at their own expense obtain an appraisal of the property by a qualified real estate appraiser said appraisal may be deemed conclusive evidence of fair market value of the land e if land dedication is not required or required in part the face of the final plat shall include a statement that park dedication fees are due and payable by the owner of each lot at the time of building permit issuance the statement will also include the percentage of dedication fee due if less than one hundred 100 percent     prior code  1809  12132011 special assessments for local improvements alternate method selected as provided in wis stats in addition to other methods provided by law special assessments for any public work and improvement may be levied by alternate methods the council elects to levy such special assessments as provided in this section amended during supplement #1  prior code  18111   preliminary resolution whenever the city council shall determine that any public work or improvement shall be financed in whole or in part by special assessments levied under this section it shall adopt a preliminary resolution setting forth the following a its intent to exercise its police powers for the purpose of levying special assessments for the stated municipal purpose  b the limits of the proposed assessment district  c the time either before or after completion of the work or improvement when the amount of such assessments shall be determined or levied  d the number of installments in which the special assessments may be paid or that the number of installments will be determined after the public hearing required by will be included in the final resolution e the rate of interest to be charged on the unpaid installments or that the rate of interest will be determined after the public hearing required by will be included in the final resolution f the terms on which any of such assessments may be deferred while no use of the improvement is made in connection with the property or that such terms will be determined after the public hearing required by will be included in the final resolution g the director of public workscity engineer shall prepare a report as required by 112   report of director of public workscity engineer whenever the city council by preliminary resolution directs the director of public workscity engineer to prepare a report the director of public workscity engineer shall prepare a report consisting of the following a preliminary or final plans and specifications for the public work  b an estimate of the entire cost of the proposed work or improvements except that when the city council determines by preliminary resolution that the
